description:
I'm not a big breakfast/brunch person but loved this place! 

Was looking through different places in the area for a light breakfast with a menu that's simple and not overly priced  and I found this gem. We were seated quickly at one of the few outside tables. Waiters were brief but very kind and smiling the entire time. 

My fiancé got the avocado toast 3 ways and was happy with his choice. It came with sunny side up egg, bacon and heirloom tomatoes. I got the bagel two ways and went with the first two options. You can choose two options from a group of 5 that was a good mix of savory and sweet options. 1 was cream cheese with blueberries, strawberries and honey drizzled on top (tasted as good as it sounds). Choice 2 was mayo with scrambled eggs and shredded cheese on top. Both our dishes came with fresh fruit cups that were actually filled with decent portions of perfectly ripe fruits including kiwi, raspberries, blackberries, pineapple, strawberries, blueberries, honey dew and cantaloupe. Latte was also perfectly done. Everyone around us had delicious looking dishes so I'm sure you can't go wrong with anything. 

We were very very happy with our breakfast! I usually leave brunches feeling greasy and overfilled but this was perfect. Highly recommend this place when in town. A great start to the day!
author: Nikkee A.

description:
This place had the best breakfast in the area for sure. 

We went there before work and it didn't disappoint. There was a very short line, which is usually a good sign. It is a unassuming little breakfast place but clean. The staff was courteous and attentive.

I got the French toast with caramelized bananas and caramel sauce and my coworker had the banana waffle. They were absolutely amazing. It wasn't your basic French toast and you could totally tell that they took some extra steps to make it a special experience. It was honestly one of the best breakfast I've had in a long time.

My only complaint was the coffee was subpar. And it wasn't cheap either, if I'm going to pay that kind of price for coffee I would expect it to be good. There are so many great coffee shops in the area you would think that they would be able to at least have one of the shops make them their coffee.

All I know is I would absolutely come back here again.
author: Adam H.

description:
This is a cute little brunch place that I would like to visit once in a while. Food is both aesthetically pleasing and delicious. We got their Green Tea Chia Seed pudding, OJ, and the Castro Omelet. Their is Service is brisk, although they did messed up my order once (got the regular pudding instead of the green tea one, later fixed). 

About their climate control -  the other comments are right, it's warm inside. I was in a cozy wool dress, not to the point that I'm sweating all over but my palms did get sweaty.

Wait was good for a Sunday brunch (11:45am). Our party of 2 got in after 5 min wait - the other parties on the waitlist weren't here when their names were called.
author: Jessie L.

description:
I haven't done brunch in a while and this spot popped up on Yelp. My friend and I decided to give it a try! We got to the place around 1130am on a Sunday and there was surprisingly no line! We were seated immediately and the staff was nice and friendly. 

After looking at the menu, we decided to get avocado toast 3 ways (bacon, egg, tomato toppings), the soy vanilla chia seed pudding, and the bagel plate (one with avocado, ham, and egg, another with peanut butter, apples, and bacon). I really appreciate how all their dishes come with a side of fruit salad, normally we'd be paying extra for this somewhere else. 

Our food came out pretty quickly. The avocado toasts and the bagels were just okay tbh - they were good, but nothing memorable. The avocado toast with bacon and the peanut butter bagel with bacon and apples were my favorites of the sets. The chia seed pudding was my favorite out of everything we ordered though - everything was layered perfectly! 

On another note, the bathroom was clean! And their playlist was on point!
author: Stacey Y.

description:
Just had breakfast at this cute little restaurant.   Based in San Francisco,  Eight AM is a small place that is busy if you do not go early.  We arrived at 9 am and we had to wait about 30 minutes.  The restaurant has no air conditioning so opt to sit outside if you are a small party.  I only tried one thing since I was by myself but that one thing could've fed two people.  The service is good, they get busy so be patient.  Here is what I had:

Fresh squeezed orange juice

Avocado toast 3 ways with fresh fruit:

Avocado toast with fried egg: toasted multigrain bread topped with mashed avocado and a fried egg

Avocado toast with heirloom tomato: toasted sweet baguette topped with mashed avocado and a large slice of heirloom tomato.  Add a little lemon and salt, it tastes amazing

Avocado toast with bacon: toasted sourdough bread with crispy fried bacon

All these were amazing and the avocado was super fresh.  I could barely finish the fruit which   had the perfect sweetness and tanginess to it.

I will definitely come back to try the other things and i would recommend this place to you too.  Just be sure to come early, also larger parties like 5 or more tend to wait longer since it is a small establishment.
author: Cecilia D.

description:
Me and my friend came in for brunch on a Sunday and there was no wait! What?! No wait for brunch on a Sunday?? 

Anyways, we got seated and the waiters are super nice! They asked if we wanted anything to drink and we got a coffee and waters. We ended up ordering the Avocado Toast Three Ways, Soy Vanilla Chia Seed Pudding, and Bagel Fix-Ups( there are six ways they can prepare the bagel and you can choose two, we ended up getting number 3, a ham, egg, and avocado bagel and number 6, a peanut butter, bacon, and apple bagel topped with maple syrup). 

The food came out pretty quickly and everything was really good. The avocado toast and bagels tasted like you think they would, and the Chia Seed Pudding was a nice light option. The toast and bagels also came with a side of fruit salad! 

Even though nothing stood out, this is a nice spot to get your breakfast/lunch and start your day! If I am ever in the area and want a casual breakfast, I would come back and try their crepes and frittatas!
author: Michael L.

description:
Swung by around opening time after working a night shift. The menu had alot of options that looked tasty and I went with the banana nut waffle after being torn between that and the banana french toast. I randomly recieved a mixed berry waffle instead but I also like berries and im not one to waste food so I rolled with it. 

Presentation was nice and taste was good but pretty standard. Atmosphere was meh teenage staff standing around chatting loud and its 7am on a sunday with mostly elderly customers and they were playing a mumble rap song where the dudes talking about pussy lol.
author: Sean G.

description:
Where were you in the morning baby?
You didn't leave your number for me
Left me without a warning baby
Where were you in the morning...... (maybe heading the Eight AM to beat the morning rush)

For you Shawn Mendes fans....

Well one early morning Rod left his bed at his usual early time and made the trek to Eight AM to try their:

Avocado Toast 3 ways & Fresh Fruit Salad $13 

I thought it was good but not great. One had an egg on top, the other a tomato I believe and the other had bacon. I thought the fresh fruit salad was good as well and had a good mix of fresh fruits. 

The service was also very good and the food came out fast. 

So why the 3 star rating you might ask? I just don't think given my rubric below that I would select this place clearly above and beyond some other breakfast competitors nearby.  May sound a little harsh but I did like this place and I try to be consistent with my reviews.  For example a 3 star from me might be a 4 star from someone else. 

Rod's Review grading scale explained. Essentially I personally base it on the likelihood of a return visit and I try to be stingy with 5 star reviews since they should be "special" in my eyes. Price/Value also play a role obviously but there are $ and $$$$ littered across my grading scale. 

5 stars - "I'll go out of my way" (approx 6 % of my reviews)  4 stars- "If I was in the area I'd go here and would recommend", (approx 38% of my reviews)  3 stars "Maybe if was nearby", (approx 37% of my reviews) 2 stars -"Would likely not return, Only if you want to go", (approx 16% of my reviews)  1 star -"No thanks, even if I was hungry", (approx. 3 % of my reviews)

Follow my profile for reviews all across the SF Bay Area
author: Rod M.

description: Someone please explain to me what all the hype about this place is? We came here for breakfast and had avocado toast... that wasn't even that good. We waited in line for about 30 minutes on the weekend and then when we got our food it was so bland. I ate one of the toast and was over it. The fruit served on the side was also not great. It was too ripe and a little brown. Save your time.
author: Denise C.

description:
What a fantastic place for brunch! Love the name Eight AM as well!
Everything we had was excellent.
Would definitely recommend the avocado toast. For once, I felt it was reasonably priced ($15 for 3 different ones! As opposed to places in NY that give you one piece for over $15...)
3 different kinds of bread and 3 different toppings (egg over easy, bacon, and a giant tomato). Crunchy and satisfying. The accompanied fruit cup was also sizable and so fresh. Yummm
Also would DEFINITELY recommend the French toast with berries compote. The 3 of us actually all got our own savory dishes, and then split the French toast which was MOUTHWATERING. Photo speaks for itself...
Really a fan of this place. The service was friendly and attentive. We were able to sit outside. Food came out in a timely manner, and our water and coffee cups were always filled. TRY IT!
author: Mala L.

description:
A secret treasure for tourists... the local know where to go. Grest and healthy breakfast. 

Nice staff but come early not to have to wait in line a long time as the quay is building up fast
author: Michael H.

description: A great place for breakfast. I had the Fresh Berries Waffle with some bananas added. It was delicious. The coffee was good and bottomless.  The staff was very friendly and attentive. Price was very reasonable. I'll be coming back for sure.
author: Mark G.

description:
Nice place. Nice staff, well prepared food.
Nothing mind blowing...but simple, nicely made meals.
Even if there's a wait, they move people in and out pretty quickly- so be patient! Put your name on the list when you walk up.
Enjoy!
author: Ramona P.

description: Wow!! Ate here day we arrived in San Fran. I dreamed about the heirloom tomato last night, it was a dream come true. The avocado tasted like sunshine. My sister recommended the avocado 3 ways and I'm so happy she did. She had a bagel with Nutella/banana/rice crispies and the other had PB/maple syrup/bacon/apple. Of course I try everything on the table no matter who's at my table. Did I mention the fresh fruit and fresh squeezed OJ? A++
author: Monica L.

description:
A great breakfast experience that must be had. A small unassuming restaurant that gets it right has earned their fabulous reputation.  
I would recommend getting there before 8am to avoid the line. 
The menu selections are delectable. I had the frittata with Black Forest ham and cheddar cheese. The eggs were light and fluffy, accompanied with chunks of very tasty Black Forest ham and sharp cheddar cheese. The fruit salad was an impressive combination of fruits and berries, all very fresh. 
Kudos for getting it right every time!
author: Stephen D.

description:
It's eight a.m., I'm in San Francisco and I needed something deliciously nutritious to start my day.  Where to go? Well, I checked the Yelp app and figured Eight AM was a good a spot as any to try.  Turns out, I made a good choice.

This place looks small from outside, but once inside, you'll see there's a decent amount of indoor seating, though most of it is down a long corridor. The wait staff are all super friendly and accommodating. 

For breakfast, I went with the avocado toast, three ways: avocado toast topped with bacon, avocado toast topped with an egg and avocado toast topped with tomato.  The avocado is provided as a spread, as opposed to whole avocado (which I didn't mind at all, and actually preferred).  My favorite bites of avocado toast, by far, were the ones I popped my sunny side up egg over, and allowed yolk to soak into. Yum!

I didn't realize how much food this would be until after devouring half of it. It was so filling, I took the side of fresh fruit (mixture of fresh berries, bananas and kiwi) to go with me.

Free refills on coffee was a major plus for me (because I can never have just one cup).
author: Rafael A.

description: We tried the avocado Trio was good. Then the  crepe and banana crepe  was very good. The service can be better, rushed and not personal. Try coffee is good.  The prices bit higher than it should be, but not too bad. The ambiance  is average. Overall good experience but nothing exceptional
author: J S.

description:
Loved this little place.   Got there in the nick of time before it started getting really busy.  I think we arrived at about 8:40 AM - 9am maybe.  Everyone that was providing service there was so nice and so accommodating. Anyone that passed our table would check in on us (not just 1 waiter
to help us, which was nice). The food was great, the coffee was good.  We will definitely be back here. I had the French Toast with caramelized bananas and it was the lightest, fluffiest most amazing French toast I've ever had. My husband had the crêpe with ham and cheese and it didn't look that appetizing but it was delicious. We shared both items and enjoyed very much!
author: Rachael C.

description: Place is an upgraded IHOP. Huge quantities low quality. Not sure why the high reviews.
author: Katya B.

description:
Safe, tasty choice. 

While walking around in San Francisco we stumbled upon Eight AM.  At first you will find a cozy atmosphere, with options to sit both inside and outside.  Just be aware that this place is quite popular, so you might have to wait a little. 

But the most important part of the experience at Eight AM is the food.  The restaurant offers options for everyone, ranging from vegan to bacon lovers. Each of the dishes that we tried were generous in size, and tasty (I would not call any of the dishes life changing, but good enough to put a smile on your face). 

Overall, if you are in San Francisco, and want a good and filling breakfast, Eight AM is a great option.  


My Criteria
5 stars: The best food I have ever had, or an excellent option given the price.
4 stars: Good food, a restaurant I look forward to trying again. 
3 stars: Good food, a restaurant that I am indifferent to. 
2 stars: Below average experience, will not go again.
1 stars: This restaurant should be closed.
author: Daniel D.

description: Small. Decent food. Limited options. My husband and I enjoyed the food, my little wasn't as thrilled. The avocado toast was delicious.
author: Melissa M.

description:
Food was fresh & good quality. Service was excellent & service with a smile. Makes a big difference.

I had Dungeness omelette, loved it. They do  a Avocado toast combo, looked fabulous.. next time.
author: Ankesh K.

description: I expected a cute little cafe, but this place looked more like a diner. We put our name down anyway and waited maybe 15 minutes. I had the French toast and it was actually pretty good. The staff were efficient and attentive. Parking can be challenging, but if you can find parking, the restaurant is only a short walk to the Wharf.
author: Mallory L.

description:
I really enjoyed brunch here. They don't take reservations so we just walked in. Our wait was about 10 minutes which was pretty short considering the restaurant isn't that large. The waiters were really fast and always on it! 

I had the 'avocado toast three ways' which I really enjoyed. I thought it was a lot of food but I ate it all! I wasn't going to waste that fresh avocado haha! The fruit bowl was also really tasty! My friend ordered the Russian Hill Frittata and when it came, we realized it had cheese on it. He'd forgotten to tell them he was lactose intolerant but they were nice enough to make him another. Although they didn't look too happy about it, I appreciate that they made him another. 

I definitely recommend here!
author: Adaeze E.

description:
This place was packed but it was well worth the wait. I ordered the avocado toasts (x3). My only complaint, which is minor, is I wasn't able to order one or two toasts. Had to be three. I digress, they were all delicious...was just too much and it's always a sad thing to leave behind good food.

Since there was a bit of confusion, there was no designated host/hostess. You write your name for the wait list. A couple families were confused so in case this is a regular occurrence, I figured it was worth noting.
author: Kristin C.

description:
I feel really mixed about this restaurant. There were some things I loved and others I wasn't impressed with.

Pros:
Really great fruit cup with berries in it, not just grapes and cantaloupe.
Nice service.
Healthier food offerings than many breakfast places.
Fairly good food when seasoning was added.
Fresh foods which were generously portioned.

Cons:
Put receipt paper directly on my food (receipt paper often has toxic chemicals in it).
Served under cooked eggs on the avo toast where the whites weren't set.
Everything lacked seasoning at different cooking intervals.
Mealy potatoes which were under cooked and lukecool in spots.
Not given any drinks or menus for well over 10 minutes after being seated.

We ordered the Avocado Toasts and a Frittata plate. Both came with a fruit cup and my frittata came with a side of country style potatoes which had bell peppers and onions in them. Everything on my plate lacked seasoning, aside from the fruit cup. My husband's avocado toast had an egg on it where the whites weren't set. He didn't have a problem with it but I'd have had to send that back if it was mine.

The cooks choose to put the paper that the waiters take your order on beneath the food. They could have chosen to put it under the plate or under the fruit bowl but for whatever reason stuck it under my frittata directly. Thermal and pressure sensitive paper often has toxic chemicals including BPA so I wasn't pleased to see that at all. 

My frittata needed seasoning mixed into the egg mixture. Salting and peppering the top wasn't really "enough" to make the seasoning penetrate the food. The potatoes also lacked seasoning and were oddly mealy. I don't quite know how they got the potatoes to have a mealy texture while they were also somewhat undercooked and firm to the bite. I enjoyed that they had peppers and onions but I really would have enjoyed them more if they had some seasoning added.

My husband enjoyed his avocado toasts while I thought they were mildly bland. I use a lot of herbs and spices in my cooking so my palate is definitely accustomed to more flavor. To others I'm sure the simple flavors are appealing in their own right. 

The latte we ordered came without vanilla. The gentleman taking our order must not have heard that part but he kindly brought a side of it and didn't seem to charge us. That's the type of customer service I appreciate. 

Side note: While we were waiting a, presumably homeless, fellow was trying to give himself some salt from one of the tables and a server came out and spoke to him with dignity and asked him to please stop because the server was offering him a "side" of salt. I really appreciated that. Treating other humans with dignity regardless of their circumstances is very heartwarming. 

This place has a lot of potential so I hope it continues to do well. There was always a small wait for tables from the time we arrived to wrapping up so I feel confident they will last a long time in the area.
author: Nika T.

description:
Great brunch place near Fisherman's Wharf. Their music selection was awesome: Hiphop/R&B from the early 2000's (nostalgic much) and some EDM classics. Such fun vibes! 

The restaurant has about 10 tables, including some that are outdoors. I don't believe they take reservations. We came on a Thursday morning, no wait but there was definitely people there. I could imagine it being lots busier on weekends! 

There were so many items on the menu that looked so fun and delicious. I finally opted for the 6AM crepe which is made with black forest ham, eggs, and swiss cheese. It was so filling, I couldn't finish it. My boyfriend got bacon, sausage, eggs, their house potatoes and a bowl of assorted fruits. The bacon was thick cut and the sausages were tasty. I felt ambivalent about the potatoes but my boyfriend liked them! The fruits were perfect to munch on after we finished our entrees. Super refreshing on a sunny morning!
author: Jessica C.

description:
We were staying less than a block away and when this popped up on Yelp as a breakfast option, I looked through the menu and everything looked great.

We headed over shortly after they opened and were seated immediately. They were already quite busy. First impression - every single server was SUPER polite. Not pretentious and awkward polite just downright good manners type of polite. 

The menu was extremely hard to choose between because everything sounded perfect!

Luckily, the wife and I were both pretty hungry so we opted for a breakfast item each and then one to share. We got the soy vanilla chia pudding with fresh fruit and berries to begin with. It was delivered promptly and again, with superb manners! The almond milk latte I ordered was also perfect.

For my entree I opted for the bagel 2 ways - one half was an avocado on the bagel with a slice ham and a sunny side up egg. The other half was Nutella, bananas and rice krispies. The rice krispies on top were a nice crunch on the sweet one. The savory half had perfect a egg yolk porn moment (think Instagram worthy yolk!).

We kept going back in for bites of the chia pudding until the jar was licked clean. The plates were completely clean from each of our entrees also. My meal came with a fruit cup so I wound up leaving with a to go plastic container of extra fruit. 

Overall, not only was the food spot on, but the customer service was some of the best i've ever had. Our water was never empty. Everything that was dropped off to us was done with a smile and politeness. I was super impressed and made sure they knew how grateful I was for the spot on customer service.

I will make it a point to head back here for breakfast whenever possible.
author: Sabrina B.

description:
Eight AM is a cute and creative restaurant that J had my eyes on when we visited San Fran. We entered and it was a little packed but luckily were able to get seats outside on a beautiful day. If you want to eat inside and are a big group, I suggest you go earlier. The food here all looked delicious and the one I got was! I recommend coming here for breakfast if you are in San Fran!
Loved the
1PM
Bagel fix ups #6 & #1
author: Adianez F.

description: The trick here is to write your name on the clipboard list as soon as you arrive. They call names off that list. Incredibly fresh, delicious and many unique offerings. The service is slow but very helpful and accommodating. The orange juice is fresh squeezed. My hubbie's crèpe was terrific with tons of filling. He had the 9am crèpe with ham, gruyere and scrambled eggs. I splurged and am so glad I did. I loved the blueberry shortcake which was a toasted croissant filled with tons of fresh blueberries and vanilla pudding. It was served with a wonderful big cup of really fresh fruit. Enjoy!!!
author: Daria S.

description:
Trendy hole-in-the-wall type spot we found as #1 on trip advisor. Great service! We were greeted & seated immediately at walk in. We chose to sit outside since it was super hot inside. The view outside is fresh and pleasant anyway! Iced tea & fresh squeezed orange/grapefruit drink were great.

My food
Soy Milk Vanilla chia seed pudding w/ almonds & fruit

His food
Avocado toast 3 ways

4 stars because the bathroom was a little gross.
author: Christine S.

description:
I like this place because they are very efficient, friendly, and they have generous portions. That, plus the fact that the food is tasty and well prepared, makes this place a bookmark for whenever in the area.

We did have our 1 year old, and although the space can be a bit reduced, they managed to accommodate us all. They also had fruit and easy food for our kid. (3 way avocado, which my wife did not enjoy)

So, I could rate this a 3, but it is closer to 4 in all honesty.
author: Daniel A.

description: Excellent breakfast restaurant.  Great fruit options with a nice view menu.  Nice service, promptly served, refilled coffee, etc.
author: M K.

description:
Great location right near the Courtyard Marriott on Beach Street. We walked over at 8am and learned they actually open at 7am. It is a small place with probably 15 tables in total. Very clean sleek look inside with very sweet men who hustle and help each other with tables. Eight am is has fresh ingredients and the menu has great choices that have something for everyone. We had the Avocado Toast, which comes in three ways (you get all three). It was delicious and came with a large cup of fruit. There was a lot of bread, but you don't have to eat it all. 

It is on the pricey side, but it is San Francisco so it was expected.
author: Kaitlyn M.

description:
So they say the restaurant with the longest line out the door is the one you want to eat at...right? 

Walking along the street; this hidden gem is hidden among other cafe's and eateries so it can be easy to miss...unless you notice the long line out the tiny front door. 

This place is TINY and I mean TINY, not sure how they fit everything in there but they do. 

The menu is not overwhelming; basic items and not much but hopefully can cater to everyone's appetite. 
The pricing is a tad much but what do you expect? It is San Francisco. 
For example; I ordered an egg white frittata....$18! Keep in mind the portions are small and to the point. 

This place is not one that gives LARGE servings enough to share between 2 people. It is enough for 1 person and that's that. 
However the Avocado toast 3 ways....literally is 3 ways so you get 3 slices of toast therefore that one could be shared depending on how hungry you are!

The wait was around 45 minutes for a table of 4. All of the tables are either 2-tops or 4-tops. I suppose they could push together tables to seat a party more than 4 but then that would just be taking up the entire restaurant to be honest. (It is SMALL in here).

There is 1 restroom, so that can be a wait.

Overall; the service was mediocre while the staff was very friendly.
Our food was not brought out all together (Pet Peeve!) My food came out 10 minutes after everyone. 
They were out of a few menu items at around 12:00 pm...bummer. 
They will automatically add gratuity for any party of 4 or more. (18%) Does not matter if your service sucked or not.
It is pricey. 
Menu is not large; choices are limited.
author: Sara-Marie F.

description:
If you love bagels this a place to try! The bagels are a wonderful size and gives you multiple ways to have your bagel. Bagels combo #1 for a sweet and fruity taste and #3 for a classic breakfast egg and some yummy avocado.
There is also outside seating to bring your four legged friend. Would recommend if you are in the SF area.
author: Melissa M.

description: Loved the latte. Had a scramble and chicken apple sausage. All delicious. Best part of the meal? The fruit bowl! So fresh and yummy.
author: Christen D.

description: I enjoyed Eight AM, sort of.  We arrived and the place was 75% full.  We asked to sit by the window and were told that he had to leave it open for larger parties.... ok... there were 3 other four-tops and lunch was winding down but ... whatever.  The coffee was fine with little pods of cream and regular sugar.  Our items arrived and the 3 avocado toasts looked beautiful.  The egg was totally cold by the time I took a bite, so that was a bummer, but they were interesting, tasty and fresh.  My friends ordered a scramble and asked for a side of sour cream...   sorry we don't have any.  I would have loved a fresh cracked pepper or sea sat on my dish, but alas, only a old little salt and pepper shaker.  So, while good, it would have been much better with a few little condiment type items.  Not overly friendly or upbeat service.  Very dirty bathroom which always makes me nervous.  So all in all...  meh.
author: Noelle L.

description: Mmmm...it's been a while since I've had delicious French toast and the caramelized banana French toast totally hit the spot and more.  And the soy vanilla chia seed pudding was tasty.  Totally going back!
author: Julie P.

description:
We walked in from the cool morning breeze, looking about for an experience to seize. 

Inside and out was readily available seating, though in the cozy building such quantities were fleeting. Our table consisted of two chairs and the corner booth: perfect arrangements to contain my son's excited youth. The food came quick and hot, nothing was astray of the lot. Every morsel was  delicious, but I should have prefaced, it tasted indistinguishable from any other American breakfast.
author: Mike A.

description: It's called "eight" am but its more like 11am right now. I don't do breakfast much. Decent spot, got the two way bagel with sunny egg over avocado and then cream cheese with the berries and honey on the side. My only complaint and it's significant is they don't bother using real Jewish style bagels (which are boiled if you don't know what that means) and is how they are supposed to be made because well, their bagels are JEWISH. A bit over priced for what it is but they do make the food look fantastic for pics and offer quite a few healthier and lighter items. Located in Russian Hill so my suggestion is to take an Lyft or bus it as parking is scarce.
author: Petra S.

description:
The three way avocado toast is a simple and healthy option. It is pretty basic, avocado, bread, and one other ingredient (egg, tomato or meat). Tasted similar to what I make at home except mine has seasoning and flavor. The cappuccino tasted alright, however the barista wasn't skilled with making designs. 
Also ordered one of the frittatas. The potatoes were tasty but the eggs were rubbery. My favorite part were the bowls of fruit that came with all the dishes. 
Overall, I wasn't too impressed with the food, but the service was great. My friend however really liked this place. Different strokes for different folks. Also we didn't have to wait to be seated which is always a plus.
author: Tina J.

description: Found Eight AM thanks to Yelp as a place to take my best friend for brunch before going back to the east coast. Parking can be a bit of a pain in the butt but then again its SF so what can you really expect. My friend ordered the avocado toast 3 ways and her favorite of them all was the one with the heirloom tomatoes on it. I myself got the french toast and the glazed bananas really added an extra bang to it. It's relatively smallish in size inside but I liked it because I could see my food being made from where I was sitting and I really do enjoy watching food being made and then the deliciousness being brought out to me. I would suggest this place to anyone looking for a good spot to eat.
author: Yochabel U.

description: So good and worth the wait! My sister and i had a great experience. I got the banana crepe and YUM! Tasted so fresh and like a dessert rather then a breakfast item. Highly recommend
author: Brieann B.

description: Great service here. Waitress was attentive. Everyone was smiling. The food is great. Big portions which makes it worth the price.
author: Elyse K.

description: Great place to grab a big breakfast in the Fisherman's Wharf area. Very easy to over-order given the large portions - that's not a complaint!  Had the frittatas which came with a significant amount of fresh fruit and great potatoes.  Restaurant is smallish which adds to its charm, but if you're not here by its titular time you may have to wait.
author: Jeff F.

description: We went for brunch on a Saturday and there was a line but it went by fast which was awesome. Food was very good, large portions enough to share. I did notice that there were many fruit flies and the place was kinda of dirty especially the bathroom. Not sure if I would come back because of the dirty feeling I got.
author: Pau Y Monica C.

description: Im gonna try to make this quick aight. The servers were nice, the waffle I ate was bomb, and they had the most poppin playlist I've ever heard in any food establishment. The waffle was also bigger than my head and covered with fruit so ya boy was easily full after his meal. Pull up
author: Young J.

description:
Cyndy's Bottom Line:  Fast and delicious hearty breakfast.

We stopped in to have a hearty breakfast before flying.

*Service prompt and friendly
*Steady flow of coffee refills
*Good assortment of breakfast items

This is what we ate:
*Avocado toast three ways - avocado on 3 different type of toast with on topped with an heirloom tomato, crispy bacon and a easy over egg. It also comes with a bowl of fresh fruit too.
~The heirloom tomato so fresh and delicious, and the egg well seasoned.

*Waffles with berries - topped with an assortment of berries.
The waffle was very good so light and airy.
author: Cyndy K.

description:
This is one of my favorite breakfast spots in San Francisco. When we are in town, we have to come here at least a couple of times. I usually order the Avocado Toast 3 ways and it is pretty amazing! My husband's favorite is the Fisherman's Wharf frittata, they are very generous with the chunks of dungenous crab meat. Both meals are served with a bowl of fresh fruit which is a nice generous touch. They offer fresh squeezed Orange juice which is very pulpy and has the prefect amount of sweetness. 

There is usually a line so be sure to sign in inside before preceding to the end of the line. Don't be discouraged if the line is long because it moves relatively fast and the food is worth the wait.
author: Valerie R.

description:
Good price and large portions!

My friend and I came here on a weekday for brunch. The wait time was about 15 minutes. The staffs were really friendly. Service was great! We ordered the avocado toast 3-way and a fritata. The avocado toasts tasted exactly what u would expect. The fritata was a little bland but not bad.
author: Yun Chi C.

description: Wow - the best waffle I have ever had!!!   The latte was good too.  The service was fast and friendly!   Fair prices too!
author: Dee B.

description: If you're a tourist you'll love this place: portions are big, service is speedy, and prices are relatively low for SF. If you're a local, don't waste your time. The food tastes like it's been frozen, it's definitely not fresh, and the flavors are meh. I'll rather pay a little more and eat at MyMy or Plow.
author: Dani P.

description:
Solid neighborhood place (very close to Fisherman's Wharf) for breakfast/brunch with very kind service. No frills or thrills but you get someone to prepare a decent meal without any fuss. 

I ordered the avocado toast three ways (fried egg, bacon, and heirloom tomato) and fruit salad. The bread itself was nice and toasted and they used two different types of breads. I'm really glad they didn't use just plain sandwich bread so that was good. Egg was fried sunny side up, two slices of crunchy bacon and a juicy heirloom tomato accompanied the avocado toast. It didn't seem like they seasoned anything so I added some salt and pepper which went a long way. Between the three slices of toast (yay carbs) and fruit it was a filling meal. My boyfriend had the bagel fix-ups (half with nutella, banana, rice crispies and the other with peanut butter, bacon, apple) and fruit salad. He really liked it. 

For a filling meal that's quick and easy and relatively low cost for SF I definitely recommend Eight AM.
author: Debi N.

description:
Good food! You have your choice of healthy or sweet and savory. Either expect fresh food that is very presentable.


We had the chia seed smoothly and it was refreshing and very healthy. It was topped with crush fruit and almonds.

The Belgian waffle with bananas and walnuts was fluffy and very soft. The whip cream went well with the walnuts and banana.

This was a perfect spot. The price was a little high but the food was fresh and the flavors we're on point.
author: Komatsu O.

description:
Visited here on a Sunday noon because our initial choice Surisan had an hour wait and this turned out to be a wonderful alternative.

The ambiance is like a American diner - loud and not the feel of your typical sf hip cafe. However, the food quality and portion are excellent for the price. 

Matcha soy milk chia pudding (5 stars) was not overly sweet and generously filled with fruits with a strong matcha flavor. Chicken and spinach crepe (5 stars) was very flavorful with lots of chicken filling - prob our favorite. The only below average dish was the avocado toasts (3 stars) which were somewhat flavorless with tomato, egg and bacon each individually. 

TLDR: Excellent value for great brunch food quality and portion but may not have the best ambiance.
author: Nancy Z.

description: Excellent service and the food was delicious! We waited a few minutes to be seated, but it was definitely worth it. Outdoor seating was available as the weather was perfect. Service was fast and friendly! Enjoyed our breakfast here!
author: Shirlene U.

description:
We were able to grab a seat this morning right away and were greeted immediately with a nice, hot cup of coffee. 

I ordered the Avocado Toast Three Ways. The only change I requested was for the peice of toast with the egg to be cooked over hard vs over easy. The egg I received was somewhere in the middle, but the dish as a whole was delicious. It was too much food to finish, but the avocado mash and the fruit were extremely fresh.

My SO ordered the Berry Waffle and he devoured it.

There's nothing too inventive here but sometimes you just need some simple, honest flavors to warm your bones. The service was wonderful and I'm glad we got a chance to try this spot while in town.
author: Naomi H.

description: So good! Had the Castro frittata and it was super flavorful and filling. Also tried the avocado toast 3 ways -- bacon was super crispy, perfect with the avocado and sourdough toast. Overall would highly recommend! I would also try Joanie's two doors down if either place gets busy.
author: Marina C.

description: I had this place bookmarked for a long time. Tried going 3 times before but failed to get a seat. There's always a looong wait (its a very popular place apparently) and they don't take reservations unfortunately. I got lucky last weekend and managed to get in (everyone must've been at the pride parade lol). I got the Avocado Toast 3 ways. My friends got the Banana nut waffle and Fresh berry waffle. All 3 dishes are beautifully presented and delicious. Definitely lived up to my expectations. Saving this as a fav brunch spot :)
author: Lasya B.

description:
The seating was pretty fast even though it was busy. We requested to be sat outside, and quickly found a table outside as per our request.

Food was average, something that could have been made at home, but as seeing that we were away from home, it was fine.


Price is fair, but I however no refill on drink except coffee and water.


We loved the side of fruit for each plate.

I would visit this place again. Nice experience for first timer in San Francisco.
author: Isaias P.

description: Many breakfast options that had my mouth watering. Got the avocado toast dish that came with fruit on the side. Half way through my fruit, I realized the berries were super moldy and not sure how many I put down already (I turned a bit green). The server took away the dish and came back with 5 new berries that were still a bit moldy with fuzziness. So I wasn't too impressed with their customer service or quality control. However, I'd still like to come back and try other dishes on the menu... the toast was great. Only had a berry problem.
author: J Y.

description: Decided to come have Sunday breakfast here after seeing San Fran doesn't have a lot of options. It was a small wait for a table for 2, however, this place is a bit larger than most places in the city. We sat outside which was nice as the inside was a bit warm. Food was amazing, had the berries waffle, which got the table next to us even asking to snap a pic due to its amazing presentation. Food was great and service was quick. Must go if you're looking for some regular breakfast food.
author: Manuel S.

description: This place is amazing! What I love most about this place is that they have a good amount of seating (compared to all the other places I've been to). We came in on a busy Saturday during brunch time and only had to wait about 10 minutes or so to get a table which was definitely a big plus. After being seated our server gave us the menu and brought us some water. I ordered the waffle with fresh berries and cream with a hazelnut latte. The food came out fairly quick and was beyond delicious! The berries on top of the waffle we're so fresh and the cream mixed it in with it all took It to a whole new level! The sweetness of the cream and the tanginess of the fruits was a terrific combo! Highly recommended!
author: Nargis A.

description: The wait wasn't too bad on a Sunday morning. The food was great! And servers were friendly and helpful! It was too warm inside the restaurant, which is why I didn't give it 5 stars.
author: Sarah D.

description: This place was insanely good. I like the location as it is walking distance to a lot of tourist things in SF. I go the waffle and batter was insane. Just so delicious and all the fruit was extremely fresh. There is a wait so I would recommend getting there early, but it is worth the wait. The coffee there was one of my favorites and I'm more of a coffee shop person. Overall, great experience and you don't feel rushed!
author: Andriana A.

description: Casual place for breakfast by the touristy area but the service was impeccable. I've never felt so welcomed! Their dishes were huge and delicious! Do get their matcha latte! It is larger than life and amazing.
author: Annette L.

description:
We were staying a block
South of this cafe and popped in for brunch. Even though it was a Saturday morning, we were sat within 5 min. I ordered oj which was totally fresh squeezed.  I also had the strawberry cream cheese crepes. It was beautifully plated, fresh sweet strawberries, and fresh whipped cream. My husband ordered eggs, sausage, potatoes, with fruit salad.  I felt like the food was worth the price- especially for SF. So much food!
author: Tara M.

description: Pacific Heights Frittata! w/ fresh fruit & potatoes! Yum! Potatoes didnt have much flavor - but hey, they're potatoes soooo...service was slow but they checked in a couple times. It was brunch sunday so it's what I expected. But they double charged for coffee refills (by accident) and took one million years to get back to us with the checks.
author: Angelica S.

description: I feel like this place is super over rated. There is a seriously long line every time, but a majority of the food is extremely basic and can easily be made at home. Today I got the 11AM crepe and it was good, but the crepe itself was flaky and crispy and not at all how a crepe should be. Because of that, it was hard to eat and very messy.
author: Emily G.

description: Quick, courteous service and such favorable meals...would recommend. I had the banana French toast.
author: Leesh P.

description: Food was tasty. Service was excellent.  Had a savory crepe and he had the frittata.  Bith very good.  But the gnats flying around though.
author: Gia P.

description: I reviewed this place and gave a one star in the past. I recently went there and had a good experience.the avocado toasts are great and you can choose three different toppings or three same toppings.
author: Omid A.

description: The service was great, however the food wasn't. Think of the American supermarkets where the food just looks good and that's it.
author: Ramona W.

description:
The quality of dishes is high and everything tastes very fresh, though the choices are a bit limited. 

Place is not that big but we had a nice seat outside.    Service was fine, nothing extraordinary or bad either.

Sucks they don't serve any booze, what's brunch without a cocktail? 

I'd recommend if you're in the area but if not, I would pass.
author: Saminda W.

description: Just had a fantastic breakfast here with my wife. Highly recommend the avocado toast. Not only is the food delicious but the presentation is great!
author: Michael F.

description: The place is very casual and kind of hole in the wall. Staff was very friendly and attentive, got me what I wanted in a timely manner. I had the 3 way avocado toast and enjoyed it a lot. It's very filling, I was only able to eat 2 and then some of the fruit cup. Oh and the latte is HUGE!! I will totally come back :)
author: Zoe J.

description:
What a disappointment.

How this place has earned more stars and had a line waiting outside for mediocre food is puzzling.

When I spend $40 on breakfast I expect fresh, well seasoned fare.

To start, we ordered bottomless coffee and never were brought it. The server sat people next to us and brought them coffee before coming to check on us where we reminded him of our coffee. He brought it piping hot and then never came to refill or check us again.

N ordered the frittata which was boiling and  way too hot to eat. Then it hardened into an inedible hard egg.

The fruit cup gave you one strawberry, a 1/4 banana and a handful of blueberries but on top of unripe melon. So majority of the bowl was not edible.

My bagel was not fresh and was tough and chewy. Not very much avocado and not seasoned.  The egg was undercooked and the ham was like straight out of a prepackaged container not a deli.
author: Janna C.

description: Pretty good, basic food. The avocado toast was ok, just three slices of toast one with bacon, one with a tomato slice, the other with an over-easy egg. For $15 I would have expected something better, but it was a pretty big serving for toast. Wouldn't try it again but it wasn't bad.
author: Christina F.

description:
Easy walk from our hotel, cute and quaint, family owned. They are doing it right! I had the avocado toast 3 ways and it was huge...$15 (great deal for SF). Could have split it easily and still be full. My honey had a scramble which was also very generous, plus a nice side of fresh fruit. Bonus!

I would come back here again to try the other dishes, the bacon was excellent and the service was super attentive.
author: Rebecca A.

description:
This is a cute cafe type restaurant for amazing brunch.
The staff are probably the friendliest genuinely happiest people who I have ever been served by.
The menu has great choices on it, I went for three different types of avocado toast and added smoked salmon. It was very tasty one had avocado and fresh tomato one had bacon and avocado the other just avocado so simple but so tasty.
My partner had a skillet wow served piping hot and cooked perfectly.
Be aware there will be a Q to get in I think every day but they get through it fairly quickly. Unless you are a table of four of more I would suggest splitting.
author: Siobhan W.

description:
Brunch on a Sunday afternoon at Eight Am was satisfying. 

We ordered: 

- Avocado Toast Three Ways ($14) - it came with a bowl of fruits. Love the portion, a little too much for me, but I'm sure it's fine with others. 

- Bagel Fix Ups = two bagels and a bowl of fruits. Tasty!

If you get a chance to dine here, please do sit outside. It's hella hot and stuffy inside. Glad we sat by the window for some breeze. 

Overall, a great inexpensive place to get a quick brunch. I hope you give this place a try. Cheers!
author: Owie N.

description: We went here a few times because it was a short walk from our hotel. They had lots of breakfast options and combinations if you want something sweet or something with meat. Very quick service and nice organized line when there was a wait that accumulated outside
author: Connie A.

description: Needless to say my eyes were a bit bigger than my stomach. The bagel fix up is perfect for the indecisive eater. I got the 2 & 3 option which was a half of bagel with mayo, scrambled egg and cheddar on one and the other half a good helping of avocado, ham, and a fried egg in lieu of a sunny side up. The breakfast potatoes are good, but nothing to splurge on. Great endless cups of coffee. The fruit is so fresh and great for any parfait lover. The waffles are humongous! Definitely not for the faint of heart. The side of bacon is enough for two to share! Great place to stop in the morning before a day at the wharf!
author: TeddyRose A.

description:
Great breakfast spot! It's a small place so if it's busy it'll be worth the wait.

Hubby had the 8 am crêpe with the fruit. He thought is was tasty. His only regret is he didn't get the whip cream on it. So get the whip cream! 

I had the avocado toast 3 ways! Very good! The fruit that was served with it was fresh and tasty that my son practically ate all of it instead of me! 

So many other things on the menu that I'd go back again to try!
author: Christina R.

description: A simple friendly neighborhood breakfast spot that's popular among locals and tourists alike! I have waited as little as 15 minutes and as long as 45 minutes to eat here before. I don't mind the wait outside as it gives me time to look at what other are people are eating so I can decide what I want to order. I've tried the scramble and the bagels two ways, and it's all so good. They all come with huge sides of potatoes and/or fruit!
author: Alice L.

description: This place is soo overrated. The pictures make it seem as if the place is modern and chic but inside looks like a diner. It's an open kitchen so you can see all the cooks working without covering their hair (...). Food is definitely mediocre we had the frittatas, the eggs were overdone. 3 stars because the service is so nice and the fruit was delicious. Not worth the 30 minute wait though.
author: Emily A.

description: Worth the wait for delicious breakfast. I thought the menu was a bit limited at first but I was able to settle on something. The French toast is so sinfully delicious. The restaurant is small and if you sit in the back on the inside it gets a bit stuffy. But the way the entire staff works in all positions together is amazing to watch how they pull off efficiency!
author: Tai C.

description:
Breakfast served right not what is left!

Served hot, fast service and good music. Place has limited seating, couple tables by the road side and outside. Food portions and menu selection is decent.
author: Ash K.

description: Ate breakfast here today with my wife. First of all, excellent coffee and cafe mocha. I had the 12pm crepe, which is filled with chicken, spinach, and mushrooms and topped with a Mornay sauce . It was absolutely delicious, perfectly cooked, probably the best breakfast IV had in the last couple of years. My wife had avocado toast three ways and she was very happy with it as well. Highly recommend!
author: Doug B.

description: Overall a very good breakfast place. Great service. The 3-way avocado toast was delicious. I loved the Fishermans Wharf frittata. The potatoes were tasty. Coffee was good. Both breakfast came with a yummy fruit bowl.
author: Frances R.

description: First stop for food in San Francisco. We had to wait for a table because they were busy, but we were first in line so we were at a table within ten minutes. We ordered the French toast, and the platter with eggs, bacon, and potatoes. The French toast was pretty good, not the best I've had though. The service was great, only reason I'm docking a star is the potatoes.. I don't know why, but I just did not like them at all. Other than that, a great breakfast choice!
author: Ashley L.

description: Just had the most filling and delicious breakfast of a bagel and lox. My husband had the three way alvacado and was very filling  wait was little long, however beautiful day waiting. Once we got inside and sat down didn't matter although as others have stated little warm. No jacket or sweater needed. Will eat there again
author: Jackie E.

description: It was so warm and stuffy inside, it would have been cooler sat outside in the midday sunshine. They brought the wrong order to start with and took a long time to correct it. Customer service consisted of making sure people were processed as quickly as possible so they could take more money from the poor people to follow on. Food was mediocre and not worth lining up for.
author: P M.

description: I was reluctant to give this place such a low rating - the food and service were incredible, in fact, I've never had such a great waffle! Sadly I've yet to see a dirtier restaurant bathroom; this was repulsive. Not incidentally gross either, it is clear that this bathroom has not been cleaned well in a very long time; the walls surrounding the toilet were especially hard to see right before a meal. If you're going to eat here, relieve yourself elsewhere!
author: K R.

description:
I order the trio toast, which came with fresh fruits. 
And it was delicious,the avocado was fresh and the bacon was nice and crispy, the tomatoes were very fresh and refreshing. We sat outside and enjoyed our coffee and lovely breakfast. Love his place will be coming back.
author: Yineyri F.

description: Eight AM is very small and underwhelming at sight, but the food is SO GOOD. They have amazing avocado toast, and the bagel two ways was spectacular. Definitely recommend the orange juice and the location is perfect. Overall would go back again and again for the amazing food, amazing service, and amazing location.
author: Michael B.

description:
Staying at a hotel around the Wharf, we always go out of our way to try a local establishment whenever we visit.

This past weekend, it was Eight AM.  We arrived at 9a and there was no wait, which is quite surprising because anything on Yelp in SF with more than 4-stars demands respect and anticipation of a wait time.  I guess we got in right before the rush!

The service was one of the most pleasant experiences during our weekend visit.  The food was also great!  Everything was minimally seasoned, so that you can dial it in to your own liking.

We ordered the Fisherman's Egg Benedict and the 1PM.  Eight AM provides beautiful plate presentation and quality.  You will not be disappointed.

Just as we were leaving, like clockwork, there was a 20 minute wait and it began to drizzle as well.  Not a problem with the rain as it has been patchy all weekend.  

Thank you for that bit of sunshine on Saturday, Eight AM!  We gladly support local businesses that provide quality food and quality service!
author: Ghaffar G.

description: Excellent breakfast and service! The avocado three ways is crazy good!!!!
author: Robert M.

description:
My wife and I had breakfast at Eight AM, 1323 Columbus Ave, San Francisco, CA, which was only a short walk from many Fisherman's Wharf hotels, including ours. They are a cute little cafe with indoor & sidewalk seating. The menu is extensive with all the regular breakfast favorites and a large selection of crepes and fresh fruit.

I had the Belgian waffle with fruit and whipped cream. It was delicious. My wife had the bacon and cheddar Russian Hill frittata which she enjoyed. The orange juice is fresh squeezed. My only disappointment is that the coffee is served with chemical stabilized creamers that need no refrigeration. What is the point of making everything fresh and tasty except the cream?

 I highly recommend 8 AM will give them a 5th star when they start serving some fresh milk or cream.
author: Rich C.

description:
Stopped in here on a Monday. Excellent service and coffee. Husband ordered the French toast with bananas and he said it is the best he has ever had. I ordered a frittata, which really shouldn't be called a frittata, because it is literally a rubbery open-faced omelette. It wasn't great, due to the fact that it seemed to have no seasoning whatsoever. I added lots of salt and pepper, but it was still lacking. I finally added some Cholula, which I never do, and it was edible.

Moral of the story....... Eat the sweet, skip the savory!
author: JaLynn P.

description: Really good food and they give you a lot of it. We didn't have to wait during the week. Waffles were amazing
author: Michelle P.

description:
The food is ok, the service is friendly, and it's a good bang for your buck (as far as SF goes). If you're hungry definitely order one of the frittatas. The portions are large and I love that there is a generous side of fruit with it. My friend ordered the french toast which was also delicious.

The only thing is everything there was really just okay...it wasn't bad, but it wasn't great. The potatoes were cold when I got them and the frittata was overcooked and not very flavorful. I just found it underwhelming for all of the hyped up reviews it had.  

The space itself is cramped and can get pretty crowded.
author: Kelly T.

description: This breakfast was perfect! I had an apple sausage frittata with a few added veggies. My partner had avocado toast 3 ways. Everything was cooked perfectly, seasoned well and came out on time. The service was also very attentive.
author: Lacey C.

description:
A really cute brunch place. I guess it's a really millennial thing to say, but the avocado toast trio is to die for. I really enjoyed the one with an egg on it. My friends all got the same thing and they loved it. Plus they have my favorite lavender back tea here. 

The place was a lot smaller than I imagined. I am glad we came on a quiet Sunday afternoon since it would not have been able to accommodate us all if they were super busy. 

The service was alright. We had to catch the waiter down a few times to get us lemon or refill water, but no big deal. Although we were expecting more attentiveness since it wasn't that busy. All in all, a good brunch place in the city.
author: M T.

description: A very delicious café. We had sat outside and ordered the avocado toast three ways which was delicious, and the Chia putting which was so very good too. For $15 the avocado toast three ways was a bargain because it is three large pieces of toast. Everything looked and tasted amazing, and the staff was extremely friendly.
author: Allix H.

description:
Quaint little spot with great food. 4 stars only because of the atmosphere inside (not much of an atmosphere and very warm). 
I was seated immediately and was served some pretty good coffee. I had found this place on Yelp and felt obliged to stop by due to the reviews. I'm glad I did. 
The avocado toast three ways was sooooo good. Normally I don't like ordering menu items like avocado toast because I'm typically starving in the mornings and need a big meal at the start of the day, especially on vacation! However, this was extremely filling!!! The toast was freshly baked and the avocado spread was hearty and all over just how I like it. Each toast is different, one topped with bacon, another with egg, and a third with tomato. My favorite had to be the tomato! It was delicious and very filling. The meal also came with a bowl of fruit which I enjoyed. It just went with it. I would definitely come back to this spot :)
author: Katie M.

description:
My friend and I were looking for a brunch spot and found that most places in the area didn't open until 11:30 on a Monday. We looked on Yelp and found Eight AM. When we arrived around 9am, it was already pretty crowded, with only two tables available. As we were waiting for our food, crowds of people kept pouring in. It seems to be a family run business and everyone is all smiles and friendly. I love seeing that their business is such a success.

I loved the variety of options. I went for a sweet and savory bagel. You can pick two combinations. I ordered one half with peanut butter, bacon and green apple slices and the other with egg, ham and avocado. It also came with a bowl of fresh fruit. When they say fresh, they mean it! Everything was so amazing and just the right amount of food so you're not overly stuffed and in a food coma. They don't serve alcohol, but they have plenty of juice and coffee options. Definitely recommend!
author: Caitlin R.

description: I had the avocado toast 3 ways. TO DIE FOR. I would recommend getting there close to opening time if you don't want to wait. Overall, quick service and delicious food. I will definitely visit next time I'm  in San Fran!
author: Courtney S.

description:
Solid. The place is really close to Fisherman's Wharf, so it can get touristy. The Belgian waffles, however, are for champions. They're big, crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside, not to mention vibrantly topped with fruit if you get the berries one. 

I had the sausage and eggs, and shared a waffle with my friend. The sausage and eggs dish comes with a generous amount of potatoes and a large cup of fresh fruit (strawberries, cantaloupe, honeydew melon, bananas, blueberries, raspberries, and a kiwi slice). 

We waited about 17-20 mins on a Saturday around 11am. Not too bad in comparison to most brunch/breakfast places all around the city especially for the area it was in. Service was really good and it didn't take long to get our food. The servers even came around to top off our coffee twice. 

They have a nice filled out menu from including the usual eggs and bacon/sausage dishes, frittatas, crepes, bagels, and interesting takes on the new avocado toast trend. Everyone's favorites. Lots of things I like in a breakfast spot: good amount of people without a line around the block, menu variety, desserty and savory breakfast, quick service, and in a refreshing neighborhood.
author: Stacey L.

description: Found this place online and I'm so glad I did. Amazing breakfast. My husband and I both had an iced mocha. Delish. Our son had regular coffee also good. My avocado toast 3 ways was perfect. And came out so beautiful and fresh.  Both of the guys got frittatas and really enjoyed them. Love love love the fresh fruit. And the potatoes wow! We sat outside on a perfect morning. Small place so get there early!
author: Jen B.

description: Loved the cozy atmosphere! The hostess was very helpful in getting me the big table when I had my children with me (there is not a lot of extra space here) food is colorful and delicious. I had the toast 3 ways. My only thought was I wanted to put everything on one toast and eat it together :). 3 pieces of toast is a lot for most people. My children loved the waffle with FRESH berries on top! GREAT GREAT GREAT PLACE! I also really liked the coffee.
author: Kasey H.

description: Best breakfast place ever, very nice employees great food, I loveeeeeeee the French toast it was the best. I will for sure come again,
author: Angie M.

description:
This place was great!

Had Frittata that came w potatoes and fruit. Everything was excellent.  Everything was hot.

Also had waffles w berries. Aweaome.

True from other reviewers: fruit cup is sweet, ripe, fruit is great.  Potatoes tasty.

Service was prompt, water and coffee refilled appropriately.

Highly recommend, will not disappoint!

Tip: small appetites can probably share a Frittata
author: J C.

description: Frittata was great. Very relaxed atmosphere. Large portions. Perfect coffee and lattes.
author: Marybeth E.

description:
Eight AM is fantastic. Healthy breakfast options, generous portions, good pricing, pleasant and quick service.

We like to experiment and try different places but kept coming back to Eight AM during our short stay in SF.  They nailed it every time. We tried: Avocado toast three ways, eggs and sausage, a few different frittatas and a fruit salad. All super fresh and delicious. Now, can you open Eight AM in DC, please?
author: Olga N.

description:
"Do you want more coffee?" These beautiful words pierce the heart. There's not much I love more than hearing that in the morning. Let's start with, great service! The food was great as well.

We ordered the avocado toast and the berry waffle. Both wonderful!
author: Maria R.

description: Went here because I was in the area. I will definitely be back to try different things on their menu. The waffle and the French toast were delicious!!! The chai was a bit too sweet for me but this place is a must try!
author: Remi H.

description: In town for just 4 days and came here for breakfast 2 times because it was that good. This was probably one of the best waffles I've ever had in my 20 years on this earth (and I've had a lot of waffles) must MUST come here.
author: Victoria P.

description: My boyfriend and I came here for breakfast today. We had a quick five minute wait, which we were thankful for, since we were very hungry. This place wasn't what I was expecting aesthetically. It had restaurant basics: tables, chairs, but bare walls and no decor. When we arrived they were playing 'Bad and Boujee', which I thought was pretty funny for brunch music. The food was incredible though. The breakfast menu was unique and the food did not disappoint. I got the soy vanilla chia seed pudding and my boyfriend got the bagel fixings. Both amazing! Also, the fruit that came with our meals was so fresh and flavorful! Definitely a fun little brunch spot. Simple looking restaurant with some pretty incredible food!
author: Ilena M.

description: Busy spot. Found it by chance. Service was amazing and food was great. Ordered the avocado toast 3 ways. Highly recommend.
author: Mishkat L.

description:
Amazing coffee, amazing service, amazing food. Simply amazing! 

I had the avocado toast 3 ways and my sister had the frittata. Delicious!
author: Elissa W.

description:
Inside the restaurant was literally 87 degree fahrenheit when it was only 70 degree outside. Multiple customers had been complaining about the heat and their response was, "it gets pretty warm in here"

Nothing special about the food. Just your average american breakfast..
author: Chris K.

description: Definitely worth it. Delicious and has healthy options. Fruit with every order which is awesome. Very fast and friendly staff. Fresh squeezed OJ but came out a little warm.
author: Grace M.

description: Fantastic crepes. I went on a Friday morning so it was fairly busy but the wait time for 2 people was still pretty short. Larger groups seemed to have a slightly longer wait time because the restaurant is small. Servers were friendly.
author: Kristin M.

description:
Great service ! My husband, baby and I come here often since we are locals and all the servers are always very nice. Ryan, especially goes above and beyond and always welcomes us back. 

I love their frittatas! It comes with a side of potatoes and fruit, pretty good deal ! My husband loves their French toast ( as do I ) sooo good ! This is our neighborhood go to spot !
author: Nancy T.

description: great food! super fresh and healthy... the soy vanilla chia pudding was amazing! there's was a line, but it moved pretty quick and our server was friendly and helpful! will definitely come back!
author: Pati C.

description: Get here early because everyone knows what's up with this place and you will have to wait.  The avocado toast plate is huge with juicy and fresh tomatoes like I used to have on the farm growing up and big strips of bacon.  The cappuccinos were frothy and delicious.  You can tell that this business takes pride in preparing great food for each one of their customers.  Such a great place.
author: George M.

description: The wait for this place was sorta long but there weren't that many people in the kitchen so that is probably why. I had the avocado toast and chia seed pudding. The flavor was okay but I don't think I'd come back, not really that crazy about this place. It was okay.
author: Jessie C.

description: Great service! Food was great but my eggs were cold...still bomb. Coffee was average but did the trick! Cute mom and pops restaurant:)
author: Tanya M.

description:
This is a pretty standard neighborhood breakfast/brunch spot...one of those places where you know exactly what you're going to get, you'll know it'll be good, and you know you'll leave satisfied. The inside of the restaurant is cramped but cozy, and there's a patio area out front - which is nice when the sun's shining. The menu boasts different variations of avocado toast, frittatas, and crepes (savory and sweet). The prices are a tad high but not unreasonable by SF standards. I would probably come here a lot if I lived in the neighborhood. 

Helpful tips: there's no WiFi, and the place doesn't take American Express.
author: Stephanie F.

description:
Eight AM is now a fav breakfast/brunch spot of mine. If I lived in SanFrancisco, I would definitely be a regular.

It's a small restaurant with a lot of people trying to eat there at the same time so I expected a wait. We did wait for about 35-40 minutes but we were doing brunch with no reservations as a party of 4, so while I was starving lol, I did not mind the wait. 

The food was absolutely delicious. I ordered the waffle with a side of bacon and eggs. It was so good. The waffle was topped with blackberries, strawberries, blueberries, raspberries, and whipped cream. Man oh man!!! So good. My family ordered the frittatas and they were well pleased. The frittatas came with home style potatoes and a nice sized bowl of fruit that looked so good and would be about $9-10 by itself at any other establishment, as fruit is so expensive and they did not hold back with the fruit: kiwi, banana, honeydew, strawberries, etc etc. 

Definitely come here if you are in the San Francisco area. 5 star breakfast! 

I did not like that they had 1 single stall bathroom for all patrons though but other than that, everything was great.
author: Darah B.

description: Service was super friendly and the food is SUPERB! Small place that gets hot if you sit in the back but no one even cared. That's how good it is. What a gem of a place. We were lucky that it is so close to our hotel and we are already planning on coming back for the next 2 days of our trip. There were 9 people in our party and everyone's meal was amazing. Trust the other reviews and go here!
author: Emili S.

description: Great place, with a long line that moves fast!!!! Food was GREAT!!! Prices where ok. Two younger brothers owned the place that's been in the family for a while. Service reflected owners working the tables. Service was the best for such a small local place! This is a must for a least one of your breakfast stops.
author: Brelyn A.

description:
The food was a plenty, and delicious! My heavens, what a menu to choose from.
Can't wait to return!
author: Carla D.

description: The food is definitely expensive. For two coffees and two entrees, I spent about $50 for breakfast which is definitely on the high side. The food was tasty, but not out of this world. I was impressed with the lattes, though.
author: Amber K.

description: We walked by this place and saw the food people were eating at the sidewalk tables- delicious! The pics here don't lie! So we made a special trip back to the area to try it. So glad we did! Everything was fresh and tasty! Love the idea of choosing different bagel fixings- so you can get both savory and sweet satisfaction! And friendly efficient staff- overall great place for breakfast!
author: Christy D.

description:
Amazing food - really fresh fruit and berries - yummy selections 
We have eaten there twice and will again before we leave
author: Sharon S.

description:
At around 10 there was little to no wait. The food was solid, it filled us up. I didnt like the prices, and I don't think the food was good enough for it's hefty price. 

3 people, ordered French toast, crepe, and bacon and eggs which amounted to over $70
Orange juice at $6 a glass, that seems a little excessive, especially since it was a relatively small glass.

Probably won't be back unless the wait times are crazy elsewhere.
author: Christine T.

description: A traveler's must. Great food with good prices and welcoming staff. We came twice for the the food and didn't regret. The French toast us incredible sweet so watch out but the ingredients are killer. Thanks guys!
author: Steven A.

description:
Came here while on a trip in SF. Our hotel was right now the street and I was so happy we stopped by. There was a line out the door but we got seated pretty quick. I ordered the 3 way avocado toast. It was delicious! I also got the latte which was served in a large glass, something that I think makes it better. 
Overall great food! If I'm ever in SF again I will be back and recommend it.
author: Chelsea W.

description: Fantastic little place with not your everyday breakfast choices. Friendly prompt service and a great find.
author: Stephen R.

description: Solid breakfast eatery.  We ate here outdoors on a nice SF morning and I got the eggs and bacon.  Simple dish and well-delivered dish.  Nothing special but wasn't looking for special, just good old fashion eggs and bacon.
author: Matt W.

description:
Had to wait a little bit, but it was well worth the wait. Yum. Service was friendly and efficient. 
Cappuccino was excellent.
author: Patricia R.

description: Excellent customer service, they really get hospitality. The food is great.  We've only had breakfast here. I did my regular go to- bacon eggs and a side of sausage and an americano. The Mrs did the bagel and lox with goat cheese. No complaints with the food or the wait time. This is just an all around good place to grab a quick bite and start the touristy thing. Enjoy!
author: Mac D.

description: During my SF vacation I went to several places to eat brunch. But this place by far had the best service and the food was delicious. It's not as busy as many places which makes it a nice spot to hang out and eat good food!
author: Cynthia L.

description: I really didn't enjoy this breakfast/brunch place. The avocado toast was really gross. The frittata was also bad. I really didn't like the decor either. Everything was very cheap looking.
author: Anna I.

description: If we could give this 10 stars, we would. Everything was AMAZING!  We got the banana French toast - super yum! The waffles were delicious as were the frittatas with the most sweet and sensational seasonal fruit. Definitely recommend. Our waitress was so friendly!
author: Sue D.

description: Perfect breakfast spot near Fishermans Wharf in SF! The staff was so kind and attentive! My mom and I ordered a sugar waffle and the French toast and split the two between us--the servings are big! I definitely recommend ordering a variety and sharing!
author: Alyssa H.

description: This has been our favorite dining experience since we have been in San Francisco (out of many). They sat our party of 8 quickly and politely. We ordered many different things on the menu and it was all to die for. There is no kids menu, but they have plenty of side options for inexpensive prices to keep the little ones happy. They also were very happy to accommodate difficult orders. Portions were big as well. Fruit was amazingly fresh and coffee was perfect. There was not a moment of neglect from wait staff either. Nice location, good atmosphere, friendly staff, good prices, and very good food!!
author: Tamara L.

description: Fast, good food. Serving are huge! Staff was very friendly. Had the Castro frittata and hubby had avocado toast 3 ways. Very casual and seems like a local favorite as well. We saw regulars come in and the waiter knew his order. Love places like this.
author: Guelcys P.

description: First breakfast place my mom & I came to here in San Francisco. Amazing food and amazing waiter! Highly recommend!!
author: Katherine S.

description:
Solid food - girlfriend and I both had the Avocado Toast, which is three different types of bread with bacon, fried egg, and slice of tomato on separate pieces. Needed salt, but still quite good. The tomato was surprisingly delicious. The bowl of fruit was large and neither of us could finish it all.  For breakfast, it's a little pricey, as all things in San Fran are, especially in the touristy areas...but I'd go back if I'm staying close by.  

Friendly staff and quick service!
author: David B.

description:
Overall, everything was fine at this place, but I wouldn't make it a priority to go again. 

Pros: food was good. We got the avocado toast three ways, the berry waffle and the 6am crepe. The music playing was a fun throw back to 90's hip hop. Servers were nice, but abrupt. 

Cons: food came out separately, about 5-8 min apart, so it made some wait longer than others. The place is super small, so either get there early, or be prepared to wait. It's an ok atmosphere for kids(noisy already), but they don't have anything for them to do while waiting for their food, or a kids menu. The orange juice (about 8 ounces) was $6.
author: Victoria H.

description:
Breakfast was simple but delicious - really fresh ingredients, ample portion size and perfectly prepared.  The spot isn't fancy but it's worth the line.  Service was attentive but not pushy.  

Two of us ordered the avocado toast three ways and two ordered the made-to-order frittatas.  All of us were pleased and left full.

Tip:  call ahead and put your name on the list.
author: Christina K.

description: I was looking for a place to eat with my group of friends for our last day visiting the Bay Area and found this place. We wanted a good place to eat for breakfast and we ran across this place online. Honestly, the greatest breakfast foods and service was great. My friends and I had a great time. I'd recommend the Avocado eggs three way!
author: Hufsah K.

description: Perfect for a quick breakfast and very accomodating. I stopped in for some bacon and eggs, and although I didn't go Ron Swanson style, I did get what I wanted.  Three eggs and a number of bacon strips!  The even substituted the potatoes with more fruit.  A win in my book!  Keep up the good work as I will be back.
author: Ryan W.

description: The food was DELICIOUS. I had the banana walnut waffle and it was to die for. The staff were so friendly and accommodating too! Very cute place in SF walking distance from Lombard Street and Fisherman's Wharf. I would definitely go there again next time I'm in SF!!
author: Marlene E.

description: Simple and nice breakfast. Tasty creamy avocado toast, soft and fluffy bagels. Had to queue up earlier but the guys work very fast and efficient, so food came out fast. Would definitely come back.
author: Nita M.

description: Delicious! Everything was extremely fresh, including the amazing fruit! The price was fair considering how close it is to the wharf.
