The restaurant is small so I would recommend getting there early. My only negative would be the young servers seemed off to a slow start since we got there shortly after they opened. Regardless, we would definitely go back!
author: Cortney S.

description: Great good, great service and the flow of traffic is constant but they do a very good job seating you as quickly as possible. A must if you're in the neighborhood
author: Saba Z.

description: Since we ended up in the Fisherman's Wharf area right after our cable car ride, we decided to go ahead and make a breakfast stop at 8 AM.  My wife picked this spot because of their open faced style breakfast.  She's big into the avocado and egg on a toast thing at the moment, so we ate there.  I had the frittata and let me tell you it as delicious and it was a lot of food.  You could split it easily, because it also comes with potatoes and fresh fruit.  Definitely a place to try if you are in the area for some good breakfast.  The service is great and accommodating. This is where the locals eat.
author: David S.

description: Sooo yummy. The people that work here were so pleasant and helpful. Soo much food for such a good price!!
author: Merlyn H.

description: Bad service we ordered drinks a tea and orange juice and they never came. When we came they didn't direct us into our table and gave us the menu in our hands. Also they didn't even said  sorry about never bringing us our drinks. They just brushed it off.
author: Benny R.

description: Friendly staff and great breafast and Kid friendly. Kids loved the waffles and french toast. Avacado toast for mommy.
author: Dyniece A.

description: Loved this place!  Everyone was so kind and thoughtful.  The food is outstanding!  Everything is presented gorgeously.  My kids loved it and everyone wants to come back tomorrow!  Also they have a clean restroom!  That's hard to find in the city!  The food portions are large, I should have shared with someone.
author: Leiah L.

description:
My girlfriend and I have been exploring new brunch spots in SF and Eight Am was next on out list. We put our name down and we were seated within about 20 minutes.  We got a great table out front in the sun. We had both seen pictures of the Banana nut waffles and they looked amazing so we had to try them. As expected they were delicious. We both got a side of bacon and eggs to go with as well. 
Service was fast and friendly and the food was great. I will recommend this place to everyone. Thanks !!
author: Joshua H.

description: The food was amazing but sitting inside was a little bit to warm for me. But other then that I had a great experience
author: Kayla M.

description: Food was excellent, dungenous crab eggs benedict, the waiter was patient, informational and attentive. I had to try the other three dishes , that the other people I went with had, which were equaly delicious. Wonderful refreshinf staff environment and food.
author: Joaquin G.

description: The food is definitely a 5, but I gave it a 4 because I liked, but didn't love the spot. I had the Belgian waffle. It was crunchy on the outside and fluffy on the inside. I felt they balanced out the sweetness of the wiped cream and waffle with the tartness of the berries well. I'm not a huge fan of tart berries, but it cut through the density of the waffle swimming in the wiped cream and syrup well :) I would definitely go back here again.
author: Soohyun Y.

description:
Had the Fresh Berries Waffle and Avocado Toast Three Ways. Waffles could go without a large dollop of butter, but overall everything was delicious. 

Affordable. Cute space. Sit outside for the love of God. It's like a sauna inside, unless you're into that. We left in a healthy food coma.
author: Nguyen H.

description: Delicious avocado toast 3-ways!!! What a gem of a restaurant!  Thank you for accommodating our Girl Scout troop!!! Everyone in our group enjoyed the food and service!!!
author: Dawne B.

description:
One of the many things I had bookmarked before making my trip to SF. 

Avocado toasts pictures won me over. It was pretty good, but not really out of this world. Waffles were pretty good also. "Pretty good" meaning they were okay.

This place is kind of small, but for 2 on a Sunday morning we waited about 30-40 minutes. 

Service was pretty good too. Came around refilling my coffee a few times. Coffee was average. 

I only came here because I wanted to try a lot of different places during my trip and had already gone to Buena Vista Cafe the day before. I'd rather go to Buena Vista, which is walking distance from this place. 

TL;DR: Not really gonna come back here again; rather go to Buena Vista Cafe.
author: Lyrissa R.

description:
Cozy little brunch spot that provides great service. The young man that took our order answered all our questions in a polite manner. He was attentive to every table. 

I order the popular 3 avocado toasts. Overall I have no complaints about it - it was good and simple. It comes with fresh fruits which went nicely with the order. I enjoyed it very much because i wasn't overly stuffed but I left satisfied. I recommend this place to anyone that is around the area and if you are visiting Alcatraz or the Piers near by.
author: Judy K.

description: Food is good, especially the way they look:) however, the server forgot to take our order and it took us over an hour to wait for the food. Unpleasant experience.
author: Siqiao X.

description: Vacation post! Great breakfast! It is a small location and had a long wait on the weekend, so we tried again on a Monday morning. Especially in comparison to the other breakfast places we tried, our breakfast was great. We sat outside and the service was quick and polite. Price wise, they are in-line with the other breakfast restaurants in the area, but this food was better.
author: Kelly B.

description: Food was amazing...better then a place i go to back at home if this place was closer i would come here for breakfast whenever i didn't feel like cooking....so amazing
author: Benjamin R.

description: My husband and I walked her when Mama's had a SUPER long line and we're so glad we did. From the start, the staff were super nice & welcoming. We got the avocado toast three way and the strawberry and cream cheese crepes. We also ordered a macchiato and vanilla latte and those were delicious! Great brunch :)
author: Riley M.

description:
We happened to be walking past and saw some guests eating on the patio and honestly stopped in our tracks because the food looked THAT delicious.....and went in. 

We were not let down. I ordered the 3 avocado toast...I think I went to another food universe...ABSOLUTELY delicious. Hot coffee and it comes with a fruit cup. And you know when you see that on a menu you yall think it's going to be a few pieces of watermelon, cantaloupe and a strawberry if you're lucky. This fruit cup had EVERYTHING in it....blackberries, blueberries, raspberries,bananas, kiwis, pineapple.....you get me!!! 

This place is my heaven on earth and unfortunately I live in Dallas. Now my bf ordered a banana topped Belgium waffle with nuts, whipped cream and syrup and I was so involved with my delicious food I forgot to try his....hopefully he yelps his because by gosh it looked AHHHHMAZING!!!!

I cannot wait to come back to San Francisco to eat here....everyone needs to stop and eat here....just do it....you won't be sorry!!
Bazillion stars......
author: Susan H.

description:
Definitely not a 4.5 stars! 

Food is ok but very basic. Not a large menu selection. 
My avocado toast and egg plate was very boring (see photo). Lots of bread (3 slices) spreaded with avocado, 1 egg, 1 tomato slice and a fruit bowl. 

6$ US for an orange juice.  #fail

Really needs an update on the decor as well. 

Not much different from any american style breakfast places. Will not go back.
author: Fa R.

description: This place is amazing and the customer service is excellent. Loved their options. I had their chia pudding and the avocado toast. Also I love that they always serve a side of fruit instead of potatoes or other unhealthy options.
author: Lilah A.

description: About a 15 Min wait.... small breakfast spot near the wharf... great prompt service.. water cup always full.. attentive staff. My husband ordered the 3 way Avocado toast.. came with fresh fruit .. sooo good. I ordered the bagel and lox. Very good!!Plenty of lox to spare!! This place was amazing!!! Also whoever playlist they were using in the restaurant was great!!
author: Karen S.

description: Great place overall. The air quality and temperature in the restaurant were unacceptable, though -- might have been a one-time issue.
author: Christopher M.

description: Busy on a Saturday morning, wait time was about 15 minutes. Food was generally under seasoned. French toast, despite great photos, was abysmal.
author: Dana T.

description: Avocado toast three ways! Yum. Cute, casual brunch place with a diner feel. Service is good, food is tasty, wait isn't too bad. Great spot for a Sunday brunch and afternoon stroll around the wharf.
author: Trish P.

description:
Deeeeeeelllliiiiicious!    I was unsure when I walked up but was completely blown away by the service and food.  

It's a pretty small place but there's ample room between the tables so you don't feel crowded or packed like a can of sardines.  The popular item here are their frittatas which come out piping hot and delicious.  Each are served with a side of breakfast potatoes and a bowl of fresh fruit.  

I ordered a glass of fresh squeezed orange juice which was a cup of pulpy goodness and had the Haight Ashbury frittata that was loaded with vegetables and melted Swiss.  

Be mindful in advance that everything is made on the spot so it might takes 10-12 minutes to get a freshly baked frittata.  It's worth the wait!
author: Tammie W.

description:
This place is simple and good.
I would 100% recommend to anyone.
Seating is limited, so there may be a weight.
author: Joe M.

description:
We had a chance to eat here for the First Time! We liked it very much. The frittata is great and the fruit bowl..... wow what a nice presentation! 
Very good place to eat!
author: Dave M.

description: I had 2 eggs over easy, potatoes, sausage and fruit! It's a must stop breakfast place here in the city. Delicious, highly recommend.
author: Anne Marie A.

description:
This place was my absolute favorite breakfast place throughout my trip to San Francisco last July! My mom and I came here two mornings out of the 5 days we were there. The service was great! Everyone was super nice and things didn't take forever like other popular places. 

I got the trio of avocado toast both times. It was AMAZING. The toasts were great and the large fruit bowl that came with it was the perfect fresh addition. When I visit again I will definitely be back for more of the delicious food!
author: Emma W.

description: Got the avo toast with egg whites and the Castro, both dishes were amazing! Highly recommend either one, fresh squeeze Oj was great but not worth the 6 bucks, overall I can't wait to come back!
author: Beta T.

description: My frittata was absolutely perfect. Huge portion and lots of veggies. Hubby got the avocado toast which was just ok. Coffee was fresh and unlimited refills.
author: Lisandra T.

description:
Amazing breakfast selection served all day.   The chia pudding is not for everyone but I have been eating fried food all week and wanted something light and healthy and this was perfect.  Get the Avocado Toast 3 ways!  Its amazingly simple yet so good.  The bread on which it is served deserves a medal.  
Skip the crepes.  They are not very good and way too expensive.
Service is top notch.  The people who run this place are lovely.
author: Monica G.

description: Excellent breakfast choice near Fisherman's Wharf!  The avocado toast 3 ways was a terrific light morning starter.  All ingredients tasted fresh and the heirloom tomatoes had the taste of coming from the local farmers' market.  The fruit cup was perfectly ripe without having a bad or sour selection.  Family run bistro with polite, courteous and friendly service!  Highly recommend if near Fisherman's Wharf Pier 45.
author: Joe C.

description: This is the best breakfast i have EVER had, seriously.  Avacodo  toast, daughter had banana French toast, OMG, brother had banana nut waffle,  his eyes rolled into back of head. LOL
author: Gwen C.

description: Are used a yelp review to find this restaurant, and I'm very glad that I did. The food was outstanding, service was efficient, staff was very pleasant and friendly, and went above and beyond.
author: Lisa C.

description: Had a fantastic breakfast experience - everything was excellent from the espresso to the coffee; from the fruit (how is this fruit so exceptionally yummy?) to the friendly and accommodating service. Next time I'm near fisherman's wharf I will be back!
author: Andreas M.

description: Had breakfast here. Place was packed. Our table had frittata, bagel two ways, and eggs and bacon. Bagels were good. Frittata was bland. Fruit cup was star of the show. Service was solid. What brings the star rating down is that the food here is overpriced. Over $60 after tip, and because of that won't be back.
author: D N.

description: Wow...great service, excellent and very large portions! Went here for breakfast with friends while visiting SF. The staff was so fast seating us and the food came out quickly too. Wish I had taken pics of the food because it was incredible! If you're in the city, you have to check out this place.
author: Erin F.

description:
I never knew how good avocado toast could be until I went to Eight AM. We were definitely hungry on a Sunday morning and were looking for a place close to Fisherman's Wharf but didn't want to stand in line for ages to get food. Eight AM had a short wait (about 10-15 minutes) and we were able to look at all the delicious food as it was carried on by.

We split the Avocado Toast Three Ways and the Haight Ashbury frittata and both were fantastic. There was a healthy amount of avocado on each piece of toast and each featured a different topping - Heirloom tomatoes, Bacon, and a fried egg. The Heirloom tomato was my favorite followed by the bacon and then the fried egg, but all were fantastic. It also came with a side of incredibly fresh fruit salad. The Frittata was cooked well and featured fresh vegetables and well seasoned potatoes. 

They also have a large variety of different drinks. I went with the chai tea latte and it was worth it.
author: Brent A.

description:
The food here is decent. Everyone says to get the Avocado Toast 3 ways but my bf got it and I can't say it was worth the $$. It's just Avo on toast, people. You can make it yourself. You know you can do it.
The other breakfast foods here are good. I got a frittata and it was so filling and large! The potatoes were not a welcome side dish since they were soft and that's not how this girl eats her potatoes!
The service here is really friendly and always checking up on you. The restaurant was packed and there was a long wait by the time we left. For brunch, it was decent and filling. I bet you guys will enjoy your meal
author: Jenn T.

description: Great breakfast spot. Three of us had different time-named crepes. They were all excellent, as was the avocado toast three ways.
author: Brian G.

description: OMG!!!! I was on vacation and read the reviews so I decided to try this place out.  I love eating healthy....most of the time and this place delivered! I have the Avocado Toast 3 ways and this was awesome.  I arrived right after they opened and the place wasn't packed BUT, by the time I started to leave, it was starting to fill up fast.  It's small, so you don't get lost in the crowds or anything. The prices are bad at all, for California. I'm from Texas so... lol. The décor was nothing fancy to speak about but that's what made this place even better.  It's not what it appears! Yummy.
author: Erica L.

description: Walked by this place after a run to the bridge and it was an awesome find for breakfast.  Big breakfast menu, food was great, staff was really friendly.  Ate here 2 days in a row.  There was a line both days, but it moved really fast.  Highly recommend!
author: Claire S.

description: Best breakfast I've had in town. The Avocado Toast Three Ways was incredible. Service was fantastic. Great outdoor seating for those with furry friends.
author: Taylor R.

description: Eat here! Super friendly service and unbelievably fresh food cooked right!
author: Jahna D.

description: Three ways avocado toast is great, service is very friendly. Overall great spot but the seating is very uneven. They seated us next to the bathroom which smelled and was very hot. If you manage to get a seat outside or next to the window it will be a great experience.
author: Nikolai S.

description: Get the french toast. It's massive and delicious. Also the avocado toast that every else was eating looked pretty good
author: Derrick W.

description:
This place was great. Originally told us it was 30-40 minute wait. Sat in about 15-20 min. Reason being is because if they call your name once and you don't respond, they move on to the next!! Kinda cool because it helps sit people down faster but beware!

Food was delicious. Healthy-ish if you're looking for that. The green tea matcha latte was delicious, the fruit was fresh, and the food itself was tasty! 

Will definitely be back for breakfast when we're in town!
author: Eddie H.

description: Good staff,  I didn't wait at all. I would recommend being there early due to how busy it gets here later in the morning. I like the large amount of fruit with my meal. The meal was very tasty with good flavors from savory to sweet.
author: Jake H.

description:
Small, hole-in-the-wall kind of breakfast/brunch place. We stayed at the Marriott across the street and walked over at about 10 AM. We're seated right away and food came out quickly. Everyone's dish tasted amazing and the presentation was beautiful, too! Only downside is that there is an 18% gratuity charge on parties 4 or higher. Found this unusual. 

Went back to visit the next day and it was a bit more crowded with more of a wait. Better to come earlier than later, especially on weekends. Very happy with the experience
author: Madison R.

description: What a cute little spot for breakfast/brunch. This is the only type of menu they have.. crepes, waffles, French toast, avocado toast. We came here for a late brunch since it was close to our hotel and I'm glad we did. I ordered the Berry Waffle and my fiancé ordered the Castro frittata. Fruit came with both of our meals and it was exceptionally fresh which you don't find at many restaurants. Great service, definitely would recommend!
author: Lauren C.

description:
The avocado toast was really amazing. Three different styles of bread with three different pairings of toppings beyond the smash of avocado. The rich, juicy heirloom tomato was probably my favorite. Coffee was good and plentiful.

While named Eight AM, they opened at 7 AM, the day we visited. We arrived early and grabbed a seat outside. It is a great little location off of Fisherman's Wharf, and well worth a visit.
author: Jack-Daniyel S.

description:
Awesome breakfast ... awesome service 
N Definitely will be coming back  .. we're Fr Vegas n we do get to have breakfast outdoor n nice scenery as well
author: Kathy W.

description:
Lovely little local breakfast spot with delicious, generous meals. We had Asparagus frittata which came with house potatoes and an assortment of fresh fruit; and avocado toast 3-ways, which means 1 topped w a fried egg, 1 w bacon, and 1 w fresh tomatoes. This was also served w fruit. 

Coffee and service were good too. There's some local funky artwork on the walls available for sale.
author: rene r.

description:
Food is very good, prices are somewhat reasonable for the city, and the service was ok. 

We came for brunch on a weekday and the restaurant was definitely not empty. There was a large group of us, so they put tables together to make a large table to seat everyone. We ordered a ton of food to share. The portion sizes are pretty big, and all the entrees came with a rather large bowl of fruits. We got the lox bagel, nice soft fluffy bagel with 4 thick and large pieces of smoked salmon. Also got the crab meat omelette, which came in a nice round fluffy shape and tasted delicious. The toast 3 ways was a very interesting dish as each piece of toast looked, and tasted very differently, talk about having variety. Out of the 3, my favorite was the avocado toast! 

There is only 1 bathroom for the entire restaurant which gets a bit busy and a line formed outside. The service was ok, I did have to ask a few times to refill my tea. Overall, good experience.
author: Dani S.

description:
I'd been recommended this little unprepossessing cafe...it's a couple of blocks back from the touristy fishermans wharf, and honestly, it doesn't look much from the outside.

But, oh my, the breakfast menu was delicious...I was looking down it thinking "yep, I'd literally eat everything on here" given the time!

French toast with fruit, caramelised bananas was superb, the service was incredibly friendly.

If you are a tourist, go, please. If you're not, same applies. 

Excellent.
author: John B.

description:
The best part about Eight AM? The fact that Nina Y. and I did not have to wait for once in our breakfast and brunch adventures together! There were a few tables left once we arrived around 9am so we were seated immediately. The service here is top notch, and it feels like your local diner without all the grease and dinginess. Love the art, too.

We totally over-ordered because there were so many great things on the menu. We ordered three things...

* Avocado Toast Three Ways - This comes with three pieces of toast with three different types of toppings. I think Nina and I could have split JUST this and we would have been content. These were not my favorite, but still very home made.

* Castro Frittata - The frittata was a little on the dry side but still tasty and fresh, not with all the frills of other $20 San Francisco omeletes. It was nice to have a frittata instead of an omelete!

* Chia Seed Pudding - This was my favorite menu item. SO healthy and fresh and tasty. Would recommend this! Having this with a side of toast or an egg is just the right amount of food for a light breakfast to start your day.

If you have exhausted all of your San Francisco breakfast and brunch options, add Eight AM to your list. It was definitely the healthiest food Nina and I had eaten on a Sunday morning in a long time, and well worth our riding the F train from beginning in Castro to the end at Fishermans Wharf.
author: Stefanie C.

description: So happy we decided to have breakfast at Eight AM! Everyone here is so friendly and the food is so fresh and tasty! I wish I was staying in San Francisco another night just to have breakfast here again.
author: Sarah J.

description: Good place to start your day. Very attentive service, and great food. Small restaurant but it didn't feel cramped. Orange juice was super pulpy which I like but a lot of people might not.
author: Kate S.

description: Great experience. I stumbled onto this tiny little place and tried their frittata (with bacon) for 7.30am breakfast. It comes with fresh cut fruits and home potato fries - loved the food, ambience and servers. Recommended.
author: Manoj S.

description: This is an absolute must! Loved the waffles and the fresh fruit bowl was incredible! Definitely our new favorite breakfast place!
author: Bryan F.

description:
Generous portions, delicious food, attentive & friendly service! I'll come back again! 

Got the haight ashbury frittata which was pretty big and had a gooey cheesy filling. Roasted potatoes were pretty good with green onions.

The lox bagel came with a huge hunk of smoked salmon!!! Wow! 

The "blueberry shortcake" is really good: tons of blueberries with cream and vanilla pudding on a buttery flaky croissant. 

Almost every plate comes with a bowl of fresh fruit! Usually restaurants skimp when it comes to fresh fruit, berries, or smoked salmon but this place absolutely does not. 

Cute turtle decor inside. It looks like a family run business and the chef / owner came out and told us to take our time even though we were their last customer.

The service was highly attentive and +1 for seating us right when you closed! I won't forget that :) hope the tip made up for waiting for us. I'll be back, this time before closing!
author: Inga C.

description: Excellent food and friendly service! I ordered the 9am crepe, the fruits was fresh and the crepe was cooked just right! I will definitely go back again soon!
author: Wendy N.

description:
A great restaurant; food was delicious, service was great. We end up having breakfast at eight am every day during our visit to San Francisco..
Highly recommended!!
author: Doha S.

description: Had brunch with friends. Food was nicely presented. The negative is that I wanted my food to be boxed for take home and my server took &threw away my food without asking if I was done or if I wanted to take it home. I felt like we were rushed despite it not being near closing time or any wait for other guests. Our group was of four people so they get 18% gratuity regardless
author: Diana N.

description:
Played breakfast roulette this morning and chose this small cafe. 

Food: the food was AMAZING. I'm a huge breakfast person and I must say everything we had was great. Must get the potatoes if your meal doesn't come with it. Trust me, I'm a huge potato fan and these were good. We ordered the raspberry croissant sandwich, Berry French toast, Berry waffles, and avocado toast. All was delicious and hit the spot. 

Service:  I believe the cook would walk from table to table to ensure his customers are enjoying their meals. He would assist with cleaning up when needed. The waiters were were attentive and made sure everyone was well taken cared of. 

I would go back here again and recommend it to others who decide to travel to SF.
author: Leanne P.

description: This restaurant is a wonderful place to stop by and eat brunch. It provided a cute and cozy atmosphere and the service was excellent. My server did a great job anticipating my needs and I never had an empty cup. I ordered a 12 pm crepe (chicken, mushrooms, and spinach), and my meal was served very promptly. The food was great quality and very satisfying. Eight AM is located across the street from Joseph Conrad Park at the bottom of Russian Hill with a beautiful green scenery to look upon. I would definitely recommend this restaurant if you are looking for a nice breakfast or brunch spot in the area.
author: Sarah D.

description: FIRST THINGS FIRST!  PUT YOUR NAME ON THE SIGN IN SHEET IMMEDIATELY UPON ARRIVING!  We stood in line like dumb dumbs thinking there was actually a line.  There isn't.  For some reason, people just like to stand in line.  Everything we had for breakfast was fantastic.  I had the avocado toast 3 ways (well, two for me because I don't eat eggs).  They did not charge me extra for the substitution of extra bacon instead of the egg AND they brought me extra slices of this beautiful heirloom tomato for no additional charge as well.  The fruit cup was so fresh and delicious.  My husband had one of the frittatas and it came with breakfast potatoes.  I had food envy for every plate that went by.  The portions are VERY generous and we are hearty eaters.  The guys working in the restaurant were hustling!  I was amazed at the speed at which they moved.  Be forewarned, the restaurant is long and narrow inside, so accommodating parties of more than 4 during the rush will be a challenge.  They also have 4 tables outside that they can push together if needed.  One more note about the restaurant - it is really warm inside, so dress in layers so you can peel something off if they seat you in the main dining room.  AND FINALLY, THE FOOD IS DEFINITELY WORTH THE WAIT!  We were going to go back a second day to try the waffles or French toast but decided we would try the other top rated restaurant in the area, Hollywood Cafe.  What a disappointment!  We really wished we had gone with our gut!
author: Rina H.

description:
After a 12k race that brought us back to SF from Sausalito, we decided to come here to refuel. We beat most of the crowd and were able to be seated within 30 min. It is a bit cramped, but they have a small space to work with anyways.

Service: Our waiter was nice and attentive. Also very patient when we were still trying to figure out what we wanted and kept making adjustments to our orders.

Food: I ordered the soy chia seed pudding, which was pretty good, but in hindsight, for $8, I could have probably just made it at home. I also got a couple egg whites to replenish my muscle stores. My bf got the avocado toast three ways, which comes with an egg, bacon, and a tomato. It also came with a generous side of fruit. They were as expected, but nothing amazing. I think they needed a bit more seasoning to be honest. They have some other, more carb heavy items like waffles and french toast that may be more mind-blowing, but while this place didn't necessarily WOW me, I do respect the fact that they use such wholesome ingredients, so I feel like I'm eating clean. Definitely a good post-race breakfast without having to worry about overdoing it.

Cost: Not too bad, after all it is SF.
author: Leana L.

description: Cute place with outstanding avocado toast!    We were visiting from Dallas/Ft. Worth and wish we had a place like this in our area.
author: Lori P.

description: Great food and friendly staff! Zero complaints from us. We ordered basic breakfast, which were cooked perfectly and included the best fruit bowl I've ever ordered!
author: Jade G.

description: Visiting San Fran for a wedding and wanted to meet up with a friend for brunch ... this place has good reviews so I wanted to check it out!!!! It was five of us in total and everyone's food look and tasted phenomenal. It was pretty packed as it is a smaller space and definitely popular but the turn around was smooth and efficient. All the waiters were super friendly and pleasant. I would definitely go back again! Food was too good and we were too hungry to take pics but I will try next time. Also do not be fooled by the side option of fruit... it is super tasty and extremely fresh and not the bland and generic cup of fruit! I was impressed with that!
author: Faye K.

description: Awesome place for pancakes, French toasts and all breakfast. Staffs are efficient. It's a very small place, but great spot for the area
author: Supa S.

description: AMAZING! The food is super fresh and delicious. The fruit is fresh and they aren't stingy with the berries and kiwi. We had the 2am crepe and the Haight and Ashbury frittata and we both wept quietly while we consumed the deliciousness. The staff is friendly and prompt. Service was quick without feeling rushed. You should love yourself and go here.
author: Sherri B.

description: We stopped at Eight AM on a whim and I am so glad we did. Our breakfast was amazing and the service was spectacular. Our coffee's stay full and warm the entire meal. My mother and I could get over the freshness of the fruit. I had the Dungeness Crab Frittata and it was so worth it. Thanks Eight AM!
author: Caroline M.

description: It has been a long time since I went to a restaurant and felt so immediately at ease. The interior design, the staff, the food - it was all so kind, genuine, and relaxing. The sun was coming through the windows and the smell of fresh bay air filled my lungs as I enjoyed some vanilla pudding. Wonderful establishment. And the prices and food are so good!
author: Kurt N.

description:
This is a great breakfast/brunch place to visit. They have lots of delicious items on their menu including some unique avocado toasts, crepes & bagels. They workers here are all very nice & I think it's family owned? 

I got the avocado toast 3 ways. You don't need to get one of each kind, you can get 3 of the same or 2 of the same kind. You just need to tell the waiter! I recommend all 3 though so you get the best of all 3 worlds!! The bread for all 3 are different as well which makes it unique. I love the variety. My favorite would be the egg one since it's a runny sunny side egg :) The one with tomato on top was normal but refreshing! The bacon one is unique because it's a mix of salty and savory. This also comes with a side of fresh fruit. Every single bite of the fruit was so fresh & sweet. It came with cantelope, honeydew, banana, strawberry, blueberries & kiwi! Such a food fruit medley :) I was going to come for another visit during my vacation in SF but it's okay, NEXT TIME for sure!!
author: Winnie L.

description: Great food and amazing service. We were seated quickly and our food came out hot and fast. Husband got the avocado toast trio and loved every bite. I went for bacon, eggs, and potatoes which they nailed!
author: Ashley T.

description: Banana Nut Waffle was delicious! Slight wait but it was well worth it. Plus, Gabe is awesome.
author: Liezl M.

description:
simple, solid spot for breakfast. 

When I came in, there was a bit of a wait but because we chose to sit outside, the wait was incredibly shorter. I ordered the bagel fix-up and the avocado toast three ways. I liked that the bagel fix-up gives me an option for having sweet and savory with a manageable portion size. I ordered the peanut butter, granny smith apple, and bacon; and i ordered the black forest ham with avocado and an egg sunny. I liked the sweeter bagel because the touch of maple syrup really made it for me. 

I think that all four of the avocado toasts lacked salt and flavor but that's fine because they have salt on the table for you. it's hard to go wrong because it's enjoyable no matter what. 

i'm quite impressed by their fruit cup though. it seems that no matter the season, they stay very consistent with the selection. It was good, especially for winter time. but it's still a cup of fruit :P 

The potatoes were good, cooked thoroughly and seasoned. I obviously ate it with ketchup. I wished that they could have made it extra crispy like a hash instead of a roast, but that's fine. I won't be picky. The potatoes stayed surprisingly warm with the cold temps we were sitting in. 

All in all, a good meal. It's exactly what you expect it to be.
author: Tina Y.

description: This place is amazing. The Avocado Toast 3 Ways was great and so was the Bagel Fixin. Everything was fresh and was served with fresh fruit. Service was great but come to prepared to wait for seating. This place is packed but well worth the wait.
author: Chicobe W.

description: Amazing!!! Beautiful menu! A foodies delight. The crepes are delectable, the fruit is incredibly fresh, frittatas are well made and delicious. It's a small place but the service is fast and even on a busy weekend we didn't wait long. In a city full of great food this place was one of our favorite places to eat.
author: Heidi B.

description: This place deserves all the great reviews.  Not a tourist trap as locals definitely frequent but this place isn't a secret so expect lines if you come on the weekends during the rush.  Everything was delicious, our two teenage boys loved the waffles and we loved the uniquely prepared omelettes.  Highly recommended.
author: Matt M.

description: Had to wait a little bit for a table for 4. I had the Toast 3 Ways, it was good, not out of this world. The wife did have the Fisherman's Wharf frittata and that was good! I'd certainly come again.
author: Francis M.

description: Great breakfast. Had the avacado toast prepared three ways. It's a must visit. Be sure to get there early!
author: G W.

description: We ordered tonnnnsssss of food, we thought a sweet plate and a salty plate were going to be enough but OMG, it was way more than enough. We were full and we kept eating!
author: Carol C.

description: Light and delicious! Priceeeeeeeee tho, sorry guys , I just felt like the ambiance fit the price, the tree toast avocado, bacon, with sunny side egg! Absolutely good
author: Ivan C.

description: This place is amazing!! nothing short of 5 stars for sure. the service is great, even though they are always busy and the servers are running around, they still are super kind and sweet. the food is some of the best breakfast i've ever had. my boyfriend and I went here twice while visiting san francisco and we wish we could take some home with us! the berrie waffle was phenomenal and the russian hill frittatas were great too. the potatoes here are to die for and the iced coffee is amazing as well!! nothing but good things to say about this place and we will definitely be back next time we visit the city!
author: Makenna T.

description: Ate here twice. Employees are very nice and food is great. One visit I had the Vanilla Soy Chia Pudding and the next Berry French Toast. Both dishes were excellent. About 8:15 am or so the line starts building but they are quick to clean a table and get you seated.
author: Heather D.

description:
The bf and I stopped by here for breakfast after dropping off our dog at the groomer's in North Beach. We came by around 10 a.m. on a Saturday and were seated immediately. They were pretty busy, with just a few empty tables left. By the time we were done, maybe around 11-11:15-ish, there was a line. I assume that was the time when all the tourists finally got up and out. 

The servers looked really young -- maybe high schoolers? -- but they were really attentive and polite. After being seated, we were given menus and asked what we'd like to drink. Once we were ready, someone quickly took our order.

I had the Avocado Toast - Three Ways, and it was okay. The toast was over toasted and hard -- so hard that I couldn't cut it easily with a butter knife =/ The avocado was very fresh, but not seasoned at all so very bland. The sunny-side up egg was perfectly cooked though! Boyfriend had the Russian Hill frittata, which he enjoyed but it wasn't anything special as well. The best part was that each of our orders came with a generous serving of fresh fruit!

I feel like this is a good option for anyone looking to start their day out at Fisherman's Wharf/Pier 39 since the wharf is literally a block away. Other than that, I wouldn't make my way out here for the food.
author: Doris K.

description: So... I'm not sure if folks who liked the "waffles" are on crack. My waffle was actually a pancake with dimples in it. It tasted like it was made an hr ago and placed under a heat lamp. There's no crisp like how I like my waffle on the outside, I got served a spongy floppy matter. My Husband ordered a frittata and the cheeses were not melted. Our neighboring table had the same issue and sent their plate back. At this point I was over this place. Service was okay but definitely NOT coming back again.
author: Shawna C.

description:
They have the freshest and sweetest fruit!

What I ordered:
- Soy chia seed pudding
- Mixed berries waffle
- Nutella parfait
- Avocado trio

I came here for brunch and you may think it's a "hole in the wall" but this is a delicious "hole in the wall"! The servers and staff are friendly and while scrolling through pictures on yelp, it took me forever to decide what i wanted to eat. I was immediately drawn to ordering the soy chia seed pudding pictures. 

For avocado lovers, the avocado trio is a must-try! You won't regret trying it. This is a great place for foodies and those who love "cute" presentations of food.
author: Eva O.

description: Ate a huge belgium waffle covered in berries. Really beautiful plates came from the kitchen. 100% orange juice really good.
author: Migdarelis C.

description: Had to stand on the line for atleast 15-20 mins but aye! It was worth it! The serving of fruits was a lot! I was really surprised by it. The food were all very delicious! The servers just need to be a lil bit more friendly!
author: Ann T.

description: I always go there when I go to fishermen's wharf or when I go to the Patagonia store nearby. Food is great and very tasty. Frittata comes with potatoes and fresh fruits. They added a lot of health choices (chia seeds pudding and avocado toast) for the health conscious SF customers.  Service is always good and prompt. I definitely recommend here!
author: YY L.

description:
It was fresh and good. We expected more food for our money.
We weren't fans of them charging the tip ahead with a party of 4 or more. The cashier pointed it out on the menu. Almost double tipped.
author: Teresa N.

description: 3 adults,  1 small child, 4 happy diners! The Avocado Toast done 3 ways (order a side of perfect crispy bacon) was a fan favorite! The French toast came with a generous blueberry compote and a fruit bowl with perfectly ripe fruit! My carnivore eating husband ordered the yogurt parfait and was extremely happy! The service was quick, friendly,  and efficient; the wait time is worth it.
author: Chris S.

description: Great  Crepes and  fritatta options. Also enjoyed the coffee, not much going on with inside. Sitting outside would nice(bit drizzly on our visit)
author: Erin G.

description: The most delicious, healthy, and unique breakfast place in all of San Francisco! Love it!
author: Rebecca W.

description:
Absolutely delicious. I had the Avocado Toast  3 Ways (a Baby Boomer lowered his copy of the WSJ to glare at me as I ordered it) and was impressed with the great flavors achieved with such simple ingredients. The fruit bowl served as a side was yummy, unlike the anemic, flavorless stuff of many a diner. Good coffee, too. We had a wait of about a half hour on a Sunday midmorning--totally worth it. 

Restaurant is a bit cramped, but they play good upbeat music and the atmosphere feels appropriate. The staff was friendly and attentive despite how busy they were,  and we got to walk off our amazing breakfast I  Fisherman's Wharf, just outside the restaurant's front door. Awesome.
author: Kristi A.

description: A very cute breakfast/brunch place. Small interior with outside seating. Waited about 15 mins and they also can put your name down on the list in advance if you call. Food was delicious and service was quick and great.
author: Julie T.

description: Fantastic place to eat! The food was delicious, the service was incredibly efficient while everyone was very nice. I had the Avocado Toast 3 Ways and would eat it time and time again. I tasted the 9am crepe which was delicious too! It seems as though you can go wrong with anything on the menu. Highly recommend this place!
author: Brian G.

description:
Simply delish.  For our last morning In San Fran we decided to check this place out as we saw long lines all week.  We went in around 9am and were seated by 925.  It is a small place and always seems to be full, a good sign.

We had the Avocado toast (three ways), the caramelized banana French Toast, the croissant toasted with butter, and a simple scrambled egg dish.  Add to this sides of potatoes, fruit assortment, sausage, and bacon and you have the setting for a great meal.  

Sure enough the meal was awesome.  Great atmosphere, great food, and an overall enjoyable experience.  Coffee also was great!!!
author: Vinnie M.

description:
We ate the avocado toast three ways.
It's was deliciuos.
Is not cheap, but is a great treat.
I will go back.
Comparti con mi novio las tostadas con palta. Riquísima y abundantes. 
No es barato, pero vale la pena. 
Volvería.
author: Laurita R.

description: Came to San Francisco for the first time and needed a place to eat breakfast. We really had no idea where to go and had the Iintentions on going somewhere else. As we walked by I said we should go here, so we stopped by. Not only were the people very friendly but the place is adorable. Their food menu is something that you wouldn't expect based on how small it is. They have a very unique and delicious menu. This was a picture of my first visit. We also went there every day during our vacation. Their potatoes.... BOMB. My favorite is heir peanut butter, bacon, apple slices, and honey bagel. Perfectly toasted. I could literally go on and on. Avocado is fresh. I had hot tea and even had a yummy to go tea for my chilly walk back to the hotel. Recommend going here 100%
author: Amanda P.

description: Walking by and saw some delicious plates of people sitting outside so me and my gf decided to give t a try. Boy are we glad we did. The food is absolutely phenomenal. They have a plethora of options. I decided to get the banana nut waffles, while she got the two for bagel option with a side of fruit. The bagel choice allows you to choose 6 different tasty options for both of you bagel halves, while the cup or fruit is more than generous. The waffles came with large slices of bananas on top along with butter, whip cream and walnuts. By the end we were completely stuffed and satisfied to the point we definitely plan on coming many more times. Overall, staff was great and quick to check on you. While small, it is totally worth the wait. Would highly recommend.
author: Jeremiah G.

description: Loved this restaurant for breakfast. My son had a waffle, my husband a frittata and I had the 9AM crepe! Everything was sooo good! They do get busy but worth the short wait
author: Elle P.

description: That family owned diner feel with a great well oiled machine in the back.  Turnover is quick and efficient.  Fresh fruit, friendly people. My avocado toast was fantastic. It's situated in a lovely area to start a long walk through the neighborhoods.  Great start to your day in SF.
author: Heather D.

description:
Art #onfleek Food #onweak
#oooosnap #nothatinjustsayin
Colorful plating & photos make
the food look better than it tastes.

Menu physically reminded me of
itchen tory / weet aple / lackwood /
beachhouse, but not the execution.

Particularly, the potatoes appeared
well cooked yet had pronouncedly
underdone texture. They were also
room tempish despite their bowl
being warm. Odd. Off-batch?

Chinchillaxed service,
dope art. Dem drip jellyfish doe.
But I have to round down to 2. :(
author: Dan B.

description:
I definitely recommend 8am!
Great breakfast and service. We both could not finish our meal ands the fresh fruit cup is awesome!
author: Lou P.

description: Food was well presented but tasted ok. I wasn't wowed by anything. A little overpriced for what it was. Maybe because it's in the wharf? Service was excellent though: attentive, professional and prompt.
author: Nora J.

description: I give them a one for they bland breakfast and fruit toss it's a shasshay business with a fruit medly type of feel I had waffles and it's just a little fruit here sprinkle of this thier HERE ILL HAVE IT really....
author: Iz F.

description: Loved this place so much we ate breakfast here twice while on vacation in San Fran. The fruit that comes with the frittatas is a great variety. First trip I had the Russian Hill frittata. Second trip I had the Castro frittata. Both were great and piping hot! The staff was super friendly and though there was at times a line at the door, it moved very quickly. Highly recommend!
author: Kelli W.

description:
A quick Uber ride from my Union Square hotel dropped me at this highly rated breakfast joint. Even though it was a little chilly, we opted to sit outside in the fresh fall air - and the friendly server and hot coffee warmed us right up! It's just a little hike up from Fishermans Warf and has a much more neighborhood than tourist-y feel. 

There's nothing I like more than choices - and this place has it figured out. Want a bagel? But can't decide on sweet or savory? No problem, you can go in halves and get both! Want Avocado toast but can't decide on toppings? No worries! They serve avo toast three ways, and you can get all three on one dish! What?! Yeah I know hu? 

Be advised, other people like to have choices too, so the wait can be a little crazy. Even after 9am on a weekday there were only two outside tables available and I felt lucky to have snagged one as the one next to us filled up right after we sat down too. 

My dining pal has a ham and cheese crepe - I got a bite and it was super good. I went for the sweeter berry options and holy berries. I never thought I'd say this, but there were more berries than I could handle on this crepe! The fresh cream was sinfully good. I also ordered a side of scrambled eggs which were served in typical diner fashion - nothing fancy, but a good size for the price and I needed the protein. 

When in the city, take a moment to plan breakfast here - you'll love it! Cheers to our nice and attentive server.
author: Trish S.

description: An amazing experience. I walked in and was immediately sat and was asked what I wanted to drink. I blinked and my coffee was at my table. I had the Avocado toast three ways and it was amazing. Came with a nice fruit salad. I would recommend this place to anyone. Wish I lived in San Fran so I could visit again.
author: Laura M.

description: Amazing food... I would highly recommend. I ordered the '8AM' crepe and added bananas. It was delicious and the food was fast
author: Christy H.

description: This breakfast was remarkably delicious. We shared the French toast that comes with warm bananas & strawberries, they top it with a little (very little) ice cream & of course whipped cream. It's sweet, but so worth it. We shared it amongst 2 of us so it was perfect. The menu list good crepes, we had the 6AM & added spinach, it doesn't come with cream but all you have to do is request & you're all set. The cream really does make it, I don't remember the name but it's serve with the 12pm crepe.
author: Stephanie B.

description: What a wonderful find. Within walking distance of any hotels down in Fisherman's wharf. They have crepes and various fruit bowls with chia seeds and such. I had the blueberry croissant sandwich which was delicious. Have not seen a dessert for breakfast anywhere before. The price was reasonable for the area, service quick, but the place is small so I can imagine it having a long line at times. It was crowded when we came in but we got lucky and got seated right away.
author: Belinda N.

description: Great little diner with interesting menu & super-friendly service. Perfect for sidewalk breakfast. Recommend the frittatas & the Avocado toasts.
author: JJ W.

description: Nice little restaurant with fast service and friendly staff. Came here for breakfast and ordered a green tea latte, the Nob Hill frittata, the Avocado Toast. The green tea latte was good. The Frittata was excellent and came with a side of potatoes and fresh fruit. The fruit was fresh and wasn't your typical watery pre made fruit salad and the potatoes were well seasoned. The avocado toast came with three different types of bread and topped with a sunny side up egg on one, tomatoes on the other and bacon on the last which we substituted with smoked salmon. Overall, the breakfast was healthy and the food was fresh and delicious.
author: Cynthia L.

description: This is not for the food as I wasn't able to eat here. Came on a Sunday morning and walked in. Tons of wait staff around working hard as it was pretty busy and there was a line. Still - not greeted by a single employee! I obviously looked very confused and was hoping to find a host to be put on the list for a table. I awkwardly waited, tried to make eye contact. Finally I stopped an employee and asked how long the wait was. He asked me if I had written down my name on the list. He then suggested that it would be 45min-1 hour for the wait and sped off. I understand being very busy as I used to work in restaurants. Still - I think that greeting a confused customer is very important. Seems like this place probably has amazing food so they didn't feel like they needed to worry about losing a customer over poor service? ... Very disappointed.
author: Lizzy D.

description: Best breakfast around food was delicious and large portions! Expect a bit of a wait to get seated but well worth it. Staff is very attentive and food rolls out quick. French Toast was to die for hubbys frittata was quite tasty.
author: Nicole L.

description: Decent neighborhood brunch spot, good selection of frittatas and such. The avocado toast trip is simple and satisfying, I will definitely be back.
author: Allison S.

description: Five star food and great service but they're obviously a very busy restaurant that is doing well and they should show the customers a little appreciation by cleaning it up. It's absolutely filthy
author: Cynthia H.

description: Place was small and cramped. And that's the only downside. Otherwise this is the place to go for breakfast! Picture perfect cuisine only matched in looks by its taste. Friendly staff, clean facilities, healthy portions, and a relaxed environment. Of course, like most restaurants the thing that keeps this place afloat is the food, and this place does not disappoint. Definitely recommend.
author: Daniel R.

description:
Amazing service: friendly, attentive
Great food: delicious, good portions, presented mindfully (not just thrown on the plate)
Interesting menu: frittatas named for the neighborhoods (great way to introduce tourists to SF)

I'm happy to see Eight AM so close to the more tourist-y parts of San Francisco.  With welcoming staff and solid food they put visitors in a the right mood to make the most of a trip.  The attentiveness is some of the best I've seen in a restaurant: they were completely present without being overbearing.

A quick warning on the frittatas.  They can take longer than other dishes to make and the kitchen may put out food as they make it (who wants cold potatoes?) so, if you order one of these tasty items, be prepared to see other food come out before your dish does.  Fear not! Your patience well be well rewarded with cheesy, veggy, meaty (if that's your thing) goodness.
author: Vlad L.

description:
Delicious place . A little expensive but you get a lot of food . Fresh OJ and delicious coffee . You sign your name on a clip board they don't have a line for the wait . 
The service was fast and the people super friendly . 
We got the triple toast and the waffles . Delicious !
author: Erika S.

description: Food was great, especially the potato side. Frittata was delicious too. Staff was friendly and the chef came out to ask each table how their meal was. Had to wait roughly 25 minutes for a table inside but the hostesses were kind and thanked us for waiting.
author: Mari S.

description: What a great place!! Everything is made so fresh! They served our food very quickly, had incredibly attentive service, and all workers were very friendly.  Great place -- and way -- to start your day!
author: Zuly M.

description: This place is AMAZING!! Came down to San Fran from the big Apple and was more then impressed!! The fruit is sooo fresh, the eggs are fluffy, and the potatoes are to die for. Definitely worth every pound I gained!
author: Jennifer G.

description: Adorable place! We brave the rain and wind, waited for over 20mins (standing in the rain), and finally made it to a table... The trio avocado toast was great and my dungness crab frittata (fisherman's wharf) was good - it had an abundance of crab meat, but i didn't feel the frittata as a whole was that tasty. Loved the amount of fresh fruit they provide, but 1 blackberry and 1 raspberry in each bowl felt a bit budgeted,,, Comparing to Hollywood cafe, where they provided more than an handful of fresh berries, I would provided go back to Hollywood cafe over Eight AM.
author: Jenny Z.

description: After passing by tourist trap after tourist trap down by the water, we were grateful to randomly stumble upon this cute breakfast place! The bagel "fixups" were exactly what we needed! Service was fast and friendly, and menu reasonably priced. And the fruit cup was a real fruit cup; more than just melon and cantaloupe ;) Thanks for starting our day off right.
author: Jennifer S.

description: A great place for breakfast. And my recommendation is Frittata. Potatoes are cooked very different compared to other places and I liked it (add some salt and pepper and it feels tastes aloo fry from India). Very close to fisherman wharf. Try it and you won't be disappointed. Again this is a small place so good for party of 6 or small.
author: Puneet K.

description:
Awesome food and vibe. Def a must visit if you are in the area! We had the avocado toast, waffles with berries, and 2 different fritattas. All were delicious! The service was great also. The waiters were friendly and prompt with serving. The art on the walls was a 
Very impressive array from local artists and really fun to look at.
author: Luana C.

description:
i came here with a party of 4 on a saturday at 10:30am. it took us about 15 minutes to be seated which wasn't bad. there is outdoor seating in case you have a pet with you. the inside of the restaurant is like a sauna. there are no fans or AC. we were seated in the back next to the restroom so it wasn't too bad for us.

i ordered the avocado three way toast (bacon, egg, and tomato on each toast) because it looks "instagrammable". it didn't take them too long to bring out our orders. this was my first eating toast with avocado spread. i would say my favorite of the 3 toasts is the bacon one since that one actually had flavor. the egg toast was a bit flavorless. and i'm not a fan of tomatoes haha. i really enjoyed the bowl of fruits though. you have a nice variety of bananas, raspberries, blackberries, strawberries, blueberries, cantalope, honeydew, and pineapple!

the service was great. our waiter made sure to check up on every table to see if their customers needed a water or coffee refill. the restaurant isn't too big, so it's harder to get seated for big groups. i'll definitely come back here to try other breakfast dishes!
author: Sylvia H.

description: Came at 10am on a Saturday (party of 2) and it was about a 30 min wait. The staff were friendly and the food was delicious. French toast with bananas and the three way avocado are the go tos!
author: Valerie K.

description: The wait wasn't too bad. Food was ok. Service terrible. We waited about 30 min after giving our order to get our food. Turns out they gave our order to someone else. People who sat down after us were eating their food well before we got our. It was super hot in the place and we weren't even offered water. I had to ask 3 times before someone finally brought it. For our trouble we were given free coffee!! It's one thing to make a mistake, but not own up to it (they played down their error like it wasn't their fault). I won't come back here but the food wasnt bad. My omelette had too much cheese but the avocado toast was good
author: Joy V.

description: We just had a fabulous breakfast at Eight AM! We picked it due to its close proximity to our hotel, and were able to walk right in and grab a seat at a table by the open window. My boyfriend ordered the crepe with Nutella and banana, and I ordered the Avocado Toast 3 ways. Both were delicious. My avocado toasts were topped respectively with bacon, a fried egg and a fresh tomato. The side of fruit that came with it was fresh and delicious. We inhaled it all! To top it off, service was fast and efficient.
author: Sarah G.

description:
Excellent  breakfast! I'm not quite sure what the hype is about the avocado in 3 ways (the avocado tasted pretty ordinary) but it was still enjoyable and the fruit was so fresh! 

The restaurant is really small and it felt really hot inside but after a while you don't notice it. A big plus is that the food quality was excellent and the servers were very attentive, making several visits to our table to make sure we were ok. 

Another big plus is that although it's within a reasonable walking distance from Fisherman's  Wharf,  it's not over run by tourists.
author: Nasha W.

description: Got the avocado toast which was good, although I felt like I could have made it myself so definitely a little overpriced. No wait on a Saturday at 10:30 so that's definitely a plus!
author: Rebecca L.

description: The waiters (Gabe and both Ryans) were super friendly and quick to take my order. I ordered the Avocado Toast 3 ways and I had nice conversations with them throughout my entire meal. They came to check in with me often to make sure I was fully accommodated. 10/10 would recommend :)
author: Kyne W.

description:
I still think about this breakfast nearly a year later - it was that good.

I've tried making it myself but it's just not the same.

Simple food made with amazing ingredients and served with love.
author: Ben C.

description:
I came with my family and we all enjoyed our meal! Very friendly staff and warm inside. Our food arrived quickly. The food comes out so detailed and appealing. 
Some cons (although the food does make up for it):
The orange juice didn't taste super fresh and tasted like it was a couple days old. 
Our server forgot to bring us half & half for the coffee twice but another server helped us and apologized for the inconvenience. Lastly, I didn't mind the music but my parents didn't like the genre of music very much. But they did very much love their meal. Although our server wasn't super attentive to us the other staff were and I appreciate that. We'll for sure come back! Thank you eight am!
author: Jessica C.

description: There was a bit of a wait but I guess that is what you get when the restaurant is delicious. Everyone that worked there was super cool. The food was delicious and worth the wait. Definitely a spot to checkout for breakfast.
author: Benita J.

description: So good! Was told to go here from a friend and was completely impressed! Toast trio was amazing!!
author: Casey B.

description: Simple flavorful selections with wonderful service. Crazy fresh and delicious , especially the fruit cup. Loved it.
author: Christine A.

description: Great little breakfast spot!  Good people run the place.  I made a special  request since I am vegan and absolutely adored my avocado toast with tomato, zucchini and arugula! Really enjoyed myself here.  Healthy and yummy!
author: Jessica B.

description: Eight AM breakfast had a short line for Sunday Breakfast. It wasn't too bad of a wait at all. The location is small and has about four tables outside, although the rain is consistently on and off depending on the day. Service is quick and they serve various types of crepes and avocado toasts for breakfast!
author: Steven W.

description: The service was excellent, we got our food very quickly, and the food was the freshest we have seen. Definitely a place to go for breakfast!
author: Natalie W.

description: Randomly stumbled upon this restaurant for brunch, and It was an amazing choice. Great customer service, great food, great prices! Highly recommend this place! I will definitely be coming back
author: Olivia G.

description: My Favorite breakfast place in the City. Great things come in small packages they say...this is a small place with great people and great food. Efficiently run business, friendly staff, warm people, and delicious food. I recommend this to locals and tourists. The place I go when I have guests over and it never disappoint us. This place is a treasure the City has. Keep it up guys!!!!
author: Henry Vanden B.

description: Berry waffle is amazing. So is the avocado toast! Friendly staff and cooks. Get here early because the lines get long very quickly
author: David Y.

description: The French toast with caramelized bananas was delicious! Can be too sweet if your don't like sweets but it was perfect for us. Lost a star because the toast for the avocado was too hard and very hard to cut into and/ or bite. Besides that the taste of it was still great! Sweet and perfect with the side of fruits that comes with it.
author: L N.

description:
An awesome breakfast spot located about 3 blocks away from fisherman's wharf.

I tried the egg frittata with vegetables. It came with potatoes and a generous side of fresh fruit. For about $14, it was a pricey brunch but came with a lot of food. I tried my fiancé's waffle as well. They were great and smothered in fresh berries.

The service was awesome and our waters were kept filled throughout the brunch. When you enter, sign in- it was a short wait for us and then we got seated. It is a pretty small space filled with cool artwork.

Enjoy your brunch!
author: Meg M.

description: This place was fantastic! So good we went back the very next day! Staff was super nice and food came quick. Absolutely recommend
author: Miles W.

description:
Decided to work half day and take off early to grub.  It was a Monday and a lot of the brunch places were closed but luckily this place was open and empty.

Avocado Toast 3 ways- Not only did the ingredients LOOKed fresh but it TASTEd fresh as well.  This simple yet satisfying dish was light, healthy, and delicious.  As good as it was on its own, a dash of tabasco elevated the dish to something more amazing.

Frittata- the frittata and potatoes had good flavor

Both dishes came with a bowl filled with lots of fresh fruits, perfect for hot weather.

This is probably one of my top breakfast/brunch places in SF.  Will definitely come back.
author: Linda N.

description: Definitely a great little breakfast/brunch spot in an expensive area. The food is actually fairly priced and if you order a fruttata, you definitely get your money's worth! Service is organized, quick and friendly. I'll definitely be coming back to try their crepes.
author: Stacey D.

description: Mediocre food and pretty bad service. I know they were busy but my friend ordered water and a side of toast two or three times. He didn't even get the toast until we were done eating and ready to pay. My frittata was lackluster - bland and boring. However, they don't skimp on the fruit!
author: Julia M.

description: If you want a good breakfast spot with awesome people look no further. Great variety and and portion size. not only does it look good but taste amazing. Definetly going back.
author: Rima M.

description:
Decided to come here for breakfast with my boyfriend. 
The location is near Fisherman's Wharf, so be prepared for street parking!

This restaurants has a wait, but if you call in they can put your name on the list. 
They offer both indoor and outdoor seating. It's just unfortunate that they don't have a heater outside for those seated outside. It can get quite windy and the tables are also small. The restaurant itself is very intimate. 

As far as the food goes, we ordered the avocado toast 3 ways. The order came with toast with a heirloom tomato, bacon, eggs, and a cup of fruits. Although it did taste fresh, it was something that could be made at home and overpriced. I'm not too sure what the rave above this place is but it seems very basic. I don't think it's worth the wait or pricing.
author: Irene O.

description:
Food was good, I liked how they took your name on the phone and didn't have to wait too long when we got there.

Minus 1 star because they forgot my order.
Minus another star because they kept making excuses instead of owning up to the fact that they forgot it. I asked one guy who said "oh, it's coming" when it clearly wasn't. I asked another guy, who said "they're finishing it up right now" when it wasn't even started. I can SEE the kitchen, the guy was working on other dishes -- not mine.

In the end, my order came out after everyone else at my table was done eating but the food was good and they comped my meal. Hopefully my experience will be better next time, if I decide to come back.
author: Sharon C.

description: Avocado Toast Three Ways was delicious.... Had to share each one with the table. Simple concept but extremely tasty. Crepes are light and filling. Coffee on point. Good service! A great stop in the warf area for breakfast. Would come back again.
author: Holly B.

description:
Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful.
If only I didn't live so gosh darn far away I would dine here on the regular. Delightfully fresh food options. Every bite was better than the previous. The OJ, er mah gersh, STELLAR!  The pineapple in the fruit cup rivaled that I've enjoyed in Maui.  It was a beautiful day so I dined al fresco.
author: S T.

description:
For our anniversary weekend, my boyfriend and I went up to SF for an overnight stay. After looking up different breakfast/brunch places, we chose Eight AM because we figured we hadn't been to a restaurant with their kind of menu down in SJ. After looking at the photos, I think it's safe to say this restaurant is on the healthy side haha, which is what we needed after eating junk the night before.

It's a small little place with a few outdoor tables. We were able to snag a table without waiting. 

As much as I wanted an orange juice, after reading Yelp reviews and seeing the $6 price tag on it, I stuck with water. (I also saw how small the glass was and felt it wasn't worth $6, even if it was so-called freshly hand squeezed.)

I ordered the blueberry shortcake, which is a huge butter croissant with blueberries and vanilla pudding inside, with a side of a bowl of fruit. My boyfriend ordered the avocado toast 3 ways (2 bacons, one egg... he felt the tomato was too boring) and we both wanted to try what was so great about the chia seed pudding.
I thought I wasn't going to be full from the blueberry shortcake, but it seemed to fill me up. And surprisingly, they don't skimp you with the fruit in the fruit bowl!! The bowl is full of pineapples, melons, honeydew, grapes, blueberries, strawberries, blackberries, and raspberries. The chia seed pudding LOOKED sooo good and sweet, however, it was extremely bland. Maybe that's really how it was supposed to taste, but I was expecting it to be sweet and flavorful. My bf said his avocado toast was bland as well. He ended up not eating all three pieces of toast. He, too, was full from other stuff we ordered. 

The service is fast and they're all pretty friendly/attentive. But the price tags on the food... not too great about it. The taste of some of the food wasn't worth the hefty price. I know the prices are appropriate for a San Francisco restaurant, but ehh. I mean, portions are great. I think all of the dishes come with a bowl of fruit. I really like how different the menu is, but I wish it had more flavor.
author: Steffi G.

description: Wow! An excellent breakfast and a very thoughtful and helpful staff. Definitely worth trying.
author: Leon W.

description: Delicious. All good food.  Suggestion to have kids menu. Fruit cup is great side and super fresh! Lots of salmon on lox bagel and avocado toast was a great meal. Walk up surprise.
author: Brendan R.

description: Wow! Outstanding brunch! We waited about 10-15 minutes on a Sunday and it was definitely worth it! Menu is simple but everything is great! We ordered bagel two ways and sugar waffle... both were beautiful and delicious. Seasonal fruit also outstanding. One thing I loved about it was the staff... everyone was helping out from bringing out the food to clearing dishes... very efficient!
author: Kristen W.

description: Amazing Food, Staff & environment. Eight Am is a top pick for me every time I visit the city. From bagels to crepes you will not be disappointed. The presentation is beautiful and it tastes even better. Simple foods with savory flavors. This is a MUST try.
author: Jazzmine B.

description:
Fantastic! The fruit is sooo fresh! Each person in our family got something different. Delicious! 

Blueberry shortcake croissant, avacado toast three way, Betty waffle and height ash bury frittata!
author: Robin D.

description: Just enjoyed an excellent breakfast here. I eat low carb, so breakfast places are normally always a hit, but the menu here as written would not have many conducive choices. I asked the waiter if I could just get a bunch of side items, and they accommodated. I had some lox and cream cheese, side of bacon, 2 eggs and some avocado. Delicious. I'll be back.
author: Mark C.

description: Very California cool place that serves organic breakfast. Healthy portions of everything you order and the avocado toast was a favorite. Ordered too many items that came with bread so got stuffed. Almost every dish has a side of fruit as well. Worth a visit if going to the waterfront.
author: Tony T.

description: Love love love this spot! It's a very unassuming restaurant on the way to Fisherman's Wharf. We were staying in the Financial District and had an easy walk from the hotel to Eight AM. We got there right before the crowd - around 8 am on a Sunday - before our Alcatraz Cruise. Easy to see how this place could get crowded quickly, a line was forming when we left. Portions are generous, prices reasonable and the service was great. Very friendly servers really there to see you smile and make sure you enjoyed your meal. We walked by again around 3 pm and a few of the servers were laughing outside as the restaurant had closed - nice to know they actually enjoy each other. Great place for easy low key breakfast in San Francisco!!
author: Caitlin B.

description:
In town for the weekend and saw the rave reviews. Everything was excellent! So much food and so delicious! Avocado toast  and fresh fruit 

Service was great and a really clean and fun atmosphere. Definitely recommend.
author: Daren F.

description: Avocado toast 3 different ways was delicious! Mixed berry waffles were great also. Definitely recommend and will come back in our next visit to the city by the bay.
author: Helen B.

description:
My wife and I try to go to different breakfast places when we come to the city. This morning we both browsed through Yelp and neither we couldn't find anything we could agree upon. Then I saw Eight AM, looked at the pictures and said to my wife "let's try this place. She looked it up, saw the Avocado Toast and said "I'm in!!!"

After a nearly a mile and quarter walk, we reached our destination. There were a lot of people hanging outside and it looked full inside. I'm thinking @This is going to be at least a half hour wait. But within 15 minutes we got a table.

Our server (also named Daryl) was super nice.
I had the fruitta and my wife had already mentioned Avocado Bacon Toast. 

My meal was great. More importantly it came quickly and it was hot. It had more potatoes than I needed but that was fine. 

We were in and out within 45 minutes.

This is definitely a must do again.
author: Darryl L.

description: So delicious, no wait and fresh food. The coffee was okay. I'd give a 4.5 if possible. Their fruit was amazing. I had the bagel two way.
author: N R.

description:
Great place for a normal sized breakfast, the soy lattes are AMAZING. Service was quick and easy too. If you like a fast healthy breakfast, I highly recommend this place. 

I only rated it  4 out of 5 because the fruit wasn't ripped and the avocado spread was way too much.
author: Maritza J.

description:
Great food!
Cozy spot looks modern and very attentive staff! 
We tried the toasted avocado toast 3 ways. It was tasty! And full of flavor!
We also tried the raspberry croissant sandwich!
Omg it was a dream!!!!! Try it!!    
The orange juice and latte beverages were good too. And so were the fruit salads. 
It was not crowded at all on a Monday at 10am!
It was just right and the food was delicious!
author: Vera D.

description:
The three of us came here on a Saturday morning, and were expecting a long wait but they try really hard to get you seated. We called ahead to get our name on the list and then just waited 15min.

I ordered the "Bagel Two Ways" ($13) - (1) with avocado and egg (over medium) and (2) with scrambled eggs, mayo, and cheese. On a croissant instead of a bagel ($1 extra) both were very delicious and it was served with fresh fruit (also yummy). I was slightly apprehensive about the mayo but it was soooo good! Thought the bagel two ways was kinda expensive at $14 for what it was but it was good. 

The other two people ordered the "Castro" frittata and the "Haight Asbury" frittata. No complaints from either, except that one wished there was less cheese on it. 

Overall the food tastes great and the service was awesome - they were very quick in trying to get us seated, including last minute changes to our order without being annoyed, and accommodating changes to what was written in the menu. 

It's really close to fisherman's wharf with 2hr street parking nearby so check it out if you are in the area.
author: Dipika S.

description: Close walk from Fisherman's Wharf. You know this place is going to be good when they have a wait list before 9 am. It tends to be hot inside the restaurant so being seated outside was perfect for us. French toast is really delicious with the fresh fruit on top. Husband chose the Three-way toast with poached eggs, avocado, and bacon--he ate every bite. Really nice staff. Definitely will come for breakfast/brunch here again!
author: Allison C.

description: Great breakfast choices, very reasonably priced. The service is excellent, wait staff dry attentive. Will be a favorite when in the Bay Area.
author: Craig R.

description: Only 2 credit cards per table possible, they charge 18% automated gratuity (which is illegal in California!), food was good though
author: Steven Z.

description:
Weekly brunch with Stefanie C. means we get to try new places and hang out and catch up. Sometimes I'll be honest and I don't even truly remember what we talked about for the hours we hang out together. 

We decided on this place the week before heading here because it was a couple places on brunch spots in the the City. So we trekked all the way from Castro here. Seeing lots of tourists on the way of course. 

We ended up ordering 3 things: chia seed pudding, avocado toast, and the castro frittata. 

The Chia seed pudding was okay. I think the last time I had chia seed pudding it was made with coconut milk and coconut pieces so it gave the pudding a bit more flavor. It was okay with the fruit and nuts on top. 

Avocado toast comes 3 ways (tomato, fried egg, and bacon). I do love the egg one because I love a good runny sunnyside up egg. The bacon was also good, but now I do wonder what it would taste like with both the egg and bacon...hmmm. 

The final dish was the Castro frittata. The frittata was really just okay. Honestly, I expected a bit more and the eggs were rubbery. Not great. The potatoes that came with it were just average too. 

Overall, we got great service, but the food was up and down. 

Protip: avocado toast!
author: Nina Y.

description:
Amazing avocado toast three ways!!! True garden tomato with amazing flavor, orange egg yolks with real flavor and best of all the bacon, well maybe the wonderful fresh bread toasted underneath!
The green tea latte was to die for and the service was efficient and very timely!
author: John B.

description: Breakfast here is ideal . It's so good I loved it. Service was great and our food was quick. I ordered green tea latte something, definitely not my cup of tea. Good flavor something I personally did not like.
author: Evelyn L.

description:
Loved this place! Cute little spot serving really unique brunch fare. My husband got the avocado toasts (3 different styles) and I got the bagels, which have a selection of toppings (I did avocado & egg and PB & bacon). I adored mine. Hubby was mostly happy with his, but honestly he only likes white bread and the toasts came on "exotic" choices, like whole grain.
