The only downside is that there's no AC, and we went on that weekend that was 100 degrees. Luckily we had outdoor seating, but if you were inside you were sweltering. But hey--it's SF...when is it going to be THAT hot again?
author: Claudia W.

description: Fabulous food!!! They looked understaffed (only 2 waiters), but did perfectly serving all their customers. I got the French toast with caramelized banana and let me tell you it was the best French toast I've ever had.. EVER! Such a fan of French toast with sourdough. My friend got the frittata (Russian Hill) and it was perfect as well. We also got a side of bacon that was cooked exactly right. 100% would recommend!!!!!
author: Michelle P.

description: Really large portions and great breakfast. I had the Castro frittata and my BF had French toast; both were amazing. Mine even had a really nice sized fruit plate with fresh fruit.
author: Danielle S.

description: Wow! Perfect start to our day before heading up to hike Muir Woods.  We were seated right away (miraculously a long line formed right after we arrived). Service was fast and friendly. The owner stopped by our table and we were glad to share how perfect our breakfast was. Avocado 3 ways w smoked salmon was big enough for two (though I managed to finish most of it).  Side helping of fruit was fresh and generous and delicious. Love this place!
author: El V.

description: Great breakfast spot. Fritata was awesome! Very friendly staff. My Cafe Mocha was very good. Get there early! This place is a hot spot and a line forms shortly after eight!
author: Bob L.

description:
The AMAZING food was paired with stellar service & creative plating.  It was well worth the 15 minute wait & price.  

I got the avocado toast 3 ways.  It was nutritious & perfectly portioned - plus, they used flavorful & whole ingredients (heirloom tomatoes)!  

My 10 yr old son got the waffle with berries, which was literally awesome enough for him to sing about - a good kid choice.  I loved the plating - they used a miniature Moscow Mule mug for syrup.

 My husband got the Hoyt-Ashbury frittata, a very savory  & filling meal. 

My 12 year old daughter got the caramelized banana crepes, which were absolutely fantastic.  They were UNBELIEVABLE.  The sauce easily put it into dessert status.  

The staff was super friendly, despite the constant crowd.  1 server was watching over 10 tables flawlessly.  The staff was working very well together - the cook delivered my plate to me.  The prices reflected the level of service and quality we received.  I know this post was gushing - but we were THAT impressed.
author: Rachel A.

description: Love this little dinner. Desperately needed coffee and good breakfast by Lombard street on the way to Fishermen's wharf and found this great spot. Service was amazing right from the start. Good coffee, excellent portions and cute atmosphere, especially by the windows. Definitely will come back
author: Rachael S.

description: Awesome and worth the wait. It's a tight squeeze but they graciously accommodated my party of 9. Yummy frittatas, delicious waffles, matcha green tea latte with almond milk was perfect.
author: Renee G.

description: The restaurant is very stuffy and small, their silverware and water glasses had lipstick all over them. The reason i gave it a 3 star is because their banana french toast was one of the best i've ever had. Aside from that, the place really isn't worth going back to.
author: Sarah A.

description:
Deducted a star just because of the wait time to get in.
Food was amazing! Coffee was expensive, but delicious. Will definitely return here next time I'm in SF.
author: Katie G.

description:
What an amazing place to eat! We dodged a bullet by coming here instead of the diner up a couple doors. We were seated within a couple of minutes and had hot coffee on our table quickly after our drink order was placed.

I had the Castro frittata. It came with potatoes and a bowl of fruit. My girlfriend had the bagel two ways, one with cream cheese and fruit, the other with guacamole, ham, and an egg. We both basically licked our plates clean!

I do need to bring some attention to one detail, every single meal comes with a bowl of fruit. Not a little saucer like most places, but a legit bowl. It isn't just one or two fruit....but 9 different types of fruit. What is more insane than the variety in that bowl was the fact that all of them were ripe. Every piece of fruit was sweet and perfect in every way.

San Francisco has certain staples which people must try when visiting, and Eight AM is one of them.
author: Matthew J.

description: Excellent quality, attention and delicious food. I mean everything is fresh and on point! They have a great variety of items to choose from. My bf got the frittata and I got the banana french toast. Both home runs!
author: Christina S.

description:
The best breakfast place!
The guacamole 3 way was fabulous. And great staff. Will definitely return here again!
author: Linda E.

description:
Great breakfast place, one of the few that opens early. Everyone raved about the toast three ways so had to try it. Glad I did. Was curious what heirloom tomatoes I'd get, it was of the green variety. 

Wife got the lox bagel and I have to admit it was maybe better than mine, but it did not come with the giant fruit bowl.

 Staff was friendly and service was good. We were in and out in about 45 mins. The prices are reasonable.

Nina Y and Stefanie C were not there this morning, so that was a bonus because their comments creeped us out a little.
author: Matt C.

description: When you walk in your greeted by friendly employees and a delicious smell. It's very warm inside with plenty of seating and a few seats outside. Everything here looked so amazing but I couldn't resist how the berry waffle looked on the many tables I saw it on. And I am SO happy with my choice. It was melt in your mouth good and the berries were a great sweet addition. Overall it was a pleasant experience and at the end the cook came by and asked how it was which I thought was very personal and great customer service. I'd come back for brunch again.
author: Bridget B.

description:
We waited about 15-20 minutes and we sat outside so that we didn't have to wait 20 more minutes. It was cold and we were not prepared but we are prepared enough to enjoy our breakfast outside. The food kind of all came at different times. My mother and I shared the fruit waffle which was amazing and completely finished it before my kids breakfast came out. But they did not mind because they had a hot chocolate that was the size of me. Haha. The service was excellent our server's name was Ryan. The owner's name was Danny and he was busting his butt running around cleaning and helping out around the restaurant which is really nice to see because I'm in the business and my managers never help us servers. It is rare that they actually walk around and help. The kids had their banana nut French toast which tasted like dessert but they enjoyed it. The bagel with cream cheese was amazing and I had the Nutella parfait which was loaded with fresh fruit. We will definitely be back. 2 adults and 2 kids and we even shared rather than everyone ordering their own dish and our meal with tip was 80 bucks! But it was worth it :)
I did find it odd that the gratuity was added on a party of 4. Again, i dont mind, but that was the first time I have ever been charged gratuity on a four-top. Where I am from in Sacramento you have to have eight or more usually. Maybe that is the Way San Francisco is. Just thought I would throw that out there.
author: JEN M.

description: This is an incredible find! Small, quaint eatery with truly unique menu and extremely fresh. Not what you would expect from a whole in the wall eatery. Definitely will return!
author: Kelsey C.

description: I was really excited about the crepes, but once I started to dig in, it was basically just crepe & strawberries. Although still delicious, I was hoping for a bit more substance. I'm still hungry, but for the prices, not willing to order more. Good atmosphere though. They are very quick with everything. It's a small place so there may be a wait. I waited less than 5 minutes for a party of one. I'll return, but order something else.
author: Krystie B.

description: Awesome local place! Friendly service and unique menu with very fresh ingredients.  We had crepes which were thin and light. I had the bagel toppers. One of the best restaurant breakfasts I have had. A little spend but well worth it!
author: Andy C.

description: Not a long line, and a great breakfast! I got the waffle with fresh fruit, and it was really good. My boyfriend got the avocado and toast with salmon. The fruit was really fresh. Everything was great, we have no complaints!
author: Susannah H.

description: Easily the best brunch we had on our quick vacation to SF.  Great, affordable breakfast options and everything was delicious!  The side of fresh fruit was the best I've ever had.  We will go back next time we're in northern CA!
author: Andrea R.

description:
We had the avocado toast! It's delicious. We ordered an extra side of eggs to add to the protein of the meal. We got to sit outside - we were lucky, someone was getting up just as we arrived. The service is quick and friendly.  There is a wheelchair accessible bathroom, although to get to the bathroom you have to pass all the tables, and it's very narrow; everyone had to pull their chair in for me to get by.
Great breakfast choice!
author: AB H.

description: Great breakfast. Got the Noe valley frittata. Potatoes were well seasoned, did not need anything extra. Frittata was delicious. Come here you won't regret it.
author: Jeff T.

description: Another breakfast restaurant walking distance from our hotel. Man o man what a place to eat. Service was great and food to die for. Place is a little small but you get seated quick. Everything we ordered was ridiculously good with flavor and so fresh. Avocado toast meal with egg, bacon, and tomato. Banana Nut Waffle with pecan nuts!! 6am crepe with eggs, ham, and cheese. Scrambled eggs with bacon and potatoes. Coming back tomorrow morning and before we leave. Must check this place out when in San Fran and around Fishermans Warf.
author: Darwin I.

description: Amazing breakfast! Excellent service if we ever return to SF this is going to be our go to spot for the am meal
author: Ana M.

description: This restaurant is around my hotel. I always come to there to have a brunch. The avocado three ways is my favorite brunch.
author: Ti F.

description:
Absolutely delectable breakfast!!

It seems like a father/son duo mainly run this breakfast locale. The son was busting his butt to seat people, clean tables, run orders out, etc etc. and he kept things moving at a good pace! The inside is small, and we had a short wait to get in, but again, they were very accommodating to get us in quickly. Also, kudos to the patrons who were willing to pay for their meals, and then finish their coffees/last bits of food on the outside seats, to allow new customers to sit! That was so awesome!

I was sooooooooo stumped on what to order. There were so many amazing sounding options- french toast, avocado toast, bagels split in half with lots of toppings on each side, frittatas, croissants... wow... I could've come here for many meals and not been bored! Since we had a long day ahead, we opted for a more protein-fortified option. I got the frittata with apple sausage and manchego cheese in it, which comes with potatoes and a fruit bowl.

The frittata was delicious! It had a good amount of sausage in it, and you could really taste the unique flavor to it. The potatoes were plentiful, well seasoned, and hot. And the fruit bowl?? I've never been so impressed by fruit! Usually a fruit bowl with breakfast comes with some anemic looking cantaloupe and honeydew, and maybe a chunk of pineapple. This one had both melons for the base, but also a beautiful banana half, blueberries, kiwi and pineapple on it. It was awesome!!

Most entrée orders were about $12-$15, but the quality and quantity are there. Highly recommended!!
author: Suzanne B.

description: Amazing great service. I had the Haight Ashbury with bacon frittata and WOW delicious. It came with a beautiful bowl of fruit. My sister had the avocado toast 3-way she said "I'm a changed women".
author: Mrs S.

description: Good breakfast, it's gets expensive pretty quick and automatic gratuity added for parties of 4. OJ is $6 for a glass.  The fruit bowl that comes with the entrees is very good.
author: Nick G.

description: I don't know what to say, other than 5 Star.  Wow!  I came to Eight AM after a 5k run and it was perfect.  I had the 3 Avocado toast breakfast which was 1 avo toast with bacon, 1 avo toast with egg, and 1 avo toast with heirloom tomato slices.  Heavenly.  And a nice bowl of fresh fruit on the side.  Love this spot and will definitely be back.  Not only was the food awesome, the service also friendly,quick and attentive.  We didn't have to wait for a table at all - I think we just lucked out with timing, because the place was full but we were seated immediately.  Great spot - definitely try it out.
author: Melissa S.

description: Short wait in line was well worth it. Delicious breakfast with nice generous portion of fresh fruit. Fritatta was fluffy and cooked perfectly. French toast was two huge pieces topped with a delicious compote. Fresh squeezed OJ. What more could you want?!? We'll be back for sure!
author: Michael S.

description: Long lines but really delicious food items. Fast service, friendly staff. You will enjoy the ingredients. Definitely worth it.
author: Can I.

description: Very nice. My friends and I went here for a special occasion, and they went out of their way to make it feel special.
author: Dana R.

description:
Wait: It was full when we got here. It's a small place so that was understandable but we ended up waiting about an hour for a table. They also seated a bunch of people who came after us which was okay at first since they were parties of two but they seated a table of 8 (who came after us) before us that was not really fair.

Service: The servers were full of smiles. Came to get our orders right away. Once we got our food, servers stopped coming by and completely didn't look our way. We didn't get any water refills. Had to track down the server to get the check. 

Food: Got the Avocado Toast 3 ways. I substituted the tomato for the bacon for no charge. We also got the sugar waffle, and eggs and sausage. Food was good. Each meal came with small bowl of fruit, and was a good sized portion. The food was a little overpriced.
author: Nozomi M.

description:
I came Monday at 8 AM with my family. The restaurant was full but it was 5-10 minutes wait time till we got in. We ordered the avocado toast and tow way bagels and sugar waffles. The bagels was really good I love it the strawberry and cream cheese is delicious!! 
The service is really fast.
I love that they offer different types of coffee and my cappuccino was great!
author: Sara A.

description: This little place was adorable and service great food. Although the place was packed the service was still lacking as I keep running out of my drinks. Additionally the place was extremely hot and I felt like passing out. Overall good place to eat and would go back again.
author: Stephanie L.

description: The best breakfast in San Fran thus far. The frittata was delicious. Not to mention the bacon was perfectly cooked and the French toast with carmelized bananas was perfect for any sweet tooth!
author: Tatiana Y.

description: Delicious breakfast at reasonable prices with great vegetarian options. I had the bagel two ways with one Nutella, banana and Cocoa Krispies and the other with butter, orange marmalade and cashews. YUM! My partner had the sugar waffle. We will definitely eat there again next time we visit San Fran.
author: Jaime S.

description: Excellent place for breakfast in SF! Loved all of the Avocado toasts and amazing fresh fruit- so yummy!
author: Jennifer C.

description: During our visit to San Francisco my wife and I tried several breakfast places but this one was by far the best! We came back several times. The waffles are just great and their triple avocado toast is also very good. During the weekdays you might only have to wait during peak hours, but at the weekends quite a line will form, but trust me, it is really worth the wait. We will return once we return to San Francisco.
author: Helge K.

description: 5 stars for both food and service. We called ahead and they allowed us to put our name in. As soon as we walked in, they sat us. Very busy place and now I know why! I got the French toast with pecans and strawberries and it was to die for. My mom got the caramelized banana crepes. If you're in town, definitely stop by for an awesome breakfast.
author: Marisa B.

description:
I came here with my friend after a long walk and we decided to come here for somebrunch. 

They have outdoor seating, which was great for those with dog children. I feel that while it is important to have good menu options, it is also vitally important for the employees to be friendly and warm to their customers. I really liked 8 am not only for their fresh and healthy crepes, but because I noticed the servers were always efficient and customer service oriented. Plus, they have a nice location in the marina! I gave it a 5 stars because this place is really great for brunch. I will be coming back here :)
author: Emily F.

description: The bagels are delicious and portion sizes are pretty big. Make sure to stop here while in SF, totally worth it!
author: Peter V.

description: In San Francisco for a couple of days, trying out new restaurants.  This establishment would be one I highly recommend.  Food is fresh, generous portions and one of the best customer service experience I have had in a long time.  I will certainly be returning.
author: Debra H.

description: First time dining here, visiting from LA and I love this place! There's a bit of a wait but seating is limited and demand is high! They had us seated shortly and the service was pretty fair for a busy Friday morning. I ordered the 3 way avocado toast and my bf got the banana waffle---it was delicious! I wish we spent more time here than the other bkfast joints in the area! You will not be disappointed!
author: D S.

description: Delicious breakfast! The fruit was fresh and they gave you amazing fruit like strawberries and kiwi!!
author: Whitney N.

description: Excellent, fun breakfast spot! Service was excellent and the food was the perfect fuel for our bike ride across the Golden Gate Bridge. I would definitely recommend to any tourist who wants something just a little off the beaten path!
author: Laura H.

description:
My small group came here for breakfast while visiting the area for a meeting at the Marriott nearby. 

This place was a fantastic find thanks to Yelp reviewers!

We had ordered the Avocado Toast 3 ways and the Russian frittata with an extra side of chicken apple sausage!  Wow!  The food was great! The toast is definitely their signatures item! Not too heavy tasting at all! Just hits the spot between the toast with the sunny side egg, the one with the crisp bacon, and the one with the nice thick slice of green tomato...just a perfect balance!

The frittata was excellent too.   The dish came with a side of potatoes too. Actually, all the dishes came with a nice big cup of sliced fruits (bananas, melons, pineapple, blackberry, blueberries, and strawberries)...just another nice touch by this family-oriented restaurant.

If you are in the fisherman's wharf area, this is a must go for breakfast.
author: Alexander C.

description:
The BF and I decided to stroll down to the wharf for some brunch before we jetted out of town. We found Eight AM and were just so delighted. Avocado toast 3 ways was DELICIOUS and so was my blueberry shortcake that I ate so quickly I didn't even have time to take a picture of it. Croissant, blueberries, and vanilla pudding. WIN. Their fruit salad is also really impressive and abundant. Definitely more than I was expecting.

LOVE LOVE LOVE, we'll be back!!
author: Michelle K.

description: Really decent brunch. Food is good, service great, and really affordable prices. The avocado toast three ways is the go!
author: Jack B.

description: We happened to stumble across this quaint restaurant on a Friday morning. I am so glad that we found this place because the food was amazing. We ordered the mixed berry waffle, Haight Ashbury fritta, and the Fisherman Wharf fritta. All three dishes were delicious, including their fresh fruit. Perfectly ripe! Freshly squeezed OJ was the best as well! The servers were super nice and friendly & I would recommend Eight AM over and over
author: M C.

description: This place was amazing!!! Everything was so fresh and at the same time the signature dishes were beautiful to look at. I wanted everything that everyone else around me had ordered!!!!! It was the best breakfast that I've ever had on any trip I have taken into San Francisco!!! It was well worth the wait to get inside.
author: Sonja S.

description: Their Avocado toasts are really good and the menu had a bit of everything. I took the bagel with eggs and cream cheese which was good for the price you pay. The area is also great. Make sure that you arrive early because the lineup can be long.
author: Khalil S.

description:
This place is amazing! Not only is the food extremely delicious( I recommend the berry waffle) their service is great. They were able to accommodate our family 10 with no issues, it is Very family friendly! Looks like it is a family business. The 2 brothers are very nice and helpful when it comes to reviewing the menu. 

Also, parking is very accessible.
author: Denise O.

description: We enjoyed the Avocado Toast Three Ways - SO very good and worth it!
author: Mindy N.

description: Great service, waffles with fresh fruit, and delicious Frittata. Highly recommend it to everyone.
author: Maria C.

description: Why would you bother to eat at hotel restaurants when this is less then a block away? The frittata is good, is if was awe inspiring it would get 5 stars, but I am definitely hitting this at.least.once  more before we leave. Had the  sausage manche go frittata and matcha latte  it definitely didn't disappoint .
author: Stephen B.

description: Had breakfast here and it was very good. I had the open face bagel with eggs over easy and ham and avocado, it was so good. The only reason I give them a 4 star rating is because they only have plain bagels without additional variety, and they aren't very flexible with the menu. Otherwise the service is great, staff is nice and the food is delicious. I would go back for sure.
author: Dan D.

description:
Yummy yummy.
Had the 3-way Avocado toast and it was super good.

Nothing like an 8AM 3-way
author: David G.

description: Awesome breakfast menu, great service. Found this spot in maps & we are very pleased.
author: Kelly K.

description: This place is amazing. Food was great, staff friendly and fast service. It's smaller but the food comes out quickly so they're hustling people in and out. We thought there would be a long wait but were seated in 5 minutes.
author: Alin H.

description:
A brunch place in the city with cute presentation and decent food that DOESN'T have a line out the door? Could this be real? Am I dreaming? 

Apparently not! This little gem in North Beach is 1) bigger than it looks, and 2) pretty much one of the best kept secrets I've found after an impromptu stay at the holiday inn across the street!

The food here is average - their "american" brunch incorporates flavors that are inspired from other cuisines.. think omelettes .. frittatas.. that taste semi asian inspired and avocado toasts on orowheat bread. Almost there, but you can see why its not MBC.

That being said, their presentation is on point with prices well below that of places like MBC and fruit bowls with something other than honeydew and cantaloupe? I'm sold. Definitely stop by if you are in the neighborhood - its in an amazing neighborhood with outdoor seating. Take a stroll to ghiradelli square or fisherman's wharf afterwards!
author: Patricia K.

description: The avocado toast had a beautiful presentation with an amazing fruit bowl that could be a meal in itself. So sweet and fresh- bananas cut moments before top the bowl. Food is served piping hot. Waitstaff never stops moving among tables. Small family owned, simple decor. Easy to miss this quaint little cafe if you aren't watching for it! Don't miss this cafe when visiting San Francisco.
author: Jennifer P.

description:
Great little breakfast joint. As a party of 4, we waited about 20-25 min on a late Sunday morning. Put your name on the list and hang outside. There's a Starbucks around the corner if you're "jonesing" for a caffeine fix while you wait. 

Wait staff was super polite and attentive. 

All the breakfast dishes were creative and absolutely delicious. I recommend the toast 3 ways or one of the frittatas. Most breakfasts also include home potatoes and a cup of REAL fresh fruit (e.g. sliced bananas, raspberries, blackberries, strawberries, blueberries, pineapple and melon).
author: Frank K.

description:
Brunch and breakfast is always a meal I can have anytime of the day so when I discovered this little placed tucked away located very closed to Fisherman Wharf, I always get excited. The menu has a great variety of dishes for breakfast, all fresh products. Dishes are very creative. They have parfaits, waffles, croissant sandwiches, bagels, frittatas and crepes.  The healthy, hearty menu doesn't disappoint.
What to get:
~Nutella Granola Parfait - you had me at Nutella -interesting and delicious
~Banana Nut Waffle - for banana lovers topped with chopped pecans & whipped crème simply divine
~Avocado Toast 3 Ways - one with fried egg, one with tomato and another topped with bacon-YUMEH!
~6AM crepe - black forest ham, scrambled eggs & Swiss cheese is good for something savory
~11am crepe - peanut butter & sliced bananas w maple syrup
~1PM crepe - Nutella, bananas, cream
~Mushroom, spinach and shallots frittata - its served with potatoes and fresh fruits 
~Russian Hill frittata- bacon or sausage & cheddar cheese, got mine with bacon 
~Fisherman's Wharf Dungeness Crab, tomatoes & Manchego cheese

I can practically list everything down on the menu because everything looked good.
The service was great for a small little restaurant. Very cute place, healthy food, great menu with a lot of options, very kind staff. Definitely the best way to start a new day in SF. 4 stars!
author: Maria M.

description: Friendly service, good selection of food for breakfast and prepared well. We were seated right away and waters and coffee filled when needed. Fresh squeezed orange juice and we love the side of fruit bowl. The ham and cheese frittata was good.  I enjoyed the bagels and lox and my daughter liked her Nutella and banana filled crepe. We would come here again.
author: Cheyenne P.

description: Simple food, well executed, great coffee, friendly , polite, and competent staff - what more can you ask for? I went in expecting a small hole-in-the-wall cafe and walked out wishing more breakfast places offered this level of competence and execution.
author: Raine W.

description: Ordered avocado toast, eight am waffle, sugar waffle and Castro frittata. Matcha green tea  is interesring.
author: Linda D.

description: Amazing food! Fresh and well prepared! Would definitely recommend it to anyone trying to find a great breakfast spot in SF!
author: Andres M.

description: This place is off the beaten path but so worth it. The food is amazing and the service was great! You wouldn't expect this great food at the little corner where it is located but the food was so so good. It was great to find a place that wasn't diner food for breakfast!
author: Amanda M.

description: Avocado toast 3 ways! They literally give you 3 slices of toast, each topped with Avocado, then one with an egg, one with tomato and the 3rd topped with bacon for about $12! They serve the breakfasts with a huge bowl of high quality fresh fruit. YUM! Also had a latte that was really good. Everything was delicious. Nicest wait staff we have encountered!
author: Diane E.

description: Small neighborhood place but we went in 9 am Saturday and got a table. Delicious, ample portions and some nice twists to favorites. For example 6 distinct choices on bagels topping and you choose 2 - comes with large portion fresh & ripe fruit. Avocado toast comes 3 different ways with fresh fruit bowl. A real find.
author: Suzanne M.

description:
This is a great find! It's very unassuming from the outside, and very simple from the inside. The service was excellent.

I came for brunch, and ordered the endless coffee. They were great about coming by with the coffee, which was quite good. 

1. Avocado toast: You get three different toasts, all delicious. One has a poached egg, one has bacon, and the third has a silced tomato. It has a slight crunch, which is perfect. It comes with a large fruit cup, which was not skimpy and very fresh.

2. 12pm crepe: This was also delicious. They have various times of day for the various crepes. This one had mushroom, chicken, and tons of spinach. There was a delicious creamy sauce on top. I enjoyed this very much. The mushroom and spinach had great flavor, and the white meat chicken was done well.

3. Raspberry croissant sandwich: Surprisingly good. This is an interesting combination of cream cheese, raspberry, and banana slices in a buttery croissant. 

Overall, great value. The prices were great, and the food was fresh and flavorful. I highly recommend this place!
author: James W.

description: This is a quaint family-owned restaurant and my husband and I loved having breakfast here! Everything we ordered was absolutely delicious from the egg frittata (first time having it and definitely not the last) to the berry waffle all the way to the freshly squeezed OJ. You also cannot forget the SF favorite-perfectly crunchy sourdough bread. The service was also speedy and they made sure you were taken care of. My husband and I always say we will return in the near future and I am sure of it! I must try that delicious looking avocado toast everyone else is crazy about!
author: Mariam R.

description: Wonderful little spot for a refreshing light lunch or breakfast. Healthy food, freshly prepared ingredients, reasonable prices. This place shines! I would definitely come back here again.
author: Carolyn F.

description:
Really loved our breakfast here. We lucked out and didn't have to wait at all for our table. The servers were very nice, a little slow in taking our order but made up for it the rest of the time and were very friendly! 

I ordered two sunny side up eggs with bacon, potatoes and fruit. The bacon was so delicious!!! Not too salty or too hard, perfection. The eggs were cooked well and the potatoes had amazing flavor. My husband had the egg white frittata and he also raved about it. I wasn't too impressed by the $6 OJ, I know it's hand squeezed but it had an odd after taste, almost like tomato. For $6 I would suggest passing on that in the future. Everything else was so good, I fully suggest coming here!! 

One other thing that wasn't the greatest was their bathroom. An employee was using it before me, so you would have thought he'd clean it up a bit. There was used paper towels all over the floor, no toilet seat covers left, pee on the seat and the trash was over flowing. That was the only really bad part about this place, and I'm sure the bathroom is usually much cleaner when the restaurant isn't as busy.
author: Amanda M.

description:
While the food sits somewhere between 4 and 5 stars I had to give this place 3 stars because the service was pretty bad.  Not the service where anyone was rude or unfriendly, but the kind where it seems like it's everyone's first day and no one has ever waited tables in their life.

That being said, I would still recommend trying this place out for breakfast because the food was amazing.  Just be warned if you are here on a Sunday morning, a popular time for breakfast/brunch, you may need to practice a bit of patience.

I ordered the banana nut waffle and my husband had crepe number 1 - both excellent choices.  The waffle was huge and could easily be shared if you just want to have a sweet item to finish your breakfast.

To sum it up: FOOD: Excellent.  SERVICE: Waiters could use training....proceed with patience. :)
author: Christy C.

description: Lovely day, ate outside, Avocado toast all the way(being veg I did sub the bacon for a egg)! I'm in love, I'm in love, I'm in love and I don't care who knows it! Just happened to stumble across it...with the help of a friend that lives there : )
author: Reagan D.

description: Fresh fruit, perfectly cooked bacon, and a fantastic chai tea latte! Eight AM is the perfect little stop before you head on over to the Warf for the day.
author: Brooks A.

description: Danny, the owner is super nice and awesome.  Great food and generous portions!  Many Paleo-friendly choices and fresh fruits with just about every dish.
author: Amy H.

description: Avocado Toast. Yum! All there food is great! Not eating carbs their frittata is amazing!
author: Ashley H.

description:
Great neighborhood place to have breakfast. I had the Castro frittata which was really good. Came with fresh fruit and potatoes. 

The wife had the Nutella crepes. Not too sweet with strawberries and whipped cream. 

Everything was responsibly prices and came out hot and tasty
author: Bryan N.

description: First time here. And I would recommend it to anyone!!  Fresh everything!!! SF hidden secret come try them out.
author: Jacob C.

description:
I came here with a group of six on a Saturday afternoon and had a great experience here!

The wait for a table took roughly fifteen minutes or so as there isn't a lot of seating in such a small place, but it wasn't crowded or stuffy. The place is very clean and has a nice atmosphere to it with both indoor and outdoor seating.

The service was great as the servers were very friendly. The place appears to be family run. I ordered some coffee as well as a Noe Valley frittata. My coffee was nice and hot with constant refills coming my way which was great. The frittata was presented nicely with a wonderful fruit salad and potatoes. However, I did find the frittata to be a little bit lacking in flavor and salt, but it was still delicious and better under salted than over salted.

Overall, Eight AM is a nice little cafe for lunch with well presented dishes and drinks for a reasonable price.
author: Joshua M.

description:
This place has a great menu: the dishes are unique, the food beautifully presented, and many healthy dishes. The fruit was FRESH, coffee good, and food EXCELLENT!

This was a memorable San Fran breakfast!
author: Joshua A.

description: A great hidden gem. We started the morning walking along the Embarcadero and explored Fisherman's Wharf, before making the short (~2 blocks) journey to 8 a.m. The patio seating was full so we took a table by the window inside. Eclectic menu had several options that looked, great including French toast & fritata but we settled on the waffle with berries and the avocado toast, which they are known for. It didn't take long for order to arrive. The egg on the avocado toast was very very runny, just a warning in case you like it a bit firmer. The varieties, which are pre-set include heirloom tomatoes, eggs & bacon (1 each).  Overall everything was very fresh the server was friendly and the prices were good.
author: Alexis R.

description:
Best kept secret for breakfast in San Francisco!

Incredible breakfast, and freshly squeezed OJ.  We will be back!
author: Armando O.

description: Came here for lunch before I headed over to see Hamilton. Great service. Super friendly efficient staff. I ordered the chia fruit pudding and my daughter ordered the fruit bowl.  Great little spot. I would definitely come again.
author: T B.

description:
I first stumbled upon this place on Yelp when searching for a place to eat around Fisherman's Wharf. I and the hubster don't usually go to touristy spots - food there usually aren't as good but are even more expensive than other areas. San Franciscans would know to not go for anything pricier than SF standards - coz SF pricing standards are already so much higher that the national average *rolling of the eyes begin* :D.

Decided to try it yesterday with a friend since our original brunch destination was closed. My friend ordered the 3-way Avocado Toast and coffee, while I ordered the San Francisco Frittata with sausage. My frittata comes with a fruit bowl (that was a lot of fruits!) and house potatoes. The frittata was kind of too dry and the house potatoes were not charred enough for my liking. Despite the big fruit bowl - I think $13 (before tax & service) for the dish was a bit too steep. While I do understand how expensive rent might be in that area - I must say for that price, I have had a lot better brunch dishes elsewhere.

Service for great though. I would give an added 1/2 star for the service itself. Our server (who seems to be the owner's son) was extremely friendly and fast. He kept on checking on our drinks to see if we needed refills.

There aren't a lot of good food in Fisherman's Wharf in my opinion - so this place might worth the try when you're in the area.
author: Priscillia I.

description: Staff and cooks are really friendly. Their juices and fruit bowls are super fresh. I am a huge fan of their Height ashbury frittata and their roasted potatoes. They have cool art displays for sale and a nice ambient. So far, this is probably my favorite place to have breakfast in the world.
author: Gerzayn L.

description: This is the spot to eat breakfast if you're in the San Francisco Bay Area. We had the avocado toast which comes 3 ways, and the Nob Hill frittata(spinach,schallots, and mushrooms) Hella hospitality and a Cali vibe, support your local spots!!
author: Johnny U.

description:
My wife and I came here based on the surprising number of reviews with an average of 5.  But unfortunately after the 45 min wait this morning we felt this place was average at best.

We ordered the Castro omelette with chicken apple sausage.  It was probably the best dish we ate.  It is served with potatoes and a bowl of fresh fruit.  Nothing special, but a good eat.  They have smoothies on the menu but aren't ready cause the machine isn't in.  I tried ordering chai latte but they ran out.  Instead, we took the Matcha Green Tea Latte.  The latte initially tasted powdery with a hint of wild green leaves from a garden, not my favorite taste.  We also ordered Nine AM crepe with Fresh strawberries, cream cheese and whipped cream.  We specifically asked for it 10 mins after our omelette with whip cream on the side, hoping to save it as a desert.  It came 10 min earlier with the whip cream on top.  I don't think we liked the strawberry and cream cheese combo.

The atmosphere is nice.  The decor is simple.  Staff are nice but it took me mentioning that I needed more water before the waiter got me more.
author: Steve S.

description: Excellent breakfast spot near Fisherman's Wharf. Excellent food. Ordered the banana nut waffles, "Haight-Ashbury" frittata, and it comes with an delectable little fruit bowl. Sidewalk seating is very nice for people watching.
author: Frank M.

description: Found this place on yelp when looking for a breakfast place while staying at Courtyard just a short distance from here. Wow were we thrilled by this find. Food was amazing. Service was first rate. Best chai tea I have ever had. Seriously you won't be disappointed.
author: Tim B.

description:
My husband and I were looking for a place to eat good breakfast and good service. I looked on yelp and found three places, and Eight AM was my third choice despite all the great reviews.  The two other places were insanely crowded with a long line out the door and at least an hour wait.  After deciding I did not want to wait, I called Eight AM and they told me they did not have a wait time. As we walked over to Eight AM, it was not particularly appealing from the outside. It looks run down and old, which is probably why there was not a long line of people waiting. 

The hostess immediately greeted us with a smile and we were seated right away. The server was very friendly and gave us advice on which entrees to get. The coffee was really good, which was never less than half full. The I got a Haight Ashbury omelet (which was all veggies) and added bacon. The omelet was perfectly cooked, eggs not too runny. It came with a choice of potatoes AND fruit! The fruit was a good assortment of everything and was very fresh. I also ordered the French toast with caramelized onions at the suggestion of the server. It came with fruit and a little whipped cream. AMAZING and must try!!! The french toast was perfectly moist and the bananas were uniquely soft and melted in my mouth. Overall this place did not disappoint at all! I will definitely be coming back on my next visit to San Francisco.
author: Cynthia O.

description:
The food was fresh and really good!  I highly recommend the avocado toast!!!  The French toast with the caramelized bananas won't disappoint either. 

Last but not least all the staff were exceptionally friendly and nice.
author: Jody J.

description:
Not too long of a wait for a party of 4 on a busy Saturday morning. 

Service and food were great. 

I ordered the traditional bacon & eggs with over medium eggs. It came with house potatoes and a good serving of mixed fruit. 

Bacon was a little too crispy for my taste, so if you don't like crispy bacon notify your sever :) 

We'll be back on my next San Francisco trip!
author: Stephany Z.

description: Our waiter was nice and attentive. Food was out within tens minutes from ordering. My wife had chicken breast sandwich and I had ham and cheese with a over easy egg on top. Both dishes came with a salad that had pineapple pieces and blueberries with a raspberry vinaigrette. Everything was delicious!! Will definitely come back again.
author: Bernadette D.

description:
Good frittatas made to order. The fruit served with it was fresh, way tasty.

Minus ten points for not having a liquor license.
author: Gabriela W.

description:
Food was great. 
Setting is spacious.
Drinks were also good.
Only problem was the timing for the food.
Definitely took a while to get my food
and when I received it they messed up on 
the order and never fixed it.
author: Herman D.

description:
Our table tried the Belgian waffle with berries, three way toast, and chia seed parfait. All were good overall. Waffle was crisp, berries fresh, syrup nice and warm. Toast had generous helping of avocado on each slice. I'd say the three way toast is the best deal, as I found the waffle overpriced ($12). Chia seed parfait was unique but not sweet, a tad bland. 

Recommend the three way toast as the winner of this restaurant.
author: Will H.

description:
Me and my husband wanted to have a heavy breakfast before biking the Golden Gate Bridge on a Friday morning. This place was close to the bike rentals and had decent reviews so we decided to give it a try and we are glad we did. 

It is a tiny little place and the wait time was almost 30-40 minutes but it was worth the wait. We ordered Raspberry Croissant Sandwich with fruit salad and Nob hill omelette with orange juice and a Cappuccino. The Croissant sandwich was simply delicious. The combination of the cream cheese and raspberry was unique and refreshing. The egg also was baked and made in a very different manner which was interesting. The portion size is pretty decent too.

Definitely worth it!!
author: Fatima D.

description: I love this place!!! Avocado toast and fruit. What more could a girl ever ask for!  The customer service is also fabulous.
author: Nichole T.

description: Had a great breakfast here. Service was fast and the food was amazing.  I ordered the bagel 2 ways.  Half with Nutella, banana and honey and the second half with ham, egg and avocado!   If that wasn't enough, the fruit cup was fresh and huge.  Great local find in a tourist area!
author: Christopher P.

description: We have had breakfast at Eight AM for three days in a row and have tried different items on the menu. It has been wonderful experience. Great service with a great quality food. Worth trying ....
author: R G.

description: A traditional breakfast with a twist! Rather than having omelettes on the menu, Eight AM has a variety of frittata's. They are delicious and come with potatoes and a healthy portion of fresh fruit. Eight AM is located near Fishermans Wharf. The staff was very friendly. I will be back to try the Crepe!!
author: Brittney S.

description: Great chia seed yogurt with berries.  The other dish I had was the banana nut waffle which consisted of a freshly made waffle, a banana sliced in half and sprinkled nuts.  Hot syrup was provided, but the flavor was just right, didn't need it any sweeter.
author: Kent H.

description: Doesn't look particularly fancy however I was pleasantly surprised. Staff were really friendly and so was the chef. Needed to give my stomach a break from all the bad food I've eaten the last couple of days so had the chia seed pudding. Delicious! Coffee wasn't great though but not the worst I've had
author: Georgia D.

description: Best breakfast!!!  Had breakfast there this past Sunday morning. Group of 8 so we expected to wait for a long time, but I guess we got there before the crowd and we were able to get a table right away.  We ordered the Fruit and Granola Parfait, 8 AM Crepes, Bagel Two Ways, Avocado Toast Three Ways, two different Frittatas, and Bacon and Eggs.  Everyone loved their meals.  Service was excellent, and even had a visit from the chef.  Their coffee was really good too.  And despite the building crowd outside, they never rushed us.  Definitely recommend this place if you're in the Fisherman's Wharf area.  We'll definitely come back when we're in The City.
author: George T.

description: Delicious breakfast! Everything was fresh and service was amazing! Avocado toast 3 ways was incredible and instagram worthy.
author: Rob B.

description:
Just randomly select one food. It was Avocado toast three ways. Then, when I took a look at top reviews, I just found I chose a popular and good one.

It turns out this avocado toast is so good,  I started with the piece with tomato, which looks good and light. Then, I go for the piece with egg. For me, that's better to have some black pepper. For the piece that has bacon, it's amazing. 

I highly recommend this one. You may have three different feelings about it.
author: Yuri K.

description:
Small, family-owned brunch place located by the Fisherman's Wharf. They have an indoor/outdoor seating area. On a Friday morning, we waited for about 20 minutes as a party of 4, and they allow you to put your name on the list when we arrive. 

Each of us ordered some variation of a frittata. The eggs were fluffy and the cheese and other ingredients were well balanced. Each came with a side of potatoes that were well-seasoned and not overly greasy. The main appeal was the ample side of fruit that came with each dish. The mix of berries, banana, and melon was fresh and filling. 

Service is where this place takes a small hit. There were only two people working on the floor, which was not sufficient. They could certainly use an extra hand especially with setting and clearing tables. Overall though, a nice, pleasant brunch spot.
author: Aaron C.

description: Services was ok but those there boys were running around working hard and it was very busy! Food was also just good.
author: Kamari H.

description:
Delicious! We came hungry to SF this morning and landed in the perfect spot. 

I had the chia pudding-vanilla pudding with Chia seeds, topped with slivered almonds and fresh fruit. We also ordered the toast 3 ways- three different avacado toasts! What more could you ask for. My favorite was the sourdough baguette topped with avacado and fresh ripe tomato. The other two included bacon on top, and the other with an egg. Finally, my table ordered the Haight frittata, SO GOOD. It came with fried potatoes and fresh fruit cup. 

This place would easily be 5 star, the wait time was only 10 minutes and was very efficient. The only reason I gave it 4 was because of the price. 

With all the food listed and only hot green tea and coffee, our total was over $50. It was good, but my wallet is crying a little bit over that price for breakfast.
author: Morgan K.

description: This place gets a strong 4. It became our savior when we learned at the front door that cafe Del casa next door is closed on a Sunday morning. Service is quick and friendly, it's a hot spot for good breakfasts and has a modern contemporary cafe style vibe. Food was quick and delicious. Very happy we stopped by.
author: Ashley K.

description: Delish. Just delish. I wanted everything on the menu! The toasts are great and enough to share!
author: Nicki B.

description:
Eight AM has been topping yelp reviews - so I had high expectations going in.

Woke up early and popped over around 8:30am. Walked into a smallish looking spot - but it's bigger inside. It's clean and modern, and the artwork by TurtleWayne is adorbs! 

Menu offers a wide selection. I had the frittata and my boyfriend had the scrambled egg special. I was eye'ing the avocado toast - but only wanted one of the three toast options (the order comes with 3) - but alas, they don't let you mix and match.

Our meals ended up a bit pricey ($13/$12 per plate) but service was good and food was hot and fresh. Fruit was awesome!

Overall, a good experience. IMHO Hollywood cafe gives more food for your dollar - but Eight AM is cleaner, more modern and cultivates a chill atmosphere.
author: Marie J.

description: We had a disaster experience at this restaurant. First they served fresh squeezed orange that was bad. And the mange not to put in our service order. Made it worse, we were freezing sitting outside. The food was marginal and not worth the hassle.
author: Wei D.

description:
Great place in the San Fran area for a quick and cost effective breakfast. Both I and my dining partner enjoyed the 2 bagel choice options and it was delish! Definitely something you could do at home, but they paired with a side of fresh fruit and we left feeling full. 

Saw beautiful dishes walk by that would be worth a try!
author: Mary G.

description: Seated right away and loved all of our dishes! The chia seed pudding is awesome, not shy on fruit at all
author: Tara D.

description: Great service! Our waiter checked in several times and filled up our coffee! Food was pretty good. The 3 way avocado toast was delicious! We sat outside because inside was boiling hot. The view outside was very nice too. Overall great brunch place!
author: Ani K.

description: Food was AWESOME!! Haven't been so impressed with a breakfast place in awhile! We all cleared our plates! PLEASE NOTE** tip is already included!!
author: Leilani L.

description: Breakfast is a favorite when traveling or on vacation- enjoyed many of the reviews from fellow Yelpers and decided to give this place a try.  Cute little spot, excellent friendly service.  We were a table of four: Mom had the avocado 3 ways which was as advertised- awesome.  2 of us had the eggs, potatoes and bacon- prepared perfectly, and wife had the Nob Hill Frittata which she loved.  One of the highlights is the cup of fruit with every meal.  Prices around $15 bit you are well fed and it is SAN Fran.  Feels like finding a locals hangout in tourist area.  Highly recommend- you won't need lunch so start planning dinner!
author: Matthew H.

description: I'don't know about you, but I'm not planning to wait on a long line to be seated for "ordinary" food especially at a very touristy area such as Fisherman's Wharf!
author: Amr A.

description: This was our first stop for breakfast on our trip to San Fran. This was a place we preplanned to go to before we arrived in the city. We both got frittatas one was a veggie style frittata and the other was the Noe Valley. We both had potatoes and fresh fruit as sides which is what it comes with. The pictures of the food is what brought me here but the frittatas left much to be desired. Was expecting bold flavors but was left with bland eggs basically. The potatoes had great flavor and were crisp and we definitely love our potatoes the fruit was fresh and delicious as well. The space is small but has a nice atmosphere! Over all not a bad experience but at the same time I'm not sure if we would revisit if we came back.
author: Myframe Z.

description: Avocado toast was brilliant! Berry pancakes were good, but nothing special. I really liked the chai latte I had here. Inside was rather crowded and stuffy, so get a seat outside if possible!
author: Kristin A.

description: The food is great and the service even better! The food was creative and amazing. The staff is very personable.
author: Hugo S.

description: The best breakfast in San Francisco! I had the Blueberry fruit salad, and my husband had the 6am crepe. The restaurant is clean, and the servers were friendly. Highly recommended.
author: Denise P.

description: The best breakfast I have had in years. Fast, piping hot, fresh veggies, fresh squeezed OJ, great coffee. Nuff said.
author: Rich D.

description: Deffinitey a go to mom and pops breakfast place when in San Fran! Delicious food and outstanding service. You will not leave this place unhappy.
author: Vanessa C.

description: Yum! This place is as good as its reviews. This place seemed overhyped, but it's as good as it looks. Come early, because this breakfast/brunch spot gets busy fast! They have indoor and outdoor seating, but it's not a big place, so be expected to dine closely to others (not a big deal- since it is San Francisco). They have a wide selection of breakfast/ brunch creations. Lots of fruits involved in their meals(: The price is affordable. One bathroom. They take cash and card.
author: Cici Y.

description: Found this breakfast place searching on Yelp and so glad we found it! Food was amazing, so many choices. We ordered avocado toast 3 ways so delicious! Sugar waffle was huge and tasty. Fruit served with meals so fresh and included berries. Portion sizes were generous and prices reasonable for San Francisco. Highly recommend
author: Heidi A.

description:
Eight AM is a quaint breakfast place near Fisherman's Wharf (why do the tourists get such good brunch options?!) with, in my opinion, a uniquely cute menu. After going back and forth about all the different "AM"s and "PM"s I could get, I decided on the avocado toast 3 ways since so many people raved about it on Yelp.

I was a bit skeptical as I thought avocado toast was a relatively simple dish (plus there were so many other delicious-sounding items on the menu), but they managed to knock it out of the park! The amount of avocado was just right, and the flavor mixed so well with the crispy bacon and fresh tomato. I was full, but I wanted more.

My boyfriend raved about how well-balanced his nutella crepe was, so I'm definitely coming back here for a crepe next time and recommending to my local friends!
author: Kimberly Y.

description: First time here with my family and we absolutely loved it. Awesome service that made the atmosphere very friendly and enjoyable. The food was very fresh and flavorful. I would definitely recommend this place for breakfast or brunch! There was a little bit of a wait but it went by fast and was completely worth it.
author: Karina K.

description: Came based on the great Yelp reviews. We felt it was overpriced for the quality of food we were served. Had the avocado toast 3 ways - the tomato slice they gave us was the top of the tomato with the stem part, and the tomato was underripe and had green parts. Didn't taste good. The bacon was basically burnt (though in their defense, now that I go back and look at other reviewers photos, a lot of it looks like that. Maybe people like burnt bacon). Also got the berry croissant sandwich. It was fine, served warm. The fruit on the side wasn't very ripe or sweet either. Overall just very average food, at a high price and a bit of a wait.
author: Angie H.

description:
First they were out of oranges, and thus, orange juice at 10:00 am on Monday. 
Took 30 minutes to be served the bagel plate. 3 tables next to us arrived after we did and were all served before us.  They tasted fine, but the toasted bagels were already cold. 
The strawberry crepe was a rip off in my opinion, at $12, because it was nothing more than a FEW slices inside a large, empty crepe. There was one whole strawberry and a dollop of whipped cream on top. 
We complained and the staff agreed they really messed up, and gave us 20% off, which is why I'm leaving two stars and not just one. 
Will not be returning.
author: Chris And April S.

description:
They do not accept American Express credit card here
The food is excellent and atmosphere is nice 
They actually open before 7:30 which is the time many breakfast spots do open in the area
All the food seems very fresh and is con ineptly located to many hotels in the area
Very clean as well
Not a lot of seating but they do have indoor and outdoor dining
author: Annie H.

description: My avocado toast three ways was pretty good, though I wish my sunny side up egg was actually done on the stove or griddle. I'm pretty sure the microwaved it based on the shape of the egg and how the yolk was overcooked. The side of fruit it quite good too, and they really give you a ton of it.
author: Misha T.

description: I love this place !! The staff was so kind and fast, plus the food was delicious!!! Wish I could eat here everyday. Got the avocado toast 3 ways, comes with fresh cut fruit, couldn't be happier ! Even though they were busy, they did not rush us to finish up! Hope to be back soon:)
author: Emily R.

description:
There was nothing bad about this place, but nothing blew me away either, hence the 3 stars. 

Wait: It was full when we got there, so had to put our name on the list. We were second and waited about 10 minutes for a table, not too bad. It's a quite a small place with only about 10 tables inside and 4 outside, so I'd expect a small wait most times. However, once we got in, service was really quick. They took drink orders right away and food orders soon after.

Food: Husband had a (Diamond Heights) frittata with ham and cheese and a side of sourdough toast. Frittata came with potatoes and a bowl of fruit. I had the bagel two ways. One with scrambled egg and cheese (2) and one with peanut butter, bacon, and apple (6). That came with fruit as well. We both thought the food was good, clean, and simple. Fresh squeezed orange juice is extremely expensive for the size.

Environment: I don't know if they normally keep it warm, as this was my first time there, but I was uncomfortably hot. Air conditioning was not on at all. I don't know if it was broken, but they didn't mention anything. We were also sat at a table right across from the kitchen. Normally not a problem, but the aisle is so small, I felt like I was in the way constantly as waiters walked behind me and got food from the kitchen.

All in all, it was a quick and easy breakfast, tasty enough. But nothing particularly exciting or special. And it was way too warm inside. I'd go again probably, especially as it was literally across the street from our hotel, but if you're in this area, there are probably better breakfast places (like Buena Vista or Hollywood Cafe.)
author: Sarah K.

description: Only real negative is that some things they serve are not on the menu. Otherwise vey nice place,  cozy atmosphere and very good service.
author: Anthony P.

description:
I love this place and eat here at least once a week if not more.  The service is fantastic and friendly. The coffee is hot and refills are on point.  You can't go wrong with the menu, but a few of my favorites are: any of the frittatas (especially the Nob Hill), the vanilla soy chia seed pudding, and the Lombard sandwich. The fruit that comes with everything is fresh and plentiful.

The ultimate best thing is the Avocado Toast Three Ways. Everyone should eat this at least once.

Can't wait for the smoothies to start blending this summer!!
author: Noelle F.

description: Really good food. I got the Diamond Heights frittata and was not disappointed! Came with a nice bowl of fresh fruit and really good potatoes. The pineapple juice was really fresh too. Definitely recommend this place, but only for smaller parties!!
author: Victor P.

description: Yelp came through with the reviews on this place-  i walked in right before 7 with the closed sign still up but the door was open and they welcomed me in.  I was the first table -  I was offered coffee immediately.  The coffee was good-  the also do espresso.  I ordered the veggie frittata (actually called something else but that is what it is.  It was pretty good but it comes with home fries that were great and s fruit bowl that was amazing.  Very fair prices for San Fran as well.
author: Ryan P.

description:
Awesome place for breakfast in Fisherman's Wharf! Ate the Avocado toast three ways: 3 different toasts with smashed avocado....one with bacon, one with egg, and one with tomato. Cup of mixed fruit comes with plate. Wife had the blueberry shortcake with cup of fruit.

Friendly staff, outdoor seating available. Will come back again!
author: Patrick M.

description:
Nice place to sit outside in the morning. Staff was really friendly; would return just because they were nice and I like to support positive customer service.
I had the 9am, crepe with strawberries, was good, not great. But again, I would certainly return for the outdoor seating and friendliness.
author: Jasomus L.

description: Food was good. However, the restaurant doe not have ac and gets super hot inside. It is uncomfortable and hard to enjoy your meal like that. Better to wait a little while for an outside table.
author: D D.

description:
I think I just had the best French toast you can find in San Francisco.  The bread was perfectly thick and fluffy, and the caramelized bananas on top makes one think of fancy French desserts 

I also sampled from the frittata plate my friend ordered, and that was too notch too.  

Note - lines ca start early so the sooner you arrive the better.   Knowing this, we arrived at opening time and were seated promptly. 

Please try next time you are in north beach or near the wharf
author: Max G.

description:
Good food, friendly staff, chef is nice and came out to greet and check on the guests food.  Newer spot in Fisherman's Wharf area and hopefully a mainstay. 

Located right on the corner of Leavenworth and Columbus makes for easy access as well.  

Bagel two ways and French Toast with caramelized bananas on our first time here...did not disappoint. Fresh juices as well.  

Hope to be back here soon.
author: Rodolfo F.

description: Food was mediocre at best. Service was some of the worst I have ever had in 50 years of dining. We were the second people in the door and one of the last to be served. What should have been a quick 20 minute breakfast took over an hour. When the bill arrived, it was obscenely expensive. I would never recommend this place nor would I ever want someone to experience what I just did.
author: Jayme C.

description:
So I very much liked this place. The food is beautiful.

The fruit is super fresh. I got the bagel. One side egg and cheese the other Nutella, banana and chocolate cereal. Got a side of bacon (3 slices) that I also placed on the egg one. The bagel was super soft and both were good. I never had Nutella before, it was good, sweet. I wouldn't order that one again unless I was looking for a sugary, sweet breakfast. 

We order the French toast with berries. It came with a heavy berry syrup sauce all over it and then berries in that. Would have asked for it on the side, knowing that now. It was too much BUT I like my French toast with butter and maple syrup. I love blueberry syrup too but that was a mix of different berries I didn't particular care for.  The waiters worked their butts off. It was busy and they were very attentive to all customer, including the ones waiting on a table. It was so nice to see waiters that actually cared about their guests and were refilling waters and checking in! I will go back here, I miss those soft bagels already!
author: Lacey G.

description: Walked to empty cafe and was seated near refrigerators.  Order pancakes between two guests. Asked about getting blueberries added . Ending experience, I could of made what I bought at home and saved the $20 I left on the table. It was a tourist trap and couldn't believe that the bill was $18.
author: Michael B.

description: Awesome food!!!  It's a small place and a great starting point to the day.  My wife got the avocado toast... BOMB! When we come back to SF we'll definitely revisit for breakfast!!
author: Drew H.

description:
Great service and breakfast!! Avocado toast and banana French toast were very unique!
Recommended to anyone that wants a yummy breakfast in SF
author: Ashley W.

description: Great breakfast location. The avocado toast 3 ways is really nice. The service is good and the prices are good. With limited locations open for breakfast in this area, this is a very nice local breakfast stop.
author: Douglas F.

description: Great food! If you're looking for something different from typical breakfast places, I recommend this place. The service wasn't anything special, but the food made up for it. All 5 of us were satisfied with the different items we ordered.
author: Monica W.

description: Brunch was amazing! Favorite spot in San Francisco. Bring your patience with you, wait was 30-45 mins. Good atmosphere and courteous servers!
author: Nereyda M.

description: Great spot. Friendly people. Great food. Will be back. Los bagel and waffles especially good.
author: Juan E.

description: Found this place on Yelp and it totally lived up to its star ratings! The avocado toast was great and the crepes were delicious!!
author: Diana M.

description: Had this a year ago and then again this week. We shared the Russian Hill frittata and it was very good and full of sausage! The fruit on the side was pretty good. The potatoes were pretty average but overall it was a good breakfast experience. Our waiter was very nice and they kept the coffee flowing.
author: Taylor J.

description:
Great tasting food. lox bagel was so fresh and delicious.  Avocado toast was amazing and the breakfast potatoes hit the spot.  The service was spot on, very attentive and food was so quick!! 

Pop in if you're in the area! Well worth it!
author: Stella D.

description: I started coming here when I first moved into the neighborhood over a year ago and have been coming back every weekend since. The food is great, I usually get the sausages or frittatas, service is fantastic (Gabe and the two Ryan's killing it!) and all at a great price. It's the best in the neighborhood, highly recommended!
author: Richard C.

description: Fantastic is the best description of this little gem. The food is great and menu is exciting for breakfast food! While the decor is understated the food provides a great experience. The staff and is attentive and accommodating. I could only wish there was an Eight Am in every city I get to visit!!
author: Nombre O.

description:
It's hard to believe this place is real. Like people can actually come here. 
Top to bottom one of the best food experiences I have ever had. 
The toast 3 way is fantastic. 
The cream from the crepe is one of the best I've ever had. 
I got potatoes on the side and it was a good portion for $3. 
The orange juice tasted freshly squeezed. 
Everything from that kitchen was fresh and amazing. 
5 stars does not do this place justice.
author: A M.

description: We had guacamole toast and tostadas. Everything was great. Fresh squeezed juice. Small restaurant but worth the wait
author: Steve Z.

description: Food is delicious. Even the coffee is great. They offer healthy breakfast full of flavor! If your in San Francisco you must stop here!!! Great service, fresh food, you must go here!!!
author: Nancy F.

description: Great breakfast spot! Good coffee, the crepe with mushrooms,chicken apple sausage and manchego cheese was delicious! We also shared the assortment of avocado toasts and fruit which was fresh and appetizing! My favorite one had the bacon on top. Great spot to fuel up before a long bike ride! Waiters were attentive and friendly too.
author: Lauren R.

description:
The coffee is stellar. Very small place so you might feel a bit cramped. The food isn't bad but nothing exceptional. The menu is very small as well. 
My wife got the fritatta which was a bit boring if nothing else. It was essentially a omellette. 
I had the avocado 3 ways. While very original, it was lacking in something. All in all, it was ok, but nothing amazing.
author: John S.

description: This place is "the Goods."  Quality ingredients in great recipes. The service was prompt. And the PRICES! For what we had, it was hard to believe what they charged. The crab frittata and avocado toasts are the ticket. The ample accompanying fruit was fresh and sweet. For myself, I'd rather that they upped the quality of the decaf they buy and adjust the price accordingly. But that's my only quibble.
author: Gary H.

description: Really good food with fresh fruit. This place was very busy and seemed to be a local favorite. There was no wait at 7:00 but crowded after 7:30am.!
author: D C.

description: Second visit for breakfast in past two days.  Very small place and it's worth it!  Come early and avoid the wait.  Large portions, good coffee and reasonable prices.  Definitely recommend this place for breakfast!
author: Deidra W.

description:
Frittata combo
With fruit Bowl pieces and cubes potato's
Very nice
Giant egg omelette like a pie
author: Ryan G.

description:
Just finished the 6am (a savory crepe). Very good. The wife had a fritatta, and she loved it. We also ordered a waffle for junior, and it was equally excellent. 

Their fruit and coffee are also very good. 

Service was outstanding.
author: Fletcher G.

description: When I searched on yelp for vegan this place came up.  Was greeted quickly by a server.  When asked about vegan fair, he said we really don't have that. I ask if we can get a vegetable sandwich, lettuce tomato avocado onion,  all the things on the menu.  Server says, well they don't like to make custom orders.  But I can ask. Server asks amd cook says no. Server comes back to tell us no, but just pick a sandwich and remove what you don't want.  Decided they didn't really want our business.  Server was nice enough. Prices too high for omitting half the items on the $14 sandwich.  Walked down to Joannies Happy Days Diner. Had a vegetarian sandwich on the menu. Remove mayo and cheese, plus fries for $7.95.
author: Katheryn W.

description: Breakfast here is great. They have a creative menu and the food always tastes fresh. Good service too.
author: David H.

description:
Waited 20 minutes at our table while the waitress dutifully ignored us, helped the two surrounding tables that were sat after us and didnt even bat an eye as she walked past. So screw it we took off.

How cool, i didnt realize my husband and myself developed invisability skills while here in the bay. 

So now, ill return the favor and never come here.
author: Ella A.

description: Amazing food here - the menu is very creative and food is beautifully prepared and served. The staff are very friendly and helpful. This is a great breakfast/ lunch place. Highly recommended!!!!
author: Alice D.

description: Avocado toast...enough said. Great place for breakfast but get there early!
author: Ian E.

description: Excellent breakfast!  Definitely recommend.  Fresh, hot, great tasting food and prompt and friendly service.
author: Dana C.

description: Eight AM was a delightful little restaurant. The food was fantastic and just as pictured on yelp. The staff was friendly and quick!
author: Kate H.

description: Best breakfast, hands down!!  Staff was super friendly.  Casual atmosphere in the first floor of an old Victorian house!  The Belgian waffle with fresh Strawberries was amazing.
author: Don M.

description: Our breakfast experience was really good. We were seated quickly, and the service was great. It's a little pricy, but our food was really good. The crepes are solid, and the traditional American breakfast was cooked properly.
author: Jason J.

description:
New kid on the block blows the doors off breakfast 

Well last time I was in San Fransico I went to my favorite waffle and fresh fruit restaurant Pergamino Cafe and was beyond disapointed that they closed. 

So now a year or more later I headed up to columbas and leavenworth and see I a newly remodeled restaurant EIGHT AM in the old perganino cafe building.

Its clean the food looked great and wait for it they have awsome fruit covered waffles with wiped cream. 

This was truly a great breafast the waffle was awesome the bacon was perfect great coffee and the staff were fabulous.

EIGHT AM 
1323 columbus Ave  San Fransico CA 94133
415-292-4888
author: Carl L.

description: My husband and I came to San Fran on our honeymoon and ended up starting every day of our trip with brunch at Eight AM. It is seriously the best! It's a cute and cozy little place, doesn't feel touristy at all. We tried something new off the menu just about every day and were seldom disappointed. Our personal favorites were the avocado toast and the Castro frittata. The service was fast and friendly, we hardly had to wait for a table- 15 minutes max, and that was only one time. I highly recommend this place for breakfast for anyone in the area!
author: Laura C.

description: Fantastic find. Corner of Columbus and N point. Frittatas were amazing. Fruit. Service and food five star!!
author: Kim J.

description: Amazing breakfast!! I had the blueberry shortcake croissant with fresh fruit and it was to die for. My boyfriend had a frittata and loved it. The fruit cup was also impressive and delicious! Definitely the best breakfast in the area. And the service was incredible!!
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
Overall the food was tasty but not remarkable, coffee and latte were better than most and the service was pretty good.

It was a busy Saturday morning with lines out the door of most places, when we came across this spot. Despite being only third on the list it did take a little while to get a table mostly due to the staff having to clean and set the table while also serving tables.

Once we sat down though the service was great, lots of coffee refills, people checking up on us and prompt food/drinks. I had the french toast and my gf had the ham fritatta. The French toast was pretty good but nothing really special about it (great portion size  though). The fritatta had loads of veggies in it,  which was a plus, not to mention the potatoes with scallions were unbelievable.

We would come back if we ever stayed in the area again but wouldn't wait long here as it didn't really stand out.
author: Trevor N.

description: A warm welcome on a slightly chill, yet sunny Wednesday, always puts a smile on my face. Arrived before the rush, choose inside (a bit warmer). Plenty of room, great art and clean. Service was friendly and prompt! Food, fresh, tasty and aesthetically pleasing! I nice quick healthy choice!
author: Catherine W.

description:
Service is fast and very nice.
Food in general is very good.
Really good breakfast choice about 10:00am.
Clean place.
Quality of food is good and fresh.
Recommended.
author: Carlos V.

description: Wow this spot was amazing! It was one of the only places open as early as we wanted. We're from out of town and found it by chance. The service was friendly and efficient. The food was delicious and the portions were quite large. If I'm ever in San Fran again I'll definitely have breakfast here!
author: Elena C.

description: I had the frittata and matcha green tea latte. It made me forget all my troubles and was a great start to my morning in San Fransisco!
author: Anya I.

description: Literally, one of the best breakfast places I've ever been to. Fantastic fruit bowls and juices, and everything else was just perfect!
author: David W.

description: If you need a break from the overly fried and greasy breakfasts at most places, order the avocado toast three ways at Eight AM. It comes with three large pieces of toast spread with avocado- one topped with an egg, another with bacon, and one with tomato. It also comes with a large side of fresh fruit salad. Simple ingredients, very fresh. Delicious.
author: April K.

description: Super good and super quick! I got the avocado toast with fresh fruit and it was awesome. We also got a strawberry crepe. I'm paid for an hour and a half parking, but only used 30 minutes they were so quick! I'd highly recommend
author: Amanda N.

description: Very good place for breakfast in a super turisty part of town. The egg dish was a little over done (as other have mentioned). I had the toast three ways which was great. Coffee was excellent. Service was excellent. Prices were super reasonable. The fruit salad that came with breakfast was a stand-out. Usually you get a couple pieces of melon. Here they give you a nice assortment, including berries.
author: Jen G.

description: What a wonderful surprise. It is a small, cool, clean, fun, bright breakfast/lunch location near the fisherman's wharf area. Their breakfast offerings were amazing. Wait till you see the football that comes with your breakfast. I recommend you share your breakfast-- they are huge but it doesn't feel heavy. The egg offerings are perfect. The sourdough toast with Avacado is amazing. The service is wonderful. What a great start! See you next time!
author: Marco T.

description: Delicious and quick! Great service, with constant coffee cup refills. It's a yes for me.
author: Nathalie H.

description:
I actually came here due to the yelp reviews on here. We stayed at the holiday Inn across the street, didn't want chain restaurants.  Arrived about 9am. Small place maybe 8 tables inside and 4 outside. The avacado toast was so good. 3 pieces of toast with avacado and either bacon/tomatoes /egg. And nice fruit bowl. That was 14.00, my boys both got lox bagle 15.00, sodas 2.00 (can) and 3.00 apple juice.
  Food came out fast. Only 1 unisex bathroom. They all help each other with drinks/etc. Very good. Would go back.
author: B L.

description: Avocado toast is bomb! The fruit bowl was so fresh and a perfect side. Great service, made you feel super welcome. Yummy!
author: Katlyn H.

description: Prompt service and really great breakfast. I had the avocado toast and as someone from central Pennsylvania, it was a perfect combination of California flavors and home cooking you could get in rural America.
author: David F.

description: My dudes, im smashin that muh fuhhh like button. I got toast, not one, not two, but three ways. They wildin out here at eight AM.
author: Katelyn R.
