description: The food was good but the service lack of speed and of personal touch. Plus they charged an 18% gratuity On parties four or more. The hot water for the tea was lukewarm.
author: Brandon L.

description: Great food great service, fresh fruit was amazing, avocado toast was phenomenal, it's large portion so could be shared
author: Mike O.

description: Very limited menu with steep prices. Nothing special. Grapefruit juice was freshly squeezed and delicious but we will not be coming back.
author: Zee Z.

description: We were staying at fisherman wharf for a long weekend. Decided to try 8 am since it was very close to our hotel. It was very small so people were waiting outside in the rain. The food was very good and the service was even better. It was so good that we came back for breakfast the next day as well.
author: Mike H.

description: This place was great. Best breakfast place we had in the area. The fruit was fresh and the food was cooked to perfection. Customer service was A1 and the place was super clean. This place apparently gets really busy during the day. We went towards the end of their business hours so it was not busy at all. Our hotel was not near this place, but the drive to get here was MORE than worth it. If you want breakfast... go here!
author: Robb F.

description: Great breakfast spot. We had avocado toast and banana nutella crepe and they were both delicious. Their grapefruit juice is fresh squeezed and is highly recommended.
author: Mohammad m.

description:
Frittata was good but crepes and waffles were "meh". Potatoes were tasteless. As for service...horrible. We sat for 15 minutes before someone asked us for drinks and that took another 10 minutes (had to ask 3 times).

Not worth the price and wait.
author: Greg M.

description: We had a delicious breakfast here. We were staying at the Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf and decided to walk to this place. I'm so glad we did. Everything was delicious from the avocado toast to the fresh fruit salad, to the crepes. Everything was top notch and worth the wait. I hope I visit San Francisco again soon so we can stop here again.
author: Nedine Y.

description: This has to be the best breakfast I have ever had! The avocado toast three ways is a must when dining here!
author: Robert E.

description:
On a scale of 1 to holycrap, this place is awesome.  Their breakfast options are creative and perfectly executed.  The waitstaff, eager and friendly, should probably enjoy these quiet first days of opening, because when people find out how good their food is, there's going to be a line out the door.  Open 6:30 to 4pm, you're going to find mostly early am cuisine, but we're considering stopping by again for lunch.  And possibly tomorrow for breakfast again.  And then the next day. 

P.S. Their coffee isn't messing around.  Neither is their homemade syrup (order some on the side, just because).  Seriously.
author: Sixfiftytwo X.

description: Found Eight AM on Yelp and am so happy we chose it for breakfast on a Sunday morning. We were seated outside right away and our food came in a jiffy. We got the 3 way avocado with smoked salmon as well as the berry french toast. Everything was delicious! Would definitely recommend it to anyone interested in a great breakfast/brunch
author: Esther K.

description: This place is the bomb-diggity! I was in town for the weekend and needed a hearty, fresh-cooked breakfast to get me going, and Eight AM was right across the street from my hotel. If you stay at the Holiday Inn, don't waste your time with hotel food. Cross the street for the real deal! Their food is fresh and delicious. I tried both of their popular dishes, the avocado toast and the Haight-Ashbury frittata, and they were super yummy. On top of that, the service is fantastic. The friendly staff make sure you never reach the bottom of your mug or glass, and the owner stopped by my table both days to ask if I was enjoying the food. If it looks like a long wait, don't worry . . . it's totally worth it!
author: Jeff T.

description: Food was exceptional.  Little pricey but every bite was delicious.  My son got the French toast and I got the fisherman's wharf fritta.  They both were amazing.  Let very full and satisfied.
author: Jennifer K.

description:
EAT HERE! It is so delicious and fresh. My family and I came here two days in a row because we couldn't get enough. The first time we came I ordered the bagel two ways- one with Nutella, bananas, and crunchy cereal and the other with eggs and cheese. Both were delicious and it came with a big bowl of fruit. My other family members ordered the avocado toast (without bacon) and loved it! They ordered that both times we came. Outside seating was great and pleasant! Inside seating is a little stuffy but not unpleasant. I couldn't recommend this place higher! 
*prices are a little high but not ridiculous
author: Emma W.

description:
I had a Chai Tea Latte and ordered a Bagel Fix-Up in two styles with a fruit cup on the side. The Chai Tea Latte was nice: sweeter and not as strong as traditional Indian chai (which I drink almost every morning). It was a large serving too, so I appreciated that.

You can choose two of six styles on the menu for your bagel, and each half will be made in one style. I chose styles 2 and 3. Style 2 has mayonnaise, scrambled eggs, and shredded cheddar. I hardly noticed the mayonnaise. This one was kind of bland, to be honest. I much preferred style 3: sunny-side up egg on guacamole base. Style 3 also comes with sliced black forest ham, but I asked not to have it because I'm a vegetarian. I wish they would've offered some sort of replacement for the ham (mushroom is typical at many restaurants). But it was decent nonetheless.

I wish I had tried the crepes or frittatas, because they looked mighty good. Next time!
author: Ashish B.

description: Excellent service, fresh food, well worth the wait! The berry waffles, 6am crepe and frittatas are delicious!
author: JJ W.

description:
It's a small quaint breakfast place with very tasty food. We had the avocado toast which was very relishing. The Belgian waffles were well made and the maple syrup was not too sweet (the way we love it)

It was a perfect way to start our trip to SFO!!
author: James N.

description: Love this place! Came in for breakfast this morning and had a great experience. For the pudding lovers the chia seed pudding was amazing. Castro Frittata was also delicious.
author: Irina C.

description: Wow! Amazing breakfast and brunch place. The food was fresh and unique! I was happy to have so much fresh fruit and veggies to start my day. Avocado toast was so good. Raspberry croissant also amazing!
author: Jill P.

description:
Wow, I have no words for this place. Simply amazing. Dined here today with one friend; we arrived about 7:45 AM and ordered a 6 AM crepe and the avocado toast 3 ways. Both dishes were delicious. The servers were exceedingly kind. Excellent food and fast, good service. 

I have a nut allergy and informed the server upon arriving. When I was dining, the chef came out to me and informed me that he had modified the recipe to ensure that none of my food came into contact with nuts! What great service! I have never had this happen to me even in high end restaurants. 

Tipped near 40% for their amazing service and accommodations and definitely will be returning the next time I'm in the city for brunch.
author: Gracie G.

description: Met a friend here for breakfast on a Sunday. We wanted to get in before the brunch crowd. We got here at 9:30 and got a seat in about 5-10 mins. I always judge a breakfast place first by its coffee and this place hit the mark. Coffee was delicious - strong but smooth. My friend and I ordered the dish that has 3 toasted breads all with avocado each with an egg, tomato and bacon. We asked for no bacon and just 2 fried egg toasts and they easily obliged. The egg was perfect - cooked medium so yoke was between firm and runny. Loved! And we split the toast with heirloom tomato. Yum!! Then we also split a berry crepe. Again - delicious. Reasonably priced and great service. Will definitely come back!
author: Marnie S.

description: Amazing food, quick service, friendly staff, clean environment. A bit pricey but worth it!
author: Sofia P.

description: Great breakfast, but extremely expensive. For a family of 4 expect to pay $100. We had 4 entres, 2 coffees, side of bacon and 2 fresh squeezed OJ. The food was very delicious and generous portions,  but outrageous prices. Each OJ was $6.00. All fresh ingredients. Great service too.  I'd give it 5 stars if it wasn't for the price.
author: Jennifer N.

description: Found this place randomly on Yelp near our hotel. Very friendly and attentive service. The chef came out twice to see how everything was. Wait staff was on point and the food... A-maz-ing!!!
author: Amy S.

description: Very delicious.Good breakfast / brunch place. The service is great had a nice atmosphere. Highly recommend  avacodo toast and blueberry shortcake. Good tourist destination  for breakfast. Walking distance from Marriott and holiday Inn hotels.
author: Dele R.

description:
I'm a complete sucker for avocado toast, so when my mom was in town and I ran out of avocados, I immediately suggested we try this place out. We went at about 9:30 am on a Saturday morning, and the line was long. We probably waited about 30-40 minutes for our table for 2, which was not helped by the people sitting by themselves in the front at tables meant for 4-6 people.....

Once we sat down, we ordered the avocado toast 3 ways as well as the granola with yogurt. The granola with yogurt was absolutely amazing, very fresh and light! The bacon with avocado was the best option out of the 3 ways, so next time I'll just be ordering that :)
author: Paige S.

description: This place has the most unique brunch menu.  I chose the three way avocado toast and a vanilla latte.  Servers were super attentive and gracious about letting us stay past closing time to finish our food and use the restroom.
author: Jenna F.

description:
Cute little restaurant that delivers on its rating.  I had the lox and bagels and it was delicious.  Wide and daughter had waffles and they were really good as well.  My son had the bagels two ways and he was pleased with his choice.  

Service was pretty good and we had a relaxing breakfast in a lovely atmosphere.  Plus, it's near Fishermans Wharf and the cable car stop, so you can walk around and do some sight seeing afterwards.

Be prepared for a wait, however.  We went in Monday morning and ended up waiting for 30-40 minutes.  It was worth the wait, though.

All in all, we would highly recommend this spot for a good breakfast.
author: Sam S.

description: Cute and very nice restaurant for breakfast and lunch! Got there around 9, after we came in it got busy. I got the two way bagel (ham, egg & guac /cream cheese & strawberries& blueberries) that came w a fruit cup, bro got a sugar waffle, cousin got the sausage & eggs w potatoes & a fruit cup. I tried everything they had bc of my inner fat girl curiosity. Everything was really good. No complaints at all hence the 5 stars! Idk if it's just sf or 2 bagels & a fruit cup costs $12 everywhere else also but yeah price is a little much for me but I can understand y, it's a small place & the food seem to b really fresh & nothing microwaved or frozen!
author: Kristine L.

description:
1st time here, actually went to the Hollywood cafe 1st but the line was around the restaurant. Decided to stop here and the wait at 9am was only 10 minutes (not bad).

Food service was good. Place is really small but a quaint spot for about 4 servers they where able to manage the entire restaurant.

Food was good I had the avacado  toast and it was all that it was hyped to be. Added a little chulula and it was good to go. The fruit was extremely fresh and had a lot of variety as well.

My girlfriend had the French Toast which she liked but the edges on the French Toast where a little hard and tough for her liken. The blueberry jam ontop defanitly added a different touch.

Conclusion:
Atmosphere 3.5/5 nothing to fancy
Service 4/5
Food 4/5

Will come back again next time and recommend this place if you are nearby.
author: Bryan K.

description: Great food! Extremely delish! Loved the environment and the people are very friendly. My boyfriend and I would be back! Best breakfast in a long time! We wish this was in vail! Go it's worth it!
author: Britney B.

description: Food is great. I had french toast and it was the best I've ever had. My wife had the Lombard Sandwich, it was great too specially the dressing on the side salad. Only thing I  that the young waiter could have been more cordial even though the server was very nice.
author: Connoisseur B.

description: The family ate breakfast here three days in a row. Service is on point. Food is great. Two of four of are vegan and they were very accommodating to any substitutes or changes. The kids loved the crepes. I recommend the avocado toast. Super fresh and LOTS of fresh fruit with everything. A definite bonus to me.
author: Larry M.

description: This brunch place was amazing! My husband and I came here while we were on vacation and were really excited about all the different menu selections. I got the scrambled eggs with sausage, potatoes and fruit! It was just the right amount of food. My husband got the bagel select 2 option. He picked Nutella with bananas and rice crispies and avocado and ham. We both really enjoyed the different bagel options. I would highly recommend coming here if you want to have a satisfying breakfast experience!!
author: Dana B.

description:
Delicious. 

The frittata (I had the Castro) was excellent and the fruit salad was excellent. The only issue was that it's a bit out of the way and a long walk from where I live in SOMA. I really enjoyed the food and will be back when I am in that neck of the woods.
author: Robin P.

description: Absolutely the best breakfast anywhere!  Always make a point to get down here when I'm in the Bay Area.  Food is always fresh and prepared flawlessly, servers are super friendly and attentive.
author: Brian G.

description: Meal was fabulous. Avocado toast-yes! Also, the crepes were very tasty. 4 stars due to the fact that they bring out dishes as they become ready- so our 5 person group received food at different times.
author: Cindy H.

description:
Wasn't really impressed with the brunch here. Ordered the avocado toast with egg, bacon, and heirloom tomato and fruit bowl. Although the food was very fresh and clean, nothing special about the place that you couldn't get elsewhere let alone make at home.

PS. My heirloom tomato slice was more like a house hot tomato. Was disappointed in that. Oh, and it was small, not like in some of the pictures seen.
author: David H.

description: Small place, but crowded.  Really good experience and a definite repeat in an area that is not known for good food places.  Avocado toast was good, crepes were awesome and frittata look crazy yummy.
author: Steve S.

description: Visiting San Francisco..You have to take time to go to Eight AM!  Delicious breakfast with an incredible menu and service.  Only difficulty is deciding what to eat...We will come back tomorrow to order something new.  My daughter and I ordered Strawberry Crepes and the Avocado toast three ways.  Freshest ingredients and a generous portion.  Great service!! Thank you Eight AM for starting our day perfect.
author: Leslie N.

description: A soft 5. Was tempted to give them 4 stars because of the unorganized process of being seated. However, the speedy service and delicious meals that our table was served makes it impossible to not rate them 5 stars. I recommend the threesome avocado toast or Nutella crepes! Also, the fruit bowl was large and fresh. Our server was friendly
author: Ailish R.

description:
Love this place.  We ordered a Nob Hill Frittata and a 11am Crepe. Both were delicious. The frittata portions were generous and both entrées were delicious. 

Service was excellent and quick. Overall, a nice place to have brunch with friends. Also it doesn't have a line out the door which is a nice breath of fresh air in north breach.
author: Akshai B.

description: Such an amazing neighborhood gem. Delicious food, great service. Highly recommend the avo toast trio and fresh squeezed OJ. Will be back very soon!
author: Gabrielle O.

description: First time here while visiting SF.  Checked the reviews and they were not wrong.  Service was great with smiling and friendly staff.  Got bagel 2 ways, avocado toast and 6am and 9am crepe.  All were delicious.  Would totally come here again when in the area and recommend highly for a good breakfast.  Lots of food though so come hungry.
author: Ramil B.

description:
Came here while on vacation last weekend. We were looking for a nice brunch spot in the area and stumbled upon Eight AM on Yelp. The food looked too good to pass up.

They didn't disappoint. We have the avacado 3 ways and one of their sandwiches. Both were delicious, fresh, and had a great presentation.

If your looking for a good brunch/lunch spot, check them out.
author: Oliver O.

description: This place is AMAZING! I was a little confused by their menu at first, but once my food arrived, I was beyond stoked. Before I even took my first bite I knew my meal was going to be amazing! The fruit salad I received was beautifully presented & looked exactly like my friend's next to me. There were 4 of us, we all ordered different dishes, and we all thoroughly enjoyed our food! Next time I'm in The City, I'm definitely coming back here for brunch!
author: Heather M.

description:
I read the reviews/ratings last night and we went for breakfast this AM.  Really this is a simple, clean, well-run place with a great menu.
My daughter had a crepe and I had the bagel fix up (chose a savory and sweet combo) with fruit salad (very fresh).  I will remember this spot for future trips to SF.
author: Erica E.

description:
No wait time at 830am. Small place with GREAT flavors. Best place in SF !!!!


You have to try this place !!!!
author: Issis A.

description:
I was super excited to try this place out after seeing all the pictures on Yelp.  I'm a sucker for a giant fruit bowl with my breakfast.  Eight AM certainly did not disappoint.  I had the frittata with chicken sausage.  I often regret ordering chicken sausage with breakfast as I am such a big fan of more traditional breakfast meats, but this was REALLY good chicken sausage.  In addition, the frittata came with well seasoned potatoes and (yes!!!) a giant fruit bowl.  All the ingredients were fresh and delicious.  And, thanks to the fruit, while I left feeling stuffed, I also felt like I had been fairly healthy.  

We had no problems with the service.  The waitress was very nice when someone at my table decided to change their drink order at the last minute.  

Overall, a very positive experience.
author: Kelly K.

description: Oh boy! This place is a must try... the food was on point and so was the service... great job guy's... most definitely see you soon =]
author: Danny S.

description: I love this place. My girlfriends and I came upon this little place as we were walking from our hotel to the Wharf. We ate breakfast and it was yummy. A friend and I shared a three avocado toast breakfast. The toast came with smashed avocado and bacon on one, tomatoes on another, and another one with egg. It came with a huge bowl of fresh fruit. The  I am definitely going back there again.
author: Betsy G.

description: Cannot believe that such a 'meh' place has 4.5 stars on Yelp. There is nothing special about this place - the food was boring, the service was average, ambiance was not good. We had the avocado toast three ways and the Russian Hill frittata. Both were extremely bland and didn't taste particularly fresh, contrary to what many reviews here suggest. Bottom line, there are so many great places to eat in SF, don't waste your time with this underwhelming spot.
author: Casey N.

description: Stoked on this chia seed pudding. Thanks for not serving crap even though it's fishermans wharf
author: Laurel M.

description: Great service even better food. Had bacon and eggs with a fruit bowel and it was cooked just right. I would highly recommend if you are looking for something to eat for breakfast.
author: Jon D.

description: There is definitely something here for everyone -- savory/sweet crepes/sandwiches/anything you'd want for brunch. Not cheap though and there is.....sometimes a line. Aww man..
author: Mingmei N.

description:
Delicious food, friendly staff. Not much of a wait when we went. Highly recommend.

We had the avocado toast and the bagel fix-up, both were great.
author: Dan W.

description: Excellent brunch in this small place on a late Sunday morning. Service was fast and they even squeezed me in a full room as a single diner. The frittata was light and airy with plenty of filling. I had the one with chicken sausage and manchego. The home fries were some of the best I've had in a long time. The fruit was ripe and sweet. Great experience.
author: Dana L.

description:
Clean. Friendly. Stellar food. The place was packed from when we showed up to when we left and yet it never felt crowded or stuffy. 

I hate packed restaurants, slow service and long waits. I'm an Italian from NJ. This place was great. Fuggettaboudit. 

Eat here.
author: Michael L.

description: Came here to grab a quick bite . This place is absolutely delicious . Had Avocado toast 3 ways , and a side of Chicken Apple sausage . Fruit was sweet and crisp . The service was great . You must try !
author: Becky M.

description: Great little place.  Awesome food and good service.  Added to our visit to San Francisco.
author: Alan M.

description: Found this place through Yelp and I wasn't disappointed. I had the Raspberry and Banana Croissant with the fruit cup and everything was so good. The service was great as well. Orange juice was freshly squeezed. Definitely a great breakfast spot in SF!
author: Amber V.

description: Seriously the best place ever. Such yummy food that doesn't guilt trip you. Great location (walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf)
author: Yadira R.

description: The staff were really awesome and super attentive. Food was really good too--shoutout for an awesome fruit salad
author: Kevin S.

description: Great service, delicious food, and reasonably priced.  Nice little family run operation. Coffee is excellent here.  My family enjoyed the food and the artwork throughout by local artists.  We ate here 3 times for breakfast during our visit to SF.
author: Wayne C.

description: Really enjoyed our meal here. It's a tiny place and can get a little stuffy but still comfortable enough to enjoy your meal. We sat near the windows so the heat didn't bother us much. The food was great, very wholesome. Ate here with friends and everyone enjoyed their meal. It's a breakfast only place but they've got a great variety and get pretty creative. I ordered the half bagels: one with egg, avocado, & back forest ham, the other with Nutella and bananas. The perfect combination, breakfast & dessert! I would definitely recommend.
author: Ashley O.

description: Amazing breakfast. Very good quality of food, fruits and drinks. Superb. its a MUST visit place. Location wise also its in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf
author: Fiona D.

description: Matcha green tea latte and avocado toast for me. My boyfriend had fishermans wharf frittata. So delicious. Quick service. Convenient location. Busy so call ahead or be prepared for a 15 min wait.
author: Natasha N.

description: Food was okay, pretty pricy for what you were getting. We slip the avocado toast and the 6 am crepe. Everyone raves about the avocado toast but it wasn't anything special. I would recommend getting something else there.
author: Lawren B.

description: Great breakfast and really nice employees. It's a refreshing change from everything that goes on at fischermans wharf, not touristy. Really good, fresh and creative food.
author: Victoria M.

description: Awesome food. Don't fear the price. You get plenty to eat and it tastes amazing...and the presentation is super! The staff is great too!!
author: K F.

description: Nice place for breakfast/brunch. They offer a variety of egg-dishes (omelette, frittata, sandwhich, etc...) In healthy combinations. Close to fisherman's wharf.
author: Kenny W.

description: This was a little slice of compote heaven!!! I ordered french toast, my husband the Raspberry croissant, my VERY picky 10 yr old ordered the sugar waffle and EVERYTHING was perfect. **fresh squeezed orange! Mmmm!!** service was fast and nice too!!  Even chased me down street to give me my purse. :)   Thanks for a perfect send off as we leave SF!!!!
author: Kim S.

description: The avocado toast was great, the staff do nothing but hustle and be warm to customers, and my friend loved his fritata.  The fruit salad was amazing w/ melon and berries. It is right across from the Cannery at between Ghirardelli and the Wharf. We found it easiest to park 3 blocks uphill on Leavenworth instead of paying too much to park closer. I will be going again the next time I need breakfast in the city.  It is not too far from AT&T Park via the waterfront ... we went to the game after that. The wait was 25 minutes on arrival at 10 AM on Saturday, not too bad.
author: John L.

description: Love this breakfast place! The food is so tasty, fresh and the portions are generous. Fritatas are served  with roasted potatoes and a bowl of mixed fruits. The haight ashbury fritata is highly recommended.  There's not a lot of seating so be prepared to wait ... it's worth it though!
author: Monette R.

description:
Waited almost 30 minutes for a table, then waited more than an hour for food. Had to check in with the waiter at some point, and they said they JUST started making our food.

I ordered a Lox Bagel, which was mediocre. My friend got a Russian Hill Fritata, which was also just okay. Definitely not worth the wait. 

The wait was so long, they gave us our coffee (redeeming quality is the cafe mocha -- pretty good) for free. Thanks, but I've waited at other places for much longer and at least the food was worth it. This wasn't the case here.
author: Francesca P.

description: After a quick breakfast search on Yelp for the area, we decided on Eight AM. We lucked out and sat down at one of the last open tables before the line started forming. We had the berries waffle, and avocado toast. Both were delicious, and the service was friendly and quick.
author: Brian M.

description: Excellent service and great food! The portions are huge and worth the price! This little hole in the wall is a gem.
author: Jacqueline R.

description: Great breakfast spot. Enjoying the fresh food and hot coffee. Unique breakfast items and great service!
author: Janice G.

description: Delicious! We were in the area and in the mood for brunch - plenty of seating at noon on a Friday. Service is courteous and we enjoyed many refills of our coffee.  I had the banana nut waffle with whipped cream and my fiancé had the Haight St. Frittata which came with a decent - sized fruit bowl and home fries. Delicious, good portion and reasonably priced. Great spot!
author: Linna F.

description: After waiting for 25 minutes to eat breakfast, we sat at our table inside for over 10 minutes without being helped. Other tables who sat after us were helped before us. Service was terrible.
author: Ray C.

description: This restaurant is amazing! The French toast with caramelized bananas was the best French toast I have ever had! We actually went two days in a row bc it was so amazing. My husband loved the avocado with toast. The service was amazing which helps the wait to get in the restaurant go fast. Highly recommended!
author: Britany W.

description:
Excellent breakfast 
The fruit was fresh the frittata was hot and the service was very good.
author: Richard M.

description: Five stars for every category. Great service, amazing food, clean and tastefully decorated, great location. We had the avocado toast and the asparagus frittata. Both were delicious and the side of fruit was fresh and perfect.  Can't say enough good things about this place!
author: Lori B.

description: Breakfast tastes as good as it looks. Came back a second time for the Avacado toast 3way.  Frittata also very good. Very fresh ingredients. Large portions, could have shared meal and still be full, but we are on vacation! Good service, they really hustle with morning rush and line out the door but worth it.
author: Susan H.

description: Delicious. Small and quaint. Nice staff. Relaxing. Nice bowl of fruit to add to the meal.
author: Tim G.

description: This place is legit for a breakfast that isn't the norm.  The coffee was delicious, the orange juice is freshly squeezed and has such a sweet taste of awesome.  The 3 piece toast w/guac, bacon, egg, tomato was awesome and we saw at least 10 others order it just in our short visit.  The mixed berries waffle w/fresh fruit was superb, fruit was bountiful and tasty.   A true location you should visit, not your typical breakfast but awesome.   We'll revisit soon!
author: Rick H.

description:
Wow! What a breath of fresh air! This is a small little cafe that delivers big results. We give this 4.5 stars out of 5. 

We had the 1 pm (Nutella/banana crepes), toast 3-ways, French toast & egg combo with bacon. Everything tastes very good. It was fresh and hot. The ONLY problem we had is that the Carmel was burned on the French toast so it tasted extremely bitter and burnt. We couldn't even eat half of it. BUT, when we told them he smiled and said that it was probably burnt when it was cooking & he would remove it from the bill. We weren't even telling him to remove it from the bill, he just offered. We just wanted them to know so it wouldn't happen to anyone in the future.

Overall, quaint and good-quality food. This will be our go-to breakfast spot next time we are in town.
author: Sylvia O.

description: Simply amazing. Quaint little place with amazing food, service and prices. Definitely try to get a seat outside to take in the ambiance, city.
author: Marlen M.

description: Very different kinda place and menu. Not a long wait, but had every table booked up. Great food choices too!!
author: Patricia F.

description: I feel this place is over hyped on Yelp. The food was just Okay and the service was good but definitely not the 4.5 worthy.  Worth a try if you want a quick bite...
author: Venkat R.

description: Just had breakfast here this morning, and it did NOT disappoint. The service was friendly and prompt. The food was delicious, fresh, and the portions are very substantial. My husband had a vegetarian frittata. It came with potatoes and a generous bowl of fruit. My 8 year old had a Belgian waffle (which she devoured), and my 5 year old had the French toast with fresh berries. I had the avocado toast 3 ways (I substituted the bacon for smoked salmon), and it was delicious. The sunny side up egg on my toast was perfectly cooked. We loved this place. We will definitely be back.
author: Aida A.

description:
I happened upon this wonderful place while going for a stroll. I can't believe how lucky I was to find it. Their inventive bagel creations are stellar. The fruit cup presented alongside them are fantastic. It's unfortunate that I discovered it on the last day of my vacation. If I come back to San Francisco, I'll be sure to look it up.

Seriously. This place is wonderful.
author: Bryan B.

description:
The service was great and we were seated quickly. Food was timely and delicious.
The food was Delicious and wonderfully fresh. The orange juice was awesome! Super friendly service. Great price for the quality!
author: Abigail C.

description: My son and I walked by and he saw someone's French toast so he had to have breakfast here-great choice! He had the French toast with berry compote and it was amazing according to him. He also had a side a bacon. I had the #1 bagel, it had cream cheese, strawberries, blueberries and honey. It was delicious, and I didn't think I would be blown away by a bagel but the high quality ingredients and presentation blew me away. The best part was it came with a fruit salad, and it wasn't the soggy, not so fresh fruit many breakfast places pass off. There was blackberries and kiwi in addition to the usual pineapple, banana and strawberries. You could tell it was freshly sliced fruit, nothing browning, soggy or limp. Service was excellent-we were kind of on a tight schedule to make a tour so I asked for the check as soon as the food came, and the server was great. The cook even came out to see if we enjoyed our food. So glad we happened to walk by and pop in!
author: Kelly M.

description:
This is easily the best brunch spot in the entire Fisherman's Wharf area. Bonus: There's a surprisingly low number of obnoxious tourists in your way.

The food is superb. The service is very attentive. The value for your money is good too. I'm really glad I stumbled upon Yelp reviews of this place. Would definitely go back again!
author: Kricket F.

description:
Service- 5 stars- the waiter was very nice and accommodating

French toast -5star. But very very sweet like a dessert. 

Frittata- the Castro - 4stars. It was very good a lot of flavor plus it's served with potatoes and fruit. Very filling! You won't need lunch 

Frittata- haight- 3 stars - not that much flavor so it got "boring" to eat after a while. The potatoes were very tasty and the fruit very fresh 

Coffee-3 stars- the latte was good but kinda "thin" also no foam. It didn't give me that rich, thick coffee tast I like but it was satisfactory 

Orange juice- 1 star- it was extremely expensive. 6 dollars for store bought juice. My mom got the juice not knowing the price. Don't buy it. 

Price - expensive for food quality
author: Jasmine B.

description: Seriously the best breakfast I have ever had! I went here with my family and had the 3 way avocado toast, mix up bagels (Nutella and banana and the forest ham egg and avocado bagels), French toast with banana and the California sandwich! There wasn't a single thing we didn't love! Everything was delicious! Also each plate comes with a huge side of fresh fruit! I would definitely recommend this place! You won't regret it!
author: Kiernan H.

description:
Very Good, but Expensive

The food was delicious and the service was great.  We were shocked when we received a bill for $48 for two of us for breakfast!  All we had was two entrees, two coffees, and two orange juices.  Yowza!
author: Ted Q.

description: Eight AM...what can I say...Extremely tasty ..healthy..and a beautiful presentation great customer service... Wonderful she walk down that way clean atmosphere parking unfortunately leaves a lot to be desired but it's not their fault... It's San Francisco... Where is the food it was flavorful... Light... Fruit was fresh and very very sweet
author: Regina P.

description: The food was quick, the presentation was wonderful, but the taste was even better. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful.
author: Mila C.

description: So delicious. Excellent breakfast. I always make a spot or two every time I'm in Denver. Yum! Yum! Yum!
author: Brandi D.

description: Amazing breakfast!   Fresh squeezed oj, delicious food... crepes, bagels, fresh fruit, frittatas....friendly service.  In San Francisco!   What more could you ask for?
author: K H.

description: Food was fresh and arrived fast and hot! Excellent service here and very clean establishment!
author: Mark T.

description: Amazing food and great service! Small restaurant with only two people working, but that had no effect on the quality of the food or the customer service! I ordered the avocado toast and it was delicious! Perfect flavor combinations, and the fruit bowl that came with it was fresh and tasty too. We waited about 20 minutes but it was so worth the wait! The waiters are fast and very pleasant. Considering coming back tomorrow!
author: Erin S.

description: Great service, great food.  Fresh fruit, yummy crepe breakfast :)
author: L M.

description: came here during our stay in SF and it was one of a few places that were open for breakfast at the time we wanted to start our day. We came around 8am on a Friday and there was no wait. Wait staff was friendly and helpful. I ordered the 3-way toast and my friends ordered eggs. Pretty ok food, wasn't blown away but it did the job to help us carb up for our day.
author: Fiona C.

description:
Fabulous and fun! So nice to eat at a sidewalk cafe near such a touristy area. We had avocado toast and the chia pudding. Both delicious and healthy! Service was friendly and fast. We will be back. 

Nice spot to start a family outing. My daughter and I ate breakfast here then walked to the cable car turnaround. Rode up the hill to the Cable Car Museum. Then hopped back on for a ride down with a gorgeous view.
author: Vanessa L.

description:
food is very nice, i didnt expect that at the very beginning. crews there are friendly too.
I will visit it again!
author: Erick C.

description: So delicious! I am already telling all my friends about this place! Amazing service and the food is to die for. We had the Caramelized bananas French toast and Haight Ashbury Frittata both completely gone due to the scrumptiousness lol. Also, the chai latte was really good and I don't like chai (I personally ordered the latte which was standard fair).
author: Alina S.

description:
A great new breakfast spot in the midst of the hustle and bustle of Fisherman's Wharf. Wonderful for people watching, filling up before a jam-packed day of sight seeing, or just enjoying a brisk SF morning with a delicious meal. 

I ordered the avocado toast three ways ($13) after seeing all the pictures on yelp. I have a healthy appetite in the mornings and even I had trouble finishing off my plate. The "side" of fresh fruit here comes with the whole shebang -- sweet honeydew, pineapple, raspberries, blackberries, strawberries, blueberries, kiwi, and bananas. Your typical brunch joint would charge $8 for this alone! The avocado toasts are a yummy healthy indulgence -- my favorite of course being the avocado paired with the crispy thick cut bacon. This dish is a must try! 

The servers are friendly and attentive (the chef even came out to check on how we were doing), they have a dog-friendly patio, and the food is fresh, unique, and most importantly, extremely tasty! 

Come check this place out -- two thumbs up!
author: Tiffany W.

description: Ok breakfast food. Only came to this place because it was close to my hotel. I wish I had gone to the Brazilian restaurant around the corner because this place was too bland.
author: Heyyou C.

description: We arrived right as they opened and snagged a nice window seat.  It did get busy after about half an hour but even then it didn't seem like there was an outrageous wait.  The food came out a bit in waves, but the later stuff was worth the wait!  The fruit in and on the side was all very fresh and high quality.  We had crepes, waffles, and an egg dish and everything was just superb!  We would definitely come back!
author: Amy F.

description:
This place is fantastic! I got the avocado toast trio and my boyfriend got the omelet and both were very good. My two recommendations are 

1) avocado toast should have avocado as the main ingredient. There was only a light smear of avocado on the toast. 

2) fruit salad was a fantastic touch but should be optional! I felt bad letting so much good fruit go to waste but I truly couldn't finish it all!
author: Sarah M.

description: Thanks Yelp! This little gem was a block from our hotel and Yelp reviews promised a good breakfast. The food was incredibly fresh and well presented, service was friendly and welcoming.
author: Heather J.

description: Great little place for breakfast. The wait can be long since it's right across from the Holiday Inn & it's not super big, but well worth it. Portions are huge, which is great if splitting plates with kids.
author: Nat X.

description:
I absolutely love love this place. 

My favorite is the fancy fruit bowl ( which comes with all most of their items). The caramelized banana french toast and fresh berries waffle is my guilty pleasure.

Definitely try this place out!
author: Brenda C.

description: We had fresh squeezed orange juice, Berry Waffles and 3-way avocado toast. Fast, friendly service.
author: Samuel K.

description: Super yummie and fresh and service was excellent-- food took a bit to come out of kitchen, but wait was not bad, as the coffee was good!  Crepes look Devine, but we had frittata and it was delicious! Will definitely return on new am trip to The City. Clean! Clean, clean! Great waitstaff!
author: Janet M.

description: Great breakfast/brunch spot. Food is delicious and coffee is great. It's a cozy small place. Staff is nice. Prices are moderate but not cheap.
author: Dayton H.

description:
Simple, fresh, and tasty. I went on a Sunday at about 10AM--prime brunch time--and only had to wait 10 minutes for a table. I've waited 1.5hrs or more for brunch in San Francisco, so Eight AM is a great option if you're trying to avoid crazy lines.

I had the avocado toasts: 1 with bacon, 1 with a fried egg, and 1 with tomato. It came with a fruit salad, which was larger than I expected and was much better than the mediocre honeydew and cantaloupe salads lots of places serve. The meal was hearty and healthy and I left feeling very satisfied. I was at an outside table and people passing by kept ogling my food because it looked so good!

The waiters were friendly and the service was quick. A little pricey but this is San Francisco so I wasn't expecting anything different. I'd go back and recommend it for a tasty, healthy breakfast/brunch!
author: Christine B.

description: If you're looking for breakfast this is the place to come so many options and all delicious great friendly service nice ambience perfect place to start off your day.
author: Joe S.

description: I found this restaurant thanks to Yelp, it was a short walk from our hotel and it was well worth it. The service was great and the food was awesome.
author: Rodney B.

description: Coffee kept coming, which is always nice. Got the 10am crepes carmalized bananas and whip cream YUM. The wife got the double sided bagel and she enjoyed it very much as well. This place is a very good spot to get some breakfast. The staff is very friendly as well.
author: Ryan F.

description: I came with my family of six at 8am on a Wednesday. (Two adults and kids aged 9-16). Fast, friendly service.  The food was excellent.  Egg dishes came with a large bowl of delicious fresh fruit and a bowl of home fries. Yogurt parfait also had yummy fresh fruit; nice chia seed pudding option for my vegan daughter. Highly recommend. Reasonable prices.
author: Julia T.

description: The place is very small and simple but the food is really good. Fresh ingredients and big portions. Be prepared to wait many minutes and the waiting list is long but is worth it.
author: Micheal G.

description: I ordered waffles which both look and tasted good. The employees were cheerful and thanked me by name. Only complaint is that it was a bit stuffy in there. Perhaps they needed to turn the AC up.
author: G G.

description: I was underwhelmed. Don't get me wrong, everything was good. I got the avocado three ways. It was good and It tasted like something I could have made myself. I did end up salting my tomato and egg. The bowl of fruit was nice. The cappuccino was very average. I liked the location but overall I would just try another place next time.
author: Jessica S.

description:
Cons: Slow service - 40- 50 min for food. They bring out plates at different times. Food, especially yogurt parfait is WAY too sweet. Parking difficult. 

Pro: Take phone reservations (although they say us and then moved us for an onsite customer).
author: Celeste H.

description: We were very happy to have found this little spot. Was our last breakfast here and was very impressed. Ambiance was very lovely and the host/waiter /cashier was very friendly. Each meal came with a bowl of fruit which is seasonal and quite tasty. Hot chocolate was delicious and the coffee was good. Would definitely return here.
author: Kerri B.

description: Excellent food and service. Small but friendly feel. Breakfast was amazing. Worth venturing slightly away from a fishermans Wharf.
author: Paul G.

description: Food was fresh, light and excellent. We were looking for something easy, we stumbled across this place. The fruit bowls were amazing. The orange juice was to die for. My husband got a croissant sandwich, I had avocado toast, both were great. Service was good and prices were reasonable.
author: Sara H.

description: Delicious food! Great location. Had to wait 20 minutes or so but it was worth the wait. Avocado toast three ways looked amazing. Solid restaurant for brunch.
author: Yessenia M.

description: Great food and service. Banana nut waffles were very good. My hubby had potatoes which were very good also. Fresh fruit is amazing too.  Outside tables also depending on weather. Yum
author: S K.

description: Unlimited refills on the coffee !!! Yummy food and a variety of things to choose from ( crepes, frittata's, bagels, toasts, sandwiches and more ).  The environment is very casual and it seems to be a popular place so come early or expect to wait . I gave it 4 stars because environment can be a little better . I sat by the back and there are boxes everywhere and storage. I enjoyed my meal (avocado toast) and will certainly come back again. Service was pretty fast.
author: Valerie W.

description: Great service, great food. Well executed from start to finish. Observable care in the prep and presentation of a really good breakfast. Thanks Kevin! Great service. We will be back the next two mornings before we head north.
author: Emmett T.

description: No sure the waitress's could be more friendly, welcoming frankly adorable.  Service is awesome we were given free samples while we waited.  Service is everything, but food is great place is small not fancy.  But other patrons were kinda mellow so 5 stars
author: K F.

description: we looked up in yelp for a great brunch spot. 8am was even close to our hotel so we passed by. Food is just delicious - the young chef was very proud about his creations - service was ok a little seems to be not so interested. Coffee was just great.
author: Christoph S.

description: We went to 8am for breakfast and enjoyed the meal. We ordered an omelette and the pancakes and both were great. The service was excellent and the staff was very attentive. It's located in the Fishermans Wharf area and would recommend getting there by foot or public transportation as parking is generally tough and pricey in this area. The restaurant was clean and a very pleasant environment. You may have to wait a little bit for a table but the food was good. The place is owned/ run by two cousins and they were really personable. I am rooting for them. They have a great product but the price is high for breakfast. This is not somewhere to go every day but definitely worth going to for breakfast. Great place. Just yelping out
author: Kirk I.

description: Great restaurant in this area. The overall feel was very clean and fresh food. I had the basic breakfast and my wife had the two ways bagel breakfast. Tasty and fresh. Portions are a little large but good deal for area. If staying in area to see to pier check it out.
author: Andrew B.

description: Stumbled onto this little gem on a rainy Thursday morning and was not disappointed. Everything in the menu sounded good, so my husband and I split the avocado toast 3 ways and the bagel 2 ways, plus bacon and lattes.  Everything was amazing and the fresh fruit in the side was a meal in and of itself!  The service was fast and friendly as well...cant wait to go back!!
author: Teresa L.

description: Amazing! Great food! I had the carmelized banana french toast and my friends had the omelettes which look like little pan pizzas. The place is just a small place              but the presentation of the food and the taste is excellent! The French toast was like brioche French toast probably the best I have ever had. The chef's name is Tierney something like that, it is family run and they are all nice. I highly recommend this place!
author: Ashim K.

description:
Amazing breakfast 
Loved the avocado toast and raspberry croissant 
Wish we lived near buy
author: Nikki Y.

description:
My friends and I had a great experience with the food here. Just upon arriving we saw a table outside being served their food, and we immediately decided we couldn't just have one dish! We split the berry waffle, the 3 way toast, and the asparagus and tomato frittata. All the fruit sides were extremely fresh and the dishes were cooked to perfection. 

However, we did come with the breakfast rush and had to wait to be seated. The reason I don't take a star off for that is because they were short staffed, and being in the restaurant industry, I understand how stressful it can be to manage so many tables. 

So come here if you're looking for a quaint, kind of hole-in-the-wall restaurant with amazing food if you're willing to be patient. It pays off.
author: Courtney C.

description:
We didn't have to wait at all for a table for 2, but we were here at 8 am on a Sunday so it was before the place got too crowded. 

The food was just mediocre as was the service.
author: Sam T.

description: First time returning to visit this restaurant in something like ten years. So glad it has only gotten better with age!
author: Randy N.

description: Just in front of our hotel, a very nice, cozy and welcoming place. Great customer service from their friendly hosts. We ordered bagel 2 way and French toast. Spectacular taste and presentation! Definitely will be back ! Reviews and pictures from Yelp helped a lot !!!
author: Lisa R.

description:
Wow is all I can say. Went here twice while vacationing in California. Not only was the service great but the food was phenomenal. The blueberry short cake is one of the best breakfasts I have ever ate. 

It comes with a wonderful side of fruit. Both times the fruit was perfect- I don't know where they get their fruit but it seems too good to be true!! 

Love this place- if ever back in San Fran I will be here.
author: Roger L.

description: Wow.  We went here on our way up to the woods and point Reyes ... Food was awesome, really loved the avocado toast.  Very much a diner feel, but with very flavorful and filling dishes.
author: Steve E.

description: Amazing!  Great food and service.  Who could ask for more?  Definitely check this place out.  We had the French Toast, Fritatta and Waffle...so yummy!
author: Lindsay J.

description: Excellent service, delicious food and the freshest fruit. The avocado toast and French toast are a must!
author: Karla S.

description: I love the food and especially the breakfast here! Try the 3 way avocado toast. It is delicious. And the French toast too.....
author: Mark P.

description: An awesome brunch place for locals and tourists alike. Fresh, healthy food with huge portions. Friendly service to boot. What is not to like?
author: T. B.

description: I enjoyed everything about this place. Small little place but great service and food, plus good coffee, makes it a win. I had the avocado toast (yum) and the fresh fruit side was the best fruit cup I've had at a restaurant.  I simply loved everything about this one.
author: Zillah T.

description:
We were walking by looking for a place for breakfast. My husband said lets go here.  What a great find!  I had the ham and cheese frittata and my husband had blueberry shirt cake.  We each loved what we had.  Not only was my frittata cooked perfectly, it also came with potatoes and the largest fresh fruit bowl I have ever had.  It had about 8 different fresh fruits.

Our waiter was so attentive and kept refilling our coffee and checking to see if we needed anything. He handled the entire restaurant that way.  They have indoor and outside seating.  

I recommend this place for breakfast and their lunch menu looked good as well.  Totally worth seeking out.
author: Diane W.

description: Definitely great food. Fruit is very fresh. Strawberries, kiwi, blueberries, pineapple, bananas melons everything nice and sweet.  Small place but great service and food.
author: George S.

description: Excellent place for breakfast! We had the Avocado Toast Three Ways and a Fritata as well as a side of chicken sausage. Coffee was spot on as well and service was great.
author: David S.

description: The avocado three way was disappointing.  Avocados were not rich and creamy, so tasteless.
author: Amy C.

description: Locals love this place and now it's on my list.  Family owned and operated,  this place should be on Diners Drive In's and Dives.  Get the Avocado Toast 3 ways!  Incredible, savory and makes your mouth water thinking about it.  Get there early or you will have to wait.  But keep in mind, good things come...
author: Jerry V.

description: A really nice breakfast spot near the Wharf. It's not a big place, so be prepared to wait. Our server was very friendly and always had refills of coffee. They brought the wrong meal to someone at our table and corrected it within a minute, even  before we could say a word.
author: diane z.

description: Avocado toast 3 ways is the way to go. Fresh and tasty - fruit is perfectly ripe and delicious.
author: Jae W.

description: Nothing spectacular. Most things on the menu you can easily make at home. The service was a bit pushy, asking how we felt every five minutes.
author: Ryan L.

description: The avocado toast three way is amazing!!! I loved the tomatoes the use. The place is a little hole in the wall but the staff is nice. I had the 6am crepes, those were not too good, kind of dry.
author: Natacha V.

description: I live right up the street from this restaurant and every morning when I walk my puppy to the park there are always people waiting to eat here. I finally decided to try it out when my mom came to visit. We went a bit later than the normal breakfast rush so we were able to get a table right away. The menu was full of options and as we saw other table's meals being delivered we were extremely impressed by the presentation of the food. I ordered the Pac Heights Frittata and my mom ordered the Nob Hill. We were both deliciously satisfied with our choices. Another thing to note is the meal came with fresh fruit which included strawberries, blueberries, kiwi, raspberries and melon. I do not like melon so normally I am disappointed when my side of fruit is a cup of melon and a grape.
author: Jenny L.

description: My wife and I waited at our table for almost 20 minutes after we were sat to just be ignored. The waitress bussed the 2 tables next to us, sat a couple once it was cleaned and immediately proceeded to take their orders all while not even looking our way! Completely ignored us! We came in well before that couple sat and didn't know why we weren't served first or even acknowledged. After she took their order I figured she would come to us next but nope... She walked away the other direction while we were sitting there looking at her appalled by the lack of service. Bummed out because we were looking forward to this breakfast but I guess we will never know because we walked out!
author: Benni D.

description:
3 Way Avocado Toast with Egg, Bacon, and Tomatoes comes with a fresh bowl of fruit.  Excellent!  I tend not to eat a lot of fruit but these were really fresh so finished it.

Their Waffles with Fresh Berries ... Mmmmm Yumm.

Very satisfying and definitely Will Return.

Coffee is about average and there can be a wait.  Servers are friendly but based on how much business this place gets, maybe understaffed.

Small like most restaurants around the Warf.  Lucked out and got a table outside right away.  This was around 9:30am.  As we were leaving there were about 4 groups waiting for seats.  Come early to avoid the rush.
author: David P.

description: Get the waffle and a side of fresh fruit! Cute little place with great service and food.
author: M J.

description: It's Awesome!  Tasty, unusual choices that taste great. Presentation. These guys could win Chopped and should be featured on diners drive-ins and dives
author: Tami K.

description: Awesome! New favorite breakfast spot. I got a really nice serving of fruit with a large variety and they give just the right amount of food. Service was great as well!
author: Angela Z.

description:
I struggled between giving this a 3 and 4 star review. Ultimately, the fresh fruit boats here are what pushed me into 4 territory.

Service
The place was packed and we had a bit of a wait. Once we were seated though (after about a ten minute wait), there was no messing around. Service was pretty quick and efficient.

Decor
The restaurant it mostly a diner. Somehow, on a not-so-hot day in SF, the inside of this place is boiling. Maybe from the ovens? We've been to a few other diner-ish places in the area, and none felt quite this hot to me.

Food + Drinks
To start, there was no iced tea, only hot tea. This is usually fine for me, but as stated above, the restaurant itself was hot! I could've asked for a cup of ice, but didn't feel like having the potential spillage and making my own makeshift drink at the table that morning. 

To eat, my husband and I split the avocado toast three ways (I don't like fried egg, so we asked for scrambled and we don't eat bacon, so we were allowed two toasts with scrambled egg and one topped with tomato with no problems) and the Haight Frittata, cheese on the side. The toast was likely some of the worst avocado toast we ever had. Serving size was good but bread wasn't crunchy or too thick and the avocado had no salt, chili flakes, any kind of topping. The egg on top of the toast was plentiful but, again, flavorless. The tomato toast had a very dark tomato on it. It was good and you could taste the sweetness of the tomato, but I'd say again it needed more. The Haight Frittata had mushrooms, tomato, onion and maybe one other veggie. The eggs were dry. We get an omelette with cheese on the side at our favorite local diner (Swingers in LA) regularly, and it still comes with plenty of herby and delicious flavor. This frittata tasted dry, and that was even including the taste of the vegetables. Again, needed some salt and pepper at the very least. The frittata was fluffy, though. Our dining companion got the same frittata, but he got the cheese on it, and he did seem to enjoy it just fine. So maybe the lesson is, don't remove the cheese here!

I mentioned the side of fruit, which every dish comes with. It's a great side of fruit - very fresh, lots of diversity (pineapple, grape, kiwi, apple, banana, melon), and a pretty generous portion. The egg dishes both came with potatoes too (again, a pretty good helping), but I was getting full without them, and my husband isn't a big potato fan.

Overall, a surprisingly solid option for the usually chain-entrenched tourist area. Not my favorite breakfast place in SF by any means, but certainly not the worst either. The menu offers a great deal of variety and options if nothing else.
author: Jackie W.

description: I almost hesitate to review this place so highly for fear it'll have a giant wait next time, but MAN this breakfast restaurant is the real deal. Everything you could want for breakfast, fresh made with attentive service. Had the 8 a.m. Crepe and the fresh fruit compote was bursting with giant berries. Come here, you won't regret it.
author: Maureen H.

description: Ate out all holiday weekend. This was by far our best meal, great service and the place was pristine. Pride of ownership all the way. Perfect 10!
author: Susan C.

description: Excellent breakfast of veggie frittata, homefries and large cup of fresh fruit. The  restaurant was clean and waiter was professional and friendly. Very convenient to my hotel and delicious food!
author: Loretta C.

description: Went here early for breakfast and the place was packed by the time we left (about 9am) so get here early. We got the 3 avocado toast and chia seed pudding and both were very good. It was crowded but not crammed so it was still comfortable quiet enough to have a nice chat and enjoy the morning.
author: Ryan G.

description: The location would make you think that this a touristy place - but it is NOT. It is LOVELY and the service of the entire staff was fantastic.  We ordered and split the avacado toast - which was a very nice portion with a bountiful full cup of fruit.  Hot Chai Tea Latte was great for a chilly morning.  The chef came out and served us our coffee and water... so friendly. Food was FRESH and YUMMY!
author: Robyn F.

description: The staff were friendly... There's a lot choices on the menu.  The wait for the food is not that long.  The food was great and the presentation of the food as well.
author: Melody G.

description: A very small dining area. Outstanding breakfast and brunch selections that focus on fresh and healthy ingredients. Excellent and friendly service. Highly recommended.
author: Larry F.

description: Awesome! Great crepe, super fresh fruit, awesome lox bagel, amazing breakfast potatoes. Nice crew. Highly recommended.
author: Amith N.

description: Probably the best breakfast we had durning our trip. Food was priced about the same as other places around the city. Service and food were excellent!
author: David J.

description: Great trendy spot just a few blocks from our hotel and the wharf! Loved the chai and the chia pudding! Food was very fresh and creative! And you can't beat the bowl of fresh fruit!
author: Sasha G.

description: This was a really great breakfast spot. Fast service and nice people. The avocado toast 3 ways is not something I can find anywhere near my home and I absolutely loved it. My boyfriend also had the most amazing French toast with bananas. Would definitely come back here next time I'm in town!
author: Teresa N.

description: We loved the avacado toast with heirloom tomato, bacon and eggs. Fruttatas are perfect and fresh fruit delish. Small inside and outside but service is great - very nice and lines move fast.
author: David B.

description:
Great place, big portions (kids split theirs).  Fruit and potatoes comes with each breakfast plate.  Waiter was very happy and helpful.  

No kids portions (menu is perfect so we don't need more items)
author: Fachtna O.

description: Wonderful breakfast and equally great service. Food was presented nicely and just delicious- had the frittatas and was not disappointed. Lots of food and great assortment of fresh fruit on the side.
author: Noosh P.

description:
EightAM is perfect for SF tourists in the area looking to catch a quick breakfast before starting a day of sight seeing.  

Overall, breakfast was ok.  We ordered the Castro Fritatta and your traditional eggs and bacon.  Both came with a hefty cup of fresh fruits and home-style potatoes.

The Castro Fritatta contained chicken-apple sausage.  It wasn't mind blowing or life changing but it did the job.  

As far as the traditional breakfast, you can't really go wrong with bacon and eggs.  Though EightAM didn't go wrong, it wasn't right either.  The eggs we alright and cooked to order but the home-style potatoes could definitely use a little more effort.  The potatoes were a bit on the soft and soggy side and reminiscent of hospital food.  The fresh fruit bowl, on the other hand, was perfection--fresh berries and melons, both at the peak of ripeness.  

Again, if you're looking for a quick go-to for breakfast, EightAM is the place.
author: Lex And Tee R.

description: Super cute place with friendly service and yummy food!   Great way to start my morning
author: Evelyn R.

description: We both got the avocado toast three ways, which was awesome. Served with a cup of super fresh fruit. Plenty of food to get going for the day. Staff was very friendly and attentive. Casual atmosphere, which was perfect since we're heading for a hike!
author: Paige J.

description: First visit to San Francisco, found this joint off of yelp. Basic environment but the food is pretty good. Recommend the avocado toasts!
author: Daniel E.

description: The crepes are so good! The Nutella with bananas was my favorite. Friendly service. We were full after eating because it was so good!
author: Melanie W.

description: What a delicious spot to have breakfast when staying in the Fishermans Wharf area.  A lovely bowl of fresh fruit accompanies each entree.  Get there early or be prepared to wait!
author: Robin M.

description: The food is delicious and beautiful presentation! We ordered 9am crepe, eggs with sausage/bacon and French toast with fruit! The orange juice is so fresh and yummy! We will definitely come back again!
author: Doris K.

description: True story, we sat down at the Blue Mermaid for breakfast when my husband said, "did you check Yelp to see how they are?" Oh! When I logged in I saw Eight AM in my list, noticed it was new and told him lets go there before we get served, quick get up! We apologized to the bus guy about to bring us water and walked over to Eight AM. Wow what a gem! We both ordered the Pacific Frittata with a side of bacon. They said it came with potatoes and a side of fruit. The frittata was cooked into a cute little circle with my favorite cheese on top, Manchego.  The fruit was a beautiful bowl of artistically prepped bananas, blueberries, strawberries, can't elope and honey dew. Their coffee was amazing and the service awesome. The chef stopped by to check on us. This is a wonderful little place, with searing outside. Next time I'll try the crepes!
author: Melanie S.

description: On vacation from LA we decided to poke our heads into this breakfast spot. Boy I was happy we did.  The coffee was strong but just right. The Russian hill frittata with fruit salad was spectacular.  By far the best fruit salad Ive ever had. It had bananas,  strawberries,  kiwi, pineapple,  blueberries, raspberries, honeydew, and cantaloupe.  Are there any other fruits they could have added? The answer, no. Best Ive ever had.
author: J.J. G.

description: Awesome place to have breakfast! Fresh orange juice and avocado toast yummy! If we would live here we would probably come everyday!
author: Martha G.

description: Eeeeewwww...weeeee the berry french toast is probably the best I've ever had.  It was well worth the 30 minute wait!
author: Shauna G.

description: Amazing food! And met a wonderful local . The food came fast, portions were big but worth it. Prices are reasonable.
author: Arlin R.

description: Excellent! Banana Nutella crepes and Carmelized banana crepes were excellent and well presented. The egg plate with potatoes and sausage were also excellent.  Good portions. The coffee and freshly squeezed OJ topped it all off. Service was attentive. Cost is moderate but right for the quality. Very good! And, this is off the beaten tourist path by just a tiny bit, enough to avoid any lines.
author: Eichelle T.

description: Found this conveniently located brunch place near Fishermans wharf. The Sightseeing bus tours start here. We chose it for its vegetarian options. The food was non greasy and very filling. We ordered a frittata, Avocado on toast and a vegetable crepe. They were all great without be heavy on the stomach. A bit on the expensive side but worth it. The avocado on toast would be great if the avocado were a bit more spiced.
author: Kunjarani D.

description: Absolutely wonderful breakfast place. We ordered the Avocado Toast Trio, Granola Yogurt, Banana Waffles. Amazing!! Def a place to come back to or try when staying in San Fran.
author: Sarah P.

description:
Service is a -5 stars! Food is a 3 star average but nothing special, lets not forget they run out of everything! Let's start with my experience! We come in and there's a 25 min wait we decide to wait because of such awesome reviews. After being seated we look at the menu and gathered our thoughts and we're ready to order, nobody at the table eats pork. Let's ask the server if they have turkey or can sub for anything else, oh they don't have turkey or anything they can sub for but our server thinks it's funny that we don't eat pork and have to sub for something different. How disrespectful let's sit there and laugh at your customers  for not eating a certain something. We continue to order and we would like to sub fruit for potatoes oh no we don't do any substitutes on anything on the menu. Okay that's unusual let me get a side of potatoes then and waste this fruit that you don't want to sub. We all order but the server is just extremely rude. Oh yeah we will take some drinks. I'll remind you since I'm a server and I work here, NOT! Waters all around. Some orange juice. Oh no we are out of orange juice, Apple Juice for two of us and grapefruit juice for me. Comes back after getting all the waters and juices oh I'm sorry we are out of grapefruit juice. But is extremely rude the whole time. So about 15 mins goes by our server comes over and says they're out of French toast, first thing is it took you 15 mins to come & tell us, second is when i asked are you guys out of everything he replies rudely you guys did come late, is 1pm on news years day late! Lol so we switch it for a different item on the menu. When we get the receipt French toast is still on there and not the new item we ordered. So we get another server and explain the situation cause the new item we switched was cheaper. She then tells our server and he says aren't they the same price she says no and he just laughs right in front of us. Very rude and disrespectful!

Tips for my fellow yelpers: They're out of everything, they really need to stock a lot better. The servers & staff are extremely rude. It seems like it's everyone's first day! And the food is just mediocre won't be coming back!
author: Mo T.

description:
We chose this place based on reviews, as well as location from our hotel (Argonaut).  The food was quite good.  We all ordered a variety of items, and all were happy with our choices.  The service?  That was a totally different story. When we arrived, we were treated with a very friendly hello, by a personable young man. Things were looking good!  

But... Once we got our food, we never saw anyone until we asked for our check. All waters were empty. One cup of coffee with no refills in sight.  Several people were working, and we were the only guests in the building (there were a couple of people on the patio), so the lack of service was frustrating.  

Benefit of the doubt... I may go back sometime for the food.  Maybe the lack of service was a fluke?
author: Bill P.

description: Amazing food and service!  Just moved to the neighborhood and have found my new go to place for breakfast and lunch.
author: SS D.

description: Best French toast and waffle I have ever had. Potatoes where delicious, soft, and well season. The staff was very friendly and took well care of me and my fiancé even though it was a busy Saturday morning. Definitely going to return on my next trip to San Francisco.
author: Bianca C.

description: Stopped in this AM with family based on hotel recommendation.  First to wait in line and as we waited we saw really great looking crepes on others tables.  Wait was longer than usual because of staff forgetting about is but they quickly resolved it and we were seated.  4 of us ordered crepes and I personally ordered the 2AM.  Crepes came out fresh and they were awesome.  One of us ordered the fried eggs with avacado and bacon which was very taste.  Nice to see a small mom and pop restaurant turning out great food and will definitely return!
author: Terry P.

description: Long line, had to wait 20 minutes. The service however was quick and friendly. The food was straight forward.
author: Chinmay S.

description: Berry waffle is amazing! Service was great. Definitely need to come here at least once on your visit to San Francisco
author: Leanne S.

description: Amazing food! There was a bit of a wait but it was totally worth it. The portions are large and the side of fruit is perfect. The waitstaff was very attentive. The frittatas were delicious and the bagel two ways was yummy!
author: K L.

description: Stopped here on a recent trip to San Fran; they're open earlier than eight a.m., which was handy.  The waffles were lovely, bacon was thick, and the little fruit cups that came with each meal were generous.  The potatoes were great too.  My fritatta was a little dry, but other than that, all was well.  A fair price for what you get, with quick service.  A winner.
author: Jennifer D.

description: Fantastic place to eat! The good is delicious and the portions are generous. And the serious is great! Must try.
author: Helen M.

description: If I could give this place SIX stars, I might.  Everything was great here: service, ambience, food. I ordered avocado toast based on Yelp recos - unique, very tasty, and yes, a nice generous side of fresh fruit. My dining companions had crepes which were excellent too. This is a very friendly neighborhood place, we really enjoyed our meal here.
author: Katie K.

description: Had an excellent breakfast this morning.  I had the Russian Hill fritata which included a very generous amount of potatoes and fruit salad.  My son had the French toast, and my wife a vegetarian fritata. All of us really enjoyed our meals.  Not cheap by any means..pretty typical SF pricing but very generous portions.
author: Steve J.

description: Best breakfast place in SF. So cute!!! Great service, well run restaurant. Seated quickly and food came super fast. Ordered the avocado toast and bagel pair and both came with an incredible bowl of fruit (which most restaurants don't do!). Loved the bagels, especially the strawberry and blueberry topping. The avocado spread was generously (yet perfectly) spread on the toast and was exactly what we were craving. Will definitely return to SF because of this restaurant!
author: Sabrina A.

description: Don't be misled by this quaint little restaurant, the food here is AMAZING. They put in so much care into not only the quality of the food, but the presentation as well. Even the side of fruit was overflowing with variety and freshness. We don't live in this area, or else we'd back every weekend!
author: Juliette K.

description: OMG. I am so ashamed of myself. I thought I had already reviewed this amazing, delicious, delectable place. The owners are really nice and just make you feel like your appetite matters to them. The fruit is fresh, the french toast is amazing, and the avocado toast lives up to the hype.
author: Pawanpreet G.

description: Anyone who gave this place a negative review is just one of those hipster idiots who knows nothing..... This place was really good my girlfriend who doesn't like breakfast (I know crazy) really enjoyed her breakfast, very creative fresh menu, fruit was good and fresh as well. The service wasn't too prompt but that's only because it was very busy and that happens sometimes. The only thing that could make this place better is the bagels my girlfriend and I were saying if this place was in New York where the bagels are obviously better then San Fran this gem would make a killing
author: Nicholas G.

description: The avocado toast three ways & fresh fruit was delicious. The fruit was so fresh & the avocado toast was amazing. They gave you so much avocado on each toast! We added the smoked salmon to one of the toasts which is a MUST. Very delicious, definitely will come back next time I'm in SF.
author: Jacquelyn F.

description: What a pleasant experience.  While the restaurant was a bit steamy inside, we scored a table outside.  We were so pleased with the exceptional quality of all the food.  The o.j. was super freshly made and pulpy.  All of our breakfast entrees came with (this was not extra!) an incredibly fresh bowl of fruit (melons, blueberries, strawberries, blackberries).  These berries were not cut hours before and dumped into a bowl; they were beautifully assembled and just as tasty.  We're so pleased that we bypassed the crazy line at Mama's that we wanted to try and checked with trusty Yelpers for this recommendation!
author: Leanne Y.

description:
Fantastic breakfast.  Bought the family of four here on a walk by,  liked it so much,  came back again. 

Excellent quality,  lots of fruit to compliment,  and a really interesting menu. The bagels fix ups were great,  and awesome that you can chose a couple of variations. 

For any of you out there bored of eggs bene give this a go.
author: Geof R.

description: Fantastic breakfast.  The avocado 3 ways was delicious and comes with a bowl of fruit.  Quick & friendly service.  Good location as well.
author: Sean B.

description: This place is a must go to, like drive out of your way if your not close to it go to. It's a small family owned business and they are not stingy what so ever. I almost felt obligated to eat all of my good because they were so generous in serving size for a $14 price. I couldn't just let them throw it away or not eat it for the rest of the day. I even took the mans next to me, fruit because he didn't even touch it. And I'm talking straight from the fields to the table fruit, cut up and fresh just for you... So if you don't think your going to eat it all, spare yourself and them. The avocado toast is amazing, I will be back tomorrow morning for round 2 on the strawberry croissant sandwich
author: Raevyn A.

description:
Fantastic breakfast at Eight AM. While a somewhat small location, we had a short wait (good sign). We were really impressed with the service!  Once you were signed in on the wait list, the staff used our names the rest of the meal. 

We both had frittatas. They came with excellent hash browns and a very generous fruit cup. We were really pleased with our meals here, and the value/pricing.
author: M B.

description: Make this place a destination on your next trip to SF. Food is amazing with fresh ingredients. Service is A-plus!
author: heather a.

description: Loved this place for breakfast. Good service and delicious food items. We got the avocado toast and waffles with bananas. Absolutely the best. Coffee was perfect too. Must go..
author: Ann W.

description: Just landed in San Fran last night, and this was our first restaurant experience. Slam dunk, I can only hope the rest of them have this friendly and attentive service.  My wife and I each got different frittatas, hers the Castro mine Russian Hill.  They were absolutely delicious and come with a huge bowl of fruit and potatoes.  We prob could have split one and been fine.  Not sure what brand of coffee they serve, but it was perfect.  Enjoy!
author: Travis B.

description: Amazing breakfast and all around experience. Place is busy and run by two guys that get it done. Had French toast and it was incredible. We are vacationing from Southern California and will always hit this when in town.
author: Colby C.

description: The frittatas were really good. The food just kind of sits in window when ready and people are walking by, but the one or two servers that were working handles the rush of customers well.
