We didn't get to try the fresh squeezed orange juice that others have raved about because they were out of oranges. I guess that's an indication that it is good since it's in high demand. I wouldn't rave about this place but I would recommend it for something good and filling to start your day. I really do like how a bowl of fresh fruit comes with most of the items on the menu.
author: Tk R.

description: Great food. Lots of fresh fruit and a unique menu. The staff is very friendly. Excellent service. Nice place to get breakfast while visiting San Francisco.
author: Rich W.

description: I am not sure how in the world avocado toast can be this good but it was DEFINITELY worth the wait.  I'll be back here every time I'm in San Francisco!
author: Tina W.

description: There was a little bit of a wait but usually that means it will be worth it. Everything was really good. Service was excellent even though they were pretty busy. I will definitely be back for breakfast again!
author: Jeremy ..

description: This place was absolutely amazing. Not one thing disappointed. It is a small restaurant the so we went on a Sunday morning and has to put our name on but we were sat within 10 minutes. Quick service and delicious food.
author: Katelyn S.

description: Maybe it is the sanfran thing.  Meal comes out one person at a time. The party can't have the meal together.  Mediocre service and charge too much.  Go to Hollywood for breakfast if in fishermans wharf.
author: Arsalan K.

description: This was my first trip to Eight AM Cafe and I will be back. I had a traditional American breakfast of bacon, eggs, potatoes, and a fruit cup. Every bit of it was delicious.
author: Rick M.

description: Loved breakfast here, nice and quiet at 7.15 am. Had the bagels two ways which was great as you get two different toppings. Came with fruit salad too which is a nice touch. Only downside was that they appeared to do crepes but no pancakes. Would definitely recommend though!
author: Sarah R.

description: Deliciously original breakfast. Cozy patio and great service. The 3 way avocado breakfast was hearty and served with a side of fruit. The hand squeezed OJ is a must.
author: Jamey W.

description: We don't go out to breakfast much. We generally find the quality of the food isn't worth the usual long waits. Not so with eight am. The food was delicious. My husband had the avocado toast- wow. Looked and tasted great. I had a frittata. Also very good. Come with an appetite- it's a lot of food. And the coffee is really good too. We were fortunate to come when there was no wait, not sure how busy it gets. But this place would be worth a wait.
author: RoseEllen F.

description: Nice solid neighborhood cafe with great food. Love the avocado toast three ways, and the Lox bagel. The place is run like clockwork, quick seating, really effective staff, friendly, on the case. Loved their drip coffee also, very flavorful. Another plus: clean bathroom! Will be back!
author: Stefan S.

description: Great food and excellent service. Had the Castro frittata and hubby enjoyed three toast with avocado.
author: Vicky R.

description: I had the avocado toast with fresh fruit and it did not disappoint!  Can't wait for breakfast again tomorrow at Eight AM!
author: Natalie P.

description: First of all the service was fabulous! We were greeted as soon as we walked in by friendly smiley faces! Everyone was very attentive and happy to give their personal recommendations! Now the food...wow! I couldn't decide, they have an unique menu! I choose the croissant with vanilla pudding and blueberries and it was incredible! They also include a good size bowl of fresh, yummy fruit with each meal! I'm coming back tomorrow morning! Better yet, I'll come for lunch today and again tomorrow! It was seriously that good!
author: Sergio R.

description: I came in with three other women. I wouldn't have entered had I not seen good reviews about the food and my friends wanted to enter. The strong smell of cooking eggs at the door was what almost deterred me from giving my business. We were seated immediately, as we can missed the rush for brunch. The menu was cute, and had all I needed; breakfast and lunch are the only meals that matter. The different bagel options seemed pretty delicious - smoked salmon, or fruit, or egg - and the mix and match combo was very appealing. The sandwiches are very moist and beautiful. The next time I go I'm definitely getting avocado toasts.
author: Kamilah N.

description: Nice place, could have more comfortable chairs outside or a gas lamp, as it sits smackdab on columbus avenue and I like enjoying the scenery. Service was great, they were attentive. Coffee could have been refilled more often, no water was brought. The food was good, not amazing but still very good, prices could be less as it isnt that complex cuisine. Fruit was fresh. I think it needs something more 8 am style, maybe give you the paper, more character maybe?
author: Rye Bread C.

description: This place was absolutely amazing. Worth the wait. Food was awesome and the service is great. Read read the yelp reviews and didn't know so we gave it a try.
author: Christopher S.

description:
Found this this gem, a few blocks away from our hotel. It's popular so be prepared to wait, but it's so worth it. The food is fresh and filling. My husband tried two different frittatas - Castro and Fisherman's Wharf, both were delicious but he recommends trying the Fisherman's Wharf had more crab than eggs. Both come with potatoes too. My daughter opted for the Avocado Toast Three Ways both days, so you know what her favorite was. I tried the 8 AM Crepe (berries and cream), which was surprisingly not overly sweet and the Bagel Fix-Up (one bagel - two options. Mine was #3 and #6) Everything comes with a bowl of fresh fruit, we were so full we could hardly eat any.

Also has some cool artwork on the walls, which is for sale.
author: Teresa M.

description: Good service, friendly staff. The food was great. I got the avocado toast three ways, the heirloom tomato was a good combination.
author: Sarah K.

description: After reading a lot of the great reviews we decided to try this breakfast place. We went with the avocado toast 3 ways and the frittata Castro. The heirloom tomato and avocado was clearly the best, but the other two were a bit underwhelming. The frittata was a little bit overcooked. On the plus side the fruit was very fresh. Still worth checking out but nothing that blew my mind.
author: Kyle C.

description: Limited option for vegi lover. I have tried Francisco Sandwich is really good. Like Salad and dressing.
author: Vijay C.

description: This place was GREAT. Probably the best breakfast I have ever had. It was that good. We were lucky, we had a very short wait for a table. Plan on a bit of a wait. We had the Avocado Toast Three Ways
author: Rob F.

description: Cute little bfast spot near our hotel. food and service was good, the fruit salad that comes with the breakfast was nice, fresh, and sweet. Try to come early to avoid the line out the door.
author: S B.

description: My husband and I had the caramelized banana crepe (10am crepe), the chia seed pudding, and Hyatt and ashbury frittata and they were all so flavorful. Wow.
author: Loraine S.

description: Yay, a great nearby breakfast place that if you are lucky, you can get in without too long of a wait. They have a ton of different selections (crepes, omelets, waffles) freshly squeezed juices, lots of caffeine choices, a wide range of teas.  Great place to go for brunch.
author: Natalie S.

description: Perfectly executed breakfast classics and new ideas with fruit and healthy goodness throughout. The mixed berry French toast was amazing, the mixed berry waffle was also, soft enough to bite into not overly crispy, so good. The avocado toast (we had the sampler) was excellent, the smoothies were excellent, really, really wonderful. I'm a breakfast fanatic and this place , like mamas, or even Hollywood cafe also in the wharf, is not to be passed up. And it's run by a young man and his uncle, not his dad as other reviews speculated  enjoy!!
author: Oink A.

description: I came here with my parents and when I sat down at the table and saw the menu and in my head I said WOW! It was a very hard deciding what to get and then finally I decided to get the Nutella Granola Parfait, I think this was the best parfait I have ever had. I give this place Five Stars!
author: Richard C.

description: The most healthy and priceworthy breakfast I ate during my visit to San Francisco. It tasted excellent.
author: Roland P.

description: Excellent service, generous portions, very good food. If I could give 4.2 stars I would-- it's just tough to give a higher rating to a restaurant that is not producing excellent, life-changing caliber food. Exactly what you are looking for in a casual breakfast, though. And you can tell they really aim to please. 3 stars for ambiance, 4 for food, 5 for service.
author: Will S.

description: I had the Lombard sandwich which was great with the fresh avocado.  The service was excellent and you can tell the family that owns this restaurant is vested in the interest of great customer service while delivering great tasting food.
author: John C.

description: Delicious food, incredibly friendly staff, beautiful presentation, loved the entire experience here.
author: Marissa G.

description: My wife and I stopped in to this cute little cafe on the first morning of our California trip and I must say it really set us up right. It was really healthy but delicious. The blueberry shortcake was one hell of a treat.
author: Matthew R.

description: This restaurant was great!  My crêpe was amazing, and the bacon was delish.  Very friendly atmosphere and in a good part of town right by our hotel. Overall, this restaurant/cafe was amazing and would definitely recommend it to someone else.
author: Ryan P.

description: Soo good!! Everything on the menu sounded amazing. I got a frittata with fresh squeezed orange juice and it was delicious! I highly recommend going to this place for breakfast. There wasn't a wait at all and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful.
author: Shannon B.

description: I had a great breakfast at this place! Service was great! Orange juice was very fresh and nice! Highly recommended!
author: Amanda Z.

description: The food was amazing! The service was a little slow but other than that it was great. I recommend this place for breakfast at least once a day!
author: Sara S.

description: These 3 guys no what they are doing. I got the bagels; peanut butter, maple bacon, and green apples! It was excellent!
author: Vanessa C.

description:
Excellent service, great food and very polite staff. Very recommended!!
The cappuccino is very good and they have amazing bowls of fresh fruit that accompany most of the items on the menu. I was here for breakfast with my family and we ordered the triple avocado toast (very good), bacon and eggs and waffles. We were all very pleased.
author: Silvana M.

description: Superb food. Fresh and nice quantity for price. Service was extraordinary! Will come back!
author: Zulema V.

description: Their 3 way toast with fruit salad was phenomenal! Small seating area but staff works their tail off to get people in and served. Well worth the wait.
author: David A.

description: This is a very nice and simple breakfast place, clean interior and good wait staff, they were very attentive and quick. Someone had mentioned in a recent review the quality of the fruit bowl that comes with some dishes. It is no joke one of the best bowls of fruit. Fresh fruit of different kinds and presented nicely. Also my girlfriend wanted me to mention they have a nice clean bathroom in the back. Come visit this nice cozy establishment.
author: Derek E.

description: Really great service.. Outstanding breakfast which i loved.. I found best place to have breakfast again and again.
author: Sandra M.

description: AMAZING!! Cute little café type place. Very good service with amazing modern breakfast and lunch. They have healthy options, such as the avocado toast 3 ways, which is what I had. They also are pretty flexible with making things vegetarian and vegan. My breakfast (the avocado toast 3 ways) was really good and light but also filling! I loved this place!
author: Alex M.

description: Service was incredible slow. 45 mins after we ordered breakfast (for 3), they came out and told us they don't have potatoes. The table next to us got their 4 orders 10 mins apart, and the kids were upset (thus making everyone uneasy). Menu is inventive, but might be too complicated for some. No iced tea, which is odd.
author: mandy s.

description: Cozy space. Very friendly staff especially Kevin who served us. Excellent food. Very fresh fruits and juices.
author: Adel Z.

description:
TL/DR - AMAZING food, long waits but that's ok, friendly but frustratingly inefficient service

I'm just going to start by saying their food is perfect. Perfect! So freaking delicious, and it is worth allllll the waiting in the world. 

We showed up at 11am on a Sunday, and expected to wait. We waited about 45 minutes for a table, and I'm actually not taking any stars off for that because there really isn't anything they can do about it. What was frustrating was that even though we had a party of only 3 people, groups that arrived long after we did were seated before us. We also noticed that tables sat empty for quite a long time before people were seated, even though there was a very long line. 

Once we got our table, we asked for coffee, OJ, and a diet coke. The coffee came, but no cream, and a glass of ice. We assumed they were going to come back with the OJ and diet coke, but they never did. We got up after a while to ask for it, and it still never came. We had to grab our own diet coke from the fridge. By the time someone came to take our order, our coffee was gone. Since it was after noon now, we asked for sandwiches, but they said that they weren't serving lunch yet. We placed our order and asked for OJ again, and coffee refills. None came. Our food came up pretty quickly, and when it was delivered we had to ask again for OJ and coffee. This time the server brought coffee but said they were out of OJ. That was the last time anyone came to the table. We gave up trying to get refills on anything. When our plates were empty and our cups were empty we continued to wait for our tab, feeling awkward because the line of people outside were eyeing our table with more and more hostility. We finally went up to the counter and had to list off all the things we had in order to pay. 

Honestly, I would go back again because it just seemed like they were busy and off balance, but it was frustrating because we had to chase people down in order to get basic service. I almost felt like I needed to be more assertive in order to get anyone's attention, but I didn't want to be rude when it was obvious they were all working so hard.  It just seemed inefficient and frustrating for everyone involved. Freaking amazing food, though.
author: Erica T.

description: Limited menu--only frittata's available.  Service was slow but once I got my food it was delicious.  I will not be back.
author: Karen H.

description: Solid breakfast spot.  Small place, could be a wait although we lucked out and got right in on Sunday morning.  A wait by time we left.  Everything very fresh!  Wife and I enjoyed while staying at Marriott close by.  Service was very good!  Definitely recommend if in the area.
author: M M.

description: Outstanding! All fresh ingredients and delicious.  The dishes were different than usual and therefore incredibly adventurous.
author: Clay C.

description:
Wonderful! My husband and I ate here on an early Saturday morning before an Alcatraz tour. Awesome food--I was so impressed with their plating, their unique/fun options, and the fresh fruit. Normal sides of fruit are melons with maybe a berry of some sort but this fruit cup was loaded with blackberries, raspberries, strawberries, kiwi, banana, and melons. 

The bagel 2 ways was great--Nutella/banana and apple, peanut butter, and bacon? Um, yes!! Lots of other options too. 

Thanks yelp for helping us find this gem! GREAT service too!!
author: Lauren S.

description: Eat breakfast here three days in a row, great food, good service, very friendly staff. Will come back on my next trip to San Francisco!
author: Chad C.

description: Excellent customer service! Food was AMAZING and orange juice was freshly juiced (you can tell). Even though it was quite crowded, right when we got our table we were helped immediately. I really liked how they added a fruit salad with every meal:)
author: Saloni S.

description: Solid little breakfast place near the wharf.  We walked right in at around 9am on a Monday and had the 3 toast plate plus a decadent banana French toast, which was like bananas foster.  The toasts were very good and provided a nice mix of flavors and ingredients, and the French toast was excellent, although super sweet.  The fresh OJ was excellent and the service was a little spotty at times, but friendly and good enough.  Overall, a good choice for breakfast.
author: A. L.

description: Just finished a great breakfast and like many others we will be back. The  frittata I had was tasty and my GF's crepe was excellent as well. The breakfast potatoes are seasoned perfectly and not overcooked or mushy. Fresh fruit that accompanies many dishes was visually beautiful, sweet and delicious.  The staff is friendly and efficient, they obviously take great care in their work.
author: Dave M.

description: Had a great experience here - loved the avocado toast three ways and the ample portion of mixed fruit that goes with it. Like an actual variety of fruit that was sweet and delicious, which is rare in my experience to have all three of those categories fully satisfied. I also appreciated the art #TurtleWayne throughout the restaurant walls and service was exceptional for a family owned business.
author: Sandy T.

description: Such a CUTE brunch place my friend husband and I absolutely pigged out here. The food was awesome, the fruit so fresh and the waffles were just super tasty. I had to be rolled out of this joint. Just get there early if you want a table (especially outside) as it does tend to pack out. If I roll up to San Francisco again, this will definitely be my go to.
author: Dawn W.

description: So lucky to find this place just across from our hotel. The food was great and the staff were so helpful and hard working. Cannot recommend it too highly !
author: Gromit G.

description: This place was off the beaten path, cozy and cute paintings of cartoon turtles.  The food was delicious and fresh.  The service was pretty good about what you expect at a diner.  The real treat was the detail to presentation of our good.  It was well balanced, well seasoned, and appetizing to the eye which lets face it - is seriously lacking in most diners who typically just skip food on a plate and call it a day.  This will be a staple of every visit to San Fran for our family.
author: Lis R.

description: This place is amazing! My boyfriend and I are from NY and visiting San Fran for a brief stay. We tried this spot for breakfast and we were thoroughly impressed. The service, cleanliness, and food were all things to rave about. I personally am not a huge breakfast person and I loved it! Super fresh fruit bowls, delicious crepes and so much more. Lots of options, go here and you won't be disappointed :)
author: Emily T.

description: Me and my parents went to San Francisco hoping to find fun attractions and tours. We were not expecting there to be amazing food! The service is fast the coffee is good and when I ordered the Belgian waffle I was expecting the average. I was wonderfully surprised to see that it was just how any waffle should be, hard on the outside and soft on the inside, will be going back, super recommended!
author: Ben H.

description: Stopped in for breakfast with my mom and this place is amazing! The food is delicious and the service was excellent. I highly recommend the chia yogurt with fruit! Yum!!
author: Christina R.

description: Breakfast before flight. No lines, ample searing, comfortable temperature. Good & abundant coffee. Excellent avocado toast and generous fruit bowl. Absolutely surprisingly delicious toast - surprised even my husband - and frittata - would highly recommend the Avocado Toast to anyone. Especially the heirloom tomatoes. Nice guys serving, courteous and appreciative. Good SF prices. Beautiful Victorian house building and exceptional location.
author: Barbara C.

description: What a great breakfast! Loved the avocado toast and waffle. Waited a while for a table but was worth it. Each meal came with a beautiful cup of fresh fruit.
author: Melissa D.

description: Great atmosphere, great food, very accommodating! The avocado toast was enough for two people to split & will definitely be something we make at home now!
author: Taylor H.

description: Great food, fresh ingredients, friendly service. And, as plenty have mentioned, a fruit bowl on the side that is worth coming back for again and again. I just hope it doesn't get too popular as there was no problem getting a table when I visited...
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Unpretentious place with excellent food. It's small, so there are probably days with long waits, but we were able to sit right away.  All the food was very good, but my favorite parts are the fresh squeezed OJ and the large fruit bowl with most every meal.
We split the avocado toast (1 piece each with bacon, an egg, and heirloom tomato), a frittata with crab, tomato, cheese, and the 8am Berry Compote crepe. So tasty, and so full after all that food.
So good, we went back the next day for more.
author: Peter J.

description: Good little breakfast cafe, small but we went early do not to busy.  Service was great and food was really good.  What amazed us was how fast you got your food and how nice and fresh it was, everything is either served with a great bowl of fresh mixed fruit or has the option to be added. We would definetly go back!
author: Tracia R.

description: Really good and friendly service.  The place is busy so be prepared to wait although the wait isn't going to be as along as they tell you because people will wander off and lose their spot when called.  I had the toast three ways with fruit and it was solid.  Would go back if in the area.
author: Ching-yen C.

description: Good place for breakfast, the best order from our party was the Dungenness crab frittata.  The wait staff was efficient and friendly.
author: Rodrigo S.

description: Had the Nutella crepe and coffee (coffee was notably good because most places have junk mass roasted bitter blends and this is smooth and tasty) -- girlfriend had the "avocado toast three ways" -- both great!!  Nice little cozy spot with an outside sitting area.  Probably eat here again tomorrow.
author: Matt G.

description: Generous portions, great service..the triple toast with guacamole, bacon,tomato, and fried egg with a side of fruit was super!
author: j. l.

description: I'm glad this place has 5 stars. I work right across the street at the holiday inn and I have seen many places come and go. I was surprised that it was taken over, but I was certainly satisfied. The service and food rocks! Friendly, young, fresh food, and a clean location. I always go for their avocado toast which Is always a hit! The tomatoes are always ripe and the avocados are always fresh. Great job! I will keep referring guests!
author: Omar C.

description: place needs cleaning, floors don't get cleaned  after guest with children leave, restrooms are disgusting, on our visit they had ran out of orange juice and potatoes.
author: Robert s.

description: A+++++ is all I have to say for this breakfast hole in the wall that has been open just 9 months.
author: Clari D.

description: This is really a great place!  Avocado Toast is amazing, the Fritata's all looked great. The fresh fruit cup was fresh and delicious and had a great variety of berries, melons, bananas, the Crepes also were great. And the coffee is good too. We sat outside and enjoyed a beautiful San Fransisco morning and our server was friendly and attentive.
author: Art M.

description: Two way bagels are amazing, everything was fresh and delicious!  One of the best breakfasts I've had in some time.  Service left just a bit to be desired, but still an overall wonderful breakfast!
author: Drew M.

description: Stopped here for breakfast while we were visiting San Fran. This place is great. Friendly staff and great food. Fresh squeezed OJ and all the breakfasts were served with fresh fruit. A great find thanks to Yelp!
author: Brian C.

description: Staff was friendly and attentive.  Food was fresh especially the fruit. Chis pudding was good.  Wife had avocado toast three ways.
author: Aaron C.

description: Found this place by accident. The service was great but the food  was so so and pricey.  Family owned and operated.
author: Harparkash D.

description: We aren't from here, but found Eight Am close to our hotel. The food was fresh and very good. The place was clean and service was great! I'd recommend trying a crepe.
author: Aundrea B.

description: Solid breakfast. Long list of options. Toast 3 ways is great, the crepes and fritatas are all great. Attentive service and fresh squeezed orange juice. Very nice spot indeed. Patio seating is perfect for when the sun come up over Joseph Contact Square.
author: Moses A.

description: The food not only looks good but taste delicious. It's great to sit outside and enjoy the sun while having a bite to eat at this lovely place.
author: Fiona J.

description: NOT family friendly. Only one high chair, no busters, and no kids menus. Food was decent and every plate looks like it comes with fruit.
author: Miguel R.

description: They make great food as evidenced by the queues.  They need more staff. As evidenced by the queues. But great service and friendly guys. Deserves its popularity.
author: John P.

description: Food was delicious and I highly recommend. However, don't expect to get in and out quickly. We were there early and it still took over an hour from the time we ordered.
author: Leslie F.

description: Excellent service, amazing food!! Breakfast was not only delicious but very well presented. It is a must stop for a filling bite!
author: Julie S.

description: I simply had some fruit and a chai tea latte.  The fruit was very fresh and the chai tea latte was tasty.  The service is outstanding.  I'll be back.  This place has a ton of potential.
author: Bob B.

description: Came here for breakfast one morning and the avocado toast 3 way is incredible. I got two eggs and no tomato but any combination is awesome! Would highly recommend this one!
author: Domenick F.

description: Really enjoy this new breakfast / lunch spot. Has a modern take on standard diner food with some great creative additions and delivers with fresh, quality ingredients. Great alternative to the greasy spoon type places.
author: Zan T.

description: My wife and I came here on our way to Ghirardelli square and we loved it. She got the Castro frittata which came with potatoes and fresh fruit. The fruit was very fresh and a nice mix, the potatoes and frittata were delicious. I couldn't decide between the 9am and 10am crepes, or the peanut butter and banana or the caramelized banana so I asked for the peanut butter with the caramelized bananas and it was so good! Even the waiter said he wanted to try it. Super friendly staff, even a cook walked by on his break and asked how the food was. Highly recommend!
author: Greg B.

description: Place was very good staff was friendly and it was very cute. It was definitely crowded so get there early comma before 9 a.m. on a weekend if possible
author: Mark A.

description: The avocado toast was perfect.   The crepe, frittata, and bagels made it nearly impossible to choose. My new favorite breakfast spot in the city
author: Joe K.

description: I really loved this place! The menu was such a nice change from all the fatty, greasy places we have been finding. It was so great to enjoy FRESH food made with love. The fruit bowl that came with the meal was a lovely addition and I thoroughly enjoyed the avocado 3 ways and a REAL chai latte like I have back home in Australia. Would definitely recommend and will be sure to return!
author: Ainslie K.

description: Wow the pictures and reviews are very accurate. The food was served hot and fresh and everything we had was great. If you have a chance definitely try this place! :)
author: Lane T.

description: Amazing! I had the 1 PM crepe. Can't go wrong. Great breakfast spot! So convenient and close to our hotel. Good service, everything took only a few minutes, considering it was freshly made. Good drinks, I had Southern Mint tea, came with an extra pot of water. Very tasty. The Pacific Heights was amazing. Came with a nice side of hash browns and fruits.
author: Emma H.

description: I have to admit when we saw the menu we were apprehensive. We went with the reviews and boy were we glad we did!  Two of us had the three way toast and my youngest had the berry waffle. The 3 way had a lot of bread but was delicious. I ended up putting all the ingredients between two of the breads and making a sandwich. YUM! Everyone was happy and the staff was family and very accommodating. Next time in town I'm there!
author: Ed G.

description: Excellent food. Each dish was bright, delicious and comforting. Service was attentive and nice.
author: Jeff S.

description: This was close to our hotel and thought we would try something local. It did not disappoint. The fruit salad was amazing and had a little of everything. The avocado toast was fabulous and the service was very attentive.
author: Kimberly H.

description: No reason this place shouldn't get all 5 stars. Amazing food, great and friendly service. Lots of great options and very healthy.  We'll definitely come back when we're in San Fran again. Top notch joint.
author: Ryan W.

description: This place was great! The food was so delicious and the servings were very generous. We tried the frittatas and both were so scrumptious as were the amazing fruit bowls with all types of rarer fruits e.g. Raspberries, blueberries, pineapple. There was no line at noon on a Saturday and the service was so prompt and friendly. I'm coming back here for sure!
author: Megan K.

description: Amazing breakfast! Best I've had in a long time, quick service great music friendly staff, can't wait to go back !
author: Dory O.

description: Had a nice Saturday breakfast with only a 15 minute wait. The French toast with glazed bananas was very sweet but exceptionally good because the thick slice was perfectly prepared with a great mouth feel because of the crunchy and chewy edges. The inside was not mushy nor soggy. I don't think it could've been better as far as cafes, or eating out, goes. Both friends really liked their respective frittatas; I had a traditional bacon and eggs. The three breakfasts came with fried potatoes and a very full fruit cup (a mix of kiwi, cantaloupe, pineapple, blueberries, raspberries, boysenberries, strawberries, and banana). Service was efficient and friendly with frequent visits to our table offering coffee. Because I love potatoes, I was really disappointed by theirs which were bland and prepared too far in advance. The next time I visit, I will eat my hot food and the bananas and take the rest of my fruit home.
author: Mo O.

description: Oh my god! This was the perfect breakfast! Pictures are to follow. They are probably not the cheapest but quality has its price. Fresh and healthy choices for a good start into your day. The sizes of their portions are pretty good too.
author: T F.

description: Awesome breakfast place.  Very good food. Everything was fresh and tasty... Try Avocado toast 3 way.
author: Alona B.

description: Food was good but they completely forgot our order. With a little baby that was very unfortunate as we had to ask several times until they realised and we were not able to enjoy anymore
author: Tommy T.

description: Amazing breakfast! We came back to this restaurant after our friends raved about the breakfast place that they had been to a few years back. Under new management, we took a risk and it paid off. The fruit bowls were big fresh and delicious. The syrup was a delicious marmalade honey that I just wanted to drink. Avocado toast scrumptious.
author: Michelle R.

description: Great food, beautifully presented! Is on the pricey end of the scale, but worth it for the occasion treat.
author: Paul O.

description:
My family stopped in for breakfast and we loved it. They also offer lunch. The menu is mostly breakfast items, presented very attractively. We enjoyed a Croque Monsieur, a frittata with ham and gruyere plus a fruit side, and a delicious crepe full of berries, each costing $12. Also, a crepe with bananas and peanut butter for $10. The crepes are named after hours of the day, for example the crepe with berries is called the 8 AM, hence the name of the restaurant. 

The server was enthusiastic, and the chef came out to ask us how our food was.

This is a small place where they obviously care very much about the food, its appearance, and the customer. We are so glad that we came here instead of a chain restaurant known for breakfast, which is easy to find nearby. The location is near Fisherman's wharf, so it is well situated for tourists like us staying in the nearby hotels.
author: John G.

description: Completed disappointed, with all of the great reviews I was excited, but the place was very underwhelming. Super bland food. Avocado toast three ways with no seasoning and the price was way too high for what I ordered. $14 for toast and $10 for a glass of OJ?? For that price they could have gotten oranges that actually taste good.
author: Kevin K.

description: Love this place. Discovered it yesterday and leaving this review mainly so I remember next time I'm in SF. Great presentation of food. Great service. Seems to be a family-owned and -run business. Food tastes great  Soon they'll be adding smoothies to the menu and then I'll have to figure out how to add more stars.
author: Anita Y.

description: Fresh, unique, big breakfasts for a great price. Very healthy menu with a lot of variety!
author: Jess F.

description: Good place to have breakfast of brunch! A lot of fruits in the fruit cup, everything is very tasty!
author: Alexey R.

description: Very good breakfast.no long lines... and was very tasty...I would recommend this if your a local and hate the lines at mama's or dotties
author: Jason T.

description: Amazingly fresh fruit and avocado toast. Coffee was great as well. The perfect start to the day.
author: Michael S.

description: This place has some good salad didn't care too much for the Francisco sandwich. The guy that severed us took forever.
author: Anthony -.

description: What a little find!  Service is great.  A small cafe that won't disappoint you when your food arrives, great value for your $.
author: David H.

description: Good breakfast. Fast service. Good portions and healthy selection of food. My girlfriend ordered the peanut butter and banana crepe. The crepe was moist and was very flavorful. I ordered the bacon omelet, which came with breakfast potatoes and an awesome bowl of fruit.
author: Garrett M.

description: Ate here twice because the reviews were great, menu was interesting and the staff was so kind and attentive. Ryan was our server both days and was fantastic. Ate the avocado toast and chicken crepe. Both were delicious. We'll be back!
author: Ann Y.

description: Very nice... Easy to get a table.... People here were very friendly.... And best of all the food was great...... You got to try this place......
author: Rene V.

description: To say it in a few words...simply amazing. The fruit bowl was a confectionary of bold color upon first glance, and at first taste the perfectly ripe flavor of berries, kiwi and banana satisfied my palate. The three avocado toast, again, was incredibly delicious. But, food is only one part of the dining experience. The service was impeccable, and everyone was very friendly for the early morning. Also the outdoor seating on the sidewalk made dining outdoors very pleasant.
author: Ashley D.

description: We were really looking forward to this place based on the reviews. What a disappointment. The French toast with caramelized bananas was so sickly sweet my husband could only eat 2 bites. I tried it and was like "ick!"  And we both normally love caramelized bananas. My scrambled eggs were dry and the bacon was just ok. So $40 later we were still hungry. The fresh fruit was nice, so there's that. You're better off leaving the neighborhood for non-tourist traps but even the place 2 doors down looked better.
author: Laurie M.

description: I went at 8am on a Sunday and there was already a wait.  Luckily for a small party it was just maybe 10 minutes max.  Ordered the avocado toast 3 ways.  One comes with bacon on top, one comes with sunny side up egg and the other one comes with a tomato.  Also comes with a little fruit salad.  It was yummy!! Definitely simple ingredients that I could have used at home to make it myself but on a lazy Sunday morning, totally worth going out for!! Coffee was just so-so.  Service excellent! Would recommend coming here, just get there early if possible.  Also heard the french toast is excellent.
author: AC C.

description: I wish we had found this place on our first day here. Incredible breakfast, spotlessly clean and excellent service!  The French toast with Caramelized Bananas was sweet and creamy and perfect. The waffle with mixed berries- delicious!  The waffle was crisp and a little chewy, and the fruit was fresh and flavorful. Thick cut bacon and strong, bold coffee completed an absolutely wonderful breakfast.
author: Dee A.

description: One of the absolute best breakfast places that I have been to. Big portions with fresh healthy ingredients. Great menu choices for a reasonable price. If you are       a tourist in  the Fishermans Wharf area about to start a long day of site seeing, this is the best place to fuel up.
author: Logan S.

description: Loved this place so much my 13 year old and I came back for our last breakfast before we left SF. Crepes are really good. My son had the 2pm and he even ate the strawberry sauce drizzled on it which he never does. Def my go to for breakfast when I'm in the Fisherman's Wharf area.
author: John G.

description: Very filling and delicious. Great customer service. Speedy and kept the coffee flowing. Would definitely come again.
author: Briana B.

description: Our kids really enjoyed the waffle with fruit and powder sugar and the frittatas were excellent. Crepes were great too. I particularly recommend the height ashbury frittata.   One of my frittatas was a little overdone but still had good flavor.  Fresh fruit bowl had a great visual presentation and offered a wide assortment of fruit.
author: Scott L.

description: Huge portions, super fresh yummy fruit, great potatoes and frittatas are lovely too
author: t p.

description: Wonderful food and large portions. Still in awe of having rice krispies on a banana Nutella bagel. Great stuff
author: Roshan P.

description: Surprised to find such a lovely cafe in the heart of tourist hell. Excellent brunch menu, huge fresh portions and the staff are incredibly nice and attentive.
author: Karl W.

description: Came here for breakfast, there was 4 of us.  Servers were all very nice, attentive.   Food was all good, we had one savory crepe, one berry,  banana pecan walnuts and avacado toast 3 ways...the waffles were the favorite.  Only issue waa kitchen and how the food came out,  one of us got our food,  3-4 min later the next, 3-4 the next and finally more than 10 min later the last of our party got our food.  So we were literally sitting there witb our food getting cold waiting.  Bummer
author: Maia L.

description: Was in town for business and decided to go here with some colleagues since it was close to our hotel. The food was amazing and fresh squeezed juice was perfect. I highly recommend going here if you are in the area.
author: Ryan J.

description: Great food and service. The portions and quality were amazing and the staff very attentive. Thick slices of bacon and a beautiful fruit bowl complimented the breakfast. A must for San Francisco visits.
author: Todd S.

description: In San Francisco for work and came here for breakfast every morning. The food is fresh and really good. Highly recommend this place.
author: Jeanette T.

description: Excellent food and great service. Extremely pricey. Paid 35 dollars for two plates of the Bagel Two Ways.. Guess that's San Fran for ya
author: Tim D.

description: I was visiting my brother for a week and ate out almost everyday. This place was so good that I craved the crepe days afterwards. The food was extremely fresh and tasty. Kudos to the chef! The servers were very friendly. I will definitely come back during my next visit!
author: Heather C.

description: Great food, great service.  Managed to please 3 very picky eaters.  My 5 year old had the berry French toast and it was amazing.  Definitely the table favorite.
author: Steve B.

description: Very good food. Generous portions. Great coffee. The fruit bowl was huge and very good. Love the Castro Frittata.
author: Ben H.

description: Wonderful people. Great breakfast. Very attentive. You couldn't go wrong eating here. BTW, they open at 7 am...name is confusing.
author: Timothy W.

description: Our family had breakfast here during our stay in town. The menu has a great variety and the service was excellent.  Our food came out quickly and the presentation was awesome!  Food was fresh and delicious!
author: Kevin W.

description: Went here because of other Yelp reviews. I was not disappointed bagel fix up two ways was great! Fresh fruit, good coffee. Prices comparable
author: Laura C.

description: Stopped here for breakfast our first day in San Francisco.  Service was great and can't say enough about food. Great taste and came okay nice and hot. I had one of the frittita which had excellent taste. It came with potatoesand fresh fruit. Great choice.  Will definitely be back
author: Rena F.

description: Best place to wake up after staying at the Holiday Inn across the street.  Food was wonderful and the fresh carrot juice was squeezed with experience. The Chef truly did justice to the Frittata and the Croque Madam.
author: Joe B.

description: I was a loyal customer of pergamino when I was in town.  I enjoyed the "homey" feeling when I visited, so I was a little disappointed to find out they were no longer in business.  I was somewhat hesitant to try this new place,  but what a pleasant surprise!!!!! This place is excellent!  Food is perfectly prepared, very creative.  Different flavors coming together perfectly.  Great service, very friendly staff.  As a family, we shared a 3 way toast,  nob hill fritada and  waffle with berries.  The fruit and veggies are so fresh.  The waffles with their homemade syrup, so delicious.  Great location, right by the wharf.  I will most definitely return when I am back in town.
author: Diana P.

description: Quick and friendly service. Eggs and bacon plate provided a healthy portion and the potatoes were AWESOME. 5 stars
author: Chris R.

description: Such an amazing breakfast. A nice small place away from the crowds. The servers were so nice and the chef came out to make sure everything was perfect. We had French toast with caramelized bananas, bacon, sugar waffle, and a fruit bowl. Everything was perfect. The bacon was some of the best I have ever had and the fruit was so fresh. The perfect place for breakfast!
author: Jason S.

description: If you come to San Francisco you must stop here. The best breakfasts ever. To drink I recommend the Hot chocolate and natural orange juice and to eat the avocado toasts and the fresh fruits partfait.
author: Lucas A.

description: Really enjoyed our breakfast here when visiting San Francisco!  The restaurant was clean with great food and great service!  The menu items all looked delicious and it was hard to choose between the crepes, frittatas or the avocado toast 3-way which is what I ended up getting - yum.  We also got a frittata that was also delicious. A generous cup of fresh fruit accompanied each of our breakfasts. Would definitely return!
author: Michelle H.

description: Fantastic experience! The staff was extremely friendly, the place was clean and the food was DELICIOUS. I'm a bit of a waffle snob and this place nailed it. Fresh ingredients and very tasty. Just steps away from Fisherman's Wharf, it's in a great location but just up the hill enough (and I mean a two minute walk) to avoid the masses.
author: Andrew Z.

description: Clean, friendly, delicious! The waffle with berries and whipped cream was great. My mom got avocado toast 3 ways and it looked epic. The other three meals were served with a big bowl of fresh fruit and the menu is really creative. Must try!
author: Heidi B.

description: This is a great restaurant! The young waiter and waitress are extremely professional and attentive to the needs of the customers. The chefs deliver the meal in a timely manner. Food was delicious and prepared to perfection! I would recommend this place anytime!
author: Jose F.

description:
Perfect breakfast, brunch, lunch spot!  Everything is made fresh from fresh, in season ingredients.  Portions are big....
We shall return!!
author: Mike K.

description: Stopped in for brunch, our first San Francisco dining experience. I had the avocado toast three ways (delicious). Everything was so fresh and tasty, and the giys working were friendly and took care of us.
author: Lauren T.

description: Great place! I love the generous size of the fruit salad that came with the breakfast plates. Lots of love in the food. Great service and patient staff. Oh, and the cute-looking staff is another reason why this is a great place to enjoy your breakfasts at any time of the day.
author: Kuang-Lei T.

description: Quality food and pleasant sides of fresh fruit. A good option for breakfast in this part of the city.
author: Chaleb C.

description: Wonderful, and a real emphasis on fruit, very fresh. Service   Must be noted, very attentive and friendly. Excellent!!
author: Eric B.

description: I ate here a second day and was very disappointed. Although the service was still super friendly, I had the French toast which was awful- two pieces of burnt toast. When I left, I was still hungry.
author: N R.

description: We just left this place after breakfast  and i saw roaches crawling  by the coffee cups ,nasty ,never again. Dirty place.i do not recommend it to anyone
author: VeniceandJulian P.

description: Amazing! I had eggs, bacon, potatoes and fruit. It was quite tasty and the coffee was also good. My wife had two bagel fix-ups which she raved about. Kids also liked their selections! Will definitely go back next time we're in the city for breakfast.
author: Paul A.

description: Chose this place for breakfast bc of the good reviews and its proximity to our hotel.  It is a small place and they were very busy, ( 10:30 am on a Friday during spring break )so we waited a fair amount of time both to be seated and to be served. The two young friendly waiters were doing their best to keep everyone happy.  The food was delicious and beautifully presented.  I had a crepe which was filled with berries and my daughter had one filled with Nutella and strawberries ( because they had run out of fresh bananas , but she preferred the strawberries in any case). My husband had the pacific heights frittata which came with potatoes and a bowl of fresh fruit. Definitely recommend this place , just be sure to go you're not in a hurry and  can enjoy the experience.
author: Annette L.

description: Wish I had taken pics. This place was amazing. My husband and I shared a frittata and the avocado toast. Both were delicious. I also had hot chocolate which was great. My daughter and her friend shared the avocado toast and the banana chocolate crepes. They said the crepes were the best breakfast they've ever had. The fruit was so fresh. We will def be back when we return to SF.
author: Dee M.

description: Came to eight Am with my wife and 4 year old daughter after seeing all the great reviews. I must say this was probably one of the best breakfast eateries I have been to (and I've been to a lot while traveling). It's clean, its charming, and above all it is absolutely delicious. The portions are huge and the price point is well below what you will get anywhere else for the quality. I actually felt guilty only paying $13 for a meal that could provide leftovers for lunch ( I choose to stuff myself to the brim though because it was so delicious). Eight am is definitely a must, not just for the food but the environment and the great personable service!
author: Nicholas S.

description: Delicious homemade syrup on light waffles and a wonderful trio of avocado toasts. Excellent service.  Would definitely return.
author: Andrea D.

description: Hidden tiny gem. Fresh food and good service. I'd stay off the porch if you aren't used to the San Fran chill. Great wall art by Turtle Wayne and a family owned atmosphere. Delicious and healthy comfort breakfast. I'd be here often if I lived in the area.
author: William O.

description: Excellent food and service! Came here 3 days in a row while in town for work. The avocado toast and bagel fix-ups were delicious, as were the fresh juices and great coffee drinks. Everything was fresh and tasted great--my only regret is that I didn't have more time to come back and try their crepes!
author: Matt B.

description: Good was ok, but surely not at the level of Hollywood cafe a couple of blocks away. Service polite but slow. Will give it a second shot.
author: C S.

description: My wife and I were in San Francisco on business and stopped here for breakfast.  What a wonderful find!  She had the parfait the first visit and said with chocolate on top, it would've been better than a hot fudge sundae!  I tried the avocado toast the first visit...L.very good and really filling.  Our second visit (the next day) we had the frittata which could easily feed two.  Both were very good and quite filling.  I would recommend this restaurant to anyone wanting a healthy filling breakfast or lunch.
author: Walt M.

description: This is a great spot for breakfast.  Walking distance from Marriott- Fishermans Wharf where we stay frequently.  We ate here in early May and it was delicious.  Good size portions and moderately priced. The Avacado toast (3 different type) was the highlight of the the 4 different things we tried.  The fruit bowl that comes with some meals is really nice.  The Crepes were just ok- too crispy and not worth getting again.  The usual type of scrambled egg dish my husband gets was very good as well. It is a small place with a little bit of outside seating.  Make note there is a pm menu and you can't order those items for breakfast- my son had his eye on something on that part of the menu and thought pm just referred to items for lunch but you could get all day- not the case.  Not sure when am menu ends and pm menu starts as it is only open till 2pm.
author: J D.

description: This place does everything well.  The service. The food.  You will probably have to wait but it is worth it. The staff is very efficient and polite.  The food is delicious. We had the Pacific Heights Fritatta, Nutella crepes and Avocado Toast 3 Ways.  All perfect.  Enjoy!
author: Kim A.

description: Russian Hill with bacon so good, but 12pm crepe was even better! Lots of food for a good price!
author: Heidi P.

description: This place is not kid friendly. They won't customize a meal for a child because they "don't know how to charge for that." Lame excuse, in my opinion. They also brought my 4 year old's juice in a glass cup, without a lid. Really?!?!
author: Martha S.

description: A real find in an unlikely place! I'm a neighbor and loved the huge, healthful, inexpensive menu. I've been back many times and each time the crowd is bigger. So glad this family-run place is thriving.
author: Patricia F.

description: Good spot for breakfast. Very friendly service and the food is prepared with love, you can see and tast it.
author: Jennifer L.

description: One of the most amazing breakfasts that we have had recently.  Everything was delicious.  The Avocado toast and the 1pm crepe were over the top good!
author: Matthew K.

description: This cafe completely exceeded my expectations. From quality of food to cleanliness to incredible service, this is THE breakfast cafe to visit in the Wharf area. First, the orange juice is fresh squeezed and delicious, the crepes are cooked perfectly with a variety of sweet and savory options, we ended up going with a crepe with peanut butter and bananas which was a delight! we also had to try the Avocado toast three ways, the freshest and tastiest tomato I have had in a while with crispy bacon and a tasteful fruit bowl to top it all off. The gentleman who served us was polite and courteous and you could tell he took pride in making sure you had a good experience. The ambiance is also a treat, all of the paintings and artwork on the walls are for sale by seemingly local artists which we loved. I would absolutely recommend this place to anyone looking for an enjoyable, fairly priced cafe experience, keep up the great work!!
author: Jon F.

description: This place was much better than I anticipated. I got the avocado toast three ways with the fruit bowl and split a crepe. The avocado toast was great and the fruit was very fresh and ripe. The crepe was thin and fluffy, the fruit was also very fresh. Our meals came out hot and fresh. The orange juice was freshly squeezed, but it was six dollars for just a small glass, which seemed a bit pricey to me. The waiters were extremely friendly and attentive. I especially like the view of the kitchen from the table we sat at, it looked spotless.
author: Erica B.

description: Light fluffy omelets with a really great fruit bowl included.  Attentive friendly service. I'd go back.
author: Steve S.

description: Didn't actually get to eat here but will definitely try it when I come back. We only had 30 minutes to eat and the manager kindly referred us to Joanie breakfast next door! Thanks
author: James L.

description: The frittatas are the bomb. My wife had the parfait and she raved about it. The service is top shelf.
author: Jeff G.

description: Super kind staff and chef, he personally served his food to us! The quality of the food itself is top notch, with a succinct yet deep menu that will fulfill any brunch go-er's burning desires.
author: Naval H.

description: Great breakfast spot.  I had the Avocado three way and it was delicious!  Service was fast and accurate and the coffee was excellent.  Don't miss this place if you are hungry for breakfast.
author: Michael R.

description: My daughter and I had breakfast here this morning. It is very clean and nicely appointed. I had the fruit waffle and a side of bacon. My daughter the banana waffle. They were excellent!  Kevin, our waiter, was awesome. I would come back in a heart beat!
author: Michele C.

description: The service was quick and food presentation was good. The taste was missing. French toast was dry and the savory crepes seriously lacked seasoning.
author: Ravi J.

description: So glad I discovered this place! The crab frittata is ALL CRAB- delicious! It's definitely in tourist central, but nice outside tables. Good service. Will be back!
author: Maggie Z.

description: This place was an absolute pleasure to experience. The freshly squeezed juices alone are worth the visit. The food is of very high quality and the prices aren't too bad. The staff was an absolute pleasure to meet, and they were kind and polite in every step of the experience. This place is worth the stop if you are in the area.
author: Saif Z.

description: Amazing!! Food delish, presentation beautiful. Freshest fruit. Must try the avocado toast three ways. You won't be sorry.
author: Elizabeth P.

description: The waffles, frittatas, and fresh fruit were really good. The fruit was ripe and ready to eat.
author: Orlando F.

description:
great options at decent prices, seated and served quickly. fun spot for a weekend brunch or breakfast date. 

what to get: 
Avocado trio
fruit cup + 2 bagel half combo
latte
author: Nicholas B.

description: Everything here is wonderful!!  Very fresh, huge portions and delish!  You will not be disappointed!!
author: Michelle M.

description: My son and I were visiting San Francisco and we had breakfast here before we did the Alcatraz tour. The food was excellent! I had the raspberry croissant and it was beyond delicious! My son had the waffle and he said it was one of the best waffles he's ever had. I will definitely go back to Eight AM next time I'm visiting the city.
author: Citty B.

description: Outside looks like a regular cafe but the inside is nicer. Our waiter was extremely attentive and brought more coffee several times. The chef came out and asked how the food was and took our plates back. Very good coffee, great prices and close to Fisherman's Wharf! Also the fruit bowl side was massive and very fresh with a fantastic variety!
author: Paul R.

description: I would highly recommend this place. They have a great variety of items on the menu, service was excellent, and the food was very good. The fruit was the perfect ripeness for each type of fruit.
author: Michael C.

description: This place really deserves 5 stars. I've been here several times and the food is always great. I've never had a bad experience here. Their service is also amazing every time, even if it's busy. I also love that the fruit bowl is always fresh and sweet and they give a generous portion.
author: Christina E.

description: Great service! Breakfast menu had so many delights that it was hard to choose between a savory and sweet option: the omelette or the crepe. When the food arrived, the fruit was actually appetizing, seasonal and tasted  as good as it looks.
author: Sally S.

description: Fantastic breakfast.  Had the bagel 2 ways and others had the crepes and banana French toast.  The fruit, as others say, is fresh and plentiful.  The coffee is good and strong and the service fast and very polite.
author: Claudia G.

description: This is an excellent place for breakfast in the wharf. Their menu has a great balance of trendy items (avocado toast, chia seed pudding) and more traditional choices (frittatas, bacon & eggs, waffles). The service was friendly, attentive, and quick. Probably the best I've had in San Francisco. Why wait in a long line when you could come here and have a peaceful dining experience?
author: Shaun E.

description: Why does this place have 5 stars and yet many average reviews, LOL! Anyways eggs were ok nothing amazing just average pretty much.
author: James B.

description: Great brunch spot just a little off the touristy area. Sat down right away on a Saturday morning. Friendly service, good portions, great food!
author: Scott D.

description: Quick, friendly, clean, but best of all... My toddler ate the waffle AND the eggs! The fruit was fresh and delicious and his milk came in a to-go cup with a straw so he didn't spill. The waffle was crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, made to perfection. Can't wait to come back and eat breakfast again!
author: Michelle A.

description: Loved the Haight Ashbury Fritatta! Soooo good! The Fried eggs on toast with avacado was amazing! Both came with a generous fruit cup! Highly recommended!
author: James R.

description: Amazing Service and Incredible food!  Great place for breakfast.  Menu is solid and frittatas are delicious.  Crepes are excellent and better than the gimmicky place on the pier.  My wife was so happy with the food and service we are going back tomorrow!
author: Ryan A.

description: OUTSTANDING breakfast and some of the friendliest staff you will ever meet.  Our waiter always had a smile and the chef routinely came out to make sure guests were enjoying their meals.  We came here two days in a row because it was so good.  We highly recommend the Nutella Crepes, parfaits, and fresh fruit! If we had one of these in Michigan we would come every weekend.  It's the type of place you want to succeed!
author: Brett B.

description: The food here is so fresh and delicious... And the service is great! The fresh fruit bowl is amazing... Not like the fruit you get at other breakfast places. I had the avocado toast and my mom had a frittata with asparagus and tomato, both were delicious! The staff was so friendly and helpful, constantly asking if we needed anything and so attentive. I can't say enough great things about this place!!!
author: Amanda H.

description: Great place. Brought my mother and sister here on a whim and was pleased with the overall quality, presentation and price. Will definitely return.
author: Derek N.

description: Great breakfast ,beautiful bowls of fresh fruit great service !! We really enjoyed our meals my wife had the haight ashbury and my daughter and I had the bagel fix ups . I think we will be going again this am :)
author: Brent H.

description: I love this place!  Fun plating and delicious food.  The staff was so so nice, and the syrup was the best I've ever had.  I'll definitely be back!
author: Alex N.

description: Excellent service, delicious food, and comfortable atmosphere. The coffee is phenomenal and flows freely. Highly recommended!
author: Jeffrey R.

description: While searching for a breakfast place near Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco, my husband asked a hotel doorman for a recommendation. He suggested Eight AM and we set off in search of breakfast. After checking with the inside staff, we seated ourselves at the outside tables that have a nice view of Joseph Conrad Park. After perusing the large breakfast menu, I decided on the Avocado Toast three ways with the side of fruit and my husband got the Crepes Suzette with a side of sausage. After hearing my concern over runny fried eggs, the server said I could have the toast with scrambled eggs. Our coffee was hot, fresh and delicious and breakfast was served about midway through our second cup. The Avocado Toast done three ways was amazing. The mashed avocado was spread atop three generous-size baguette slices and then topped with bacon, scrambled eggs and an heirloom tomato slice, respectively.  The fruit bowl that accompanied it was a nice surprise - small chunks of honey melon, cantaloupe, blueberries, blackberries, strawberries and kiwi. My husband's Crepe Suzette was flavorful and he quickly devoured it and the sausage. He also had to help me finish my toast and ate most of the toast topped with tomato because I was so full. The breakfast was reasonably priced. The service was really good and the servers were very nice. I would suggest this restaurant who enjoys delicious food with a twist.
author: Sherri K.

description: Awesome FRESH food, flavor full.  Service is simple yet prompt and waiting is worth every second / minute.  Highly Recommended.
author: Vim P.
